loans.name: Lilliam María

texts.es:
La señora Lilliam María L. A., se desempeña como docente en la escuela  Jesús de Nazareth en el turno de la tarde, es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con sus familiares.

La señora L.  A. utilizo el crédito para ayudar con gastos de la casa a sus padres, es primer crédito que obtiene con ceprodel.
texts.en:
Lilliam works in the evenings as a teacher in the Jesús de Nazareth School. She is single and has no children. She used the money from this loan to assist her parents with their household expenses. This is her first loan through Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Household expenses

loans.name: C3534 Ubwuzuzanye Group

texts.en:
Sada is 31 years old and is married with three children who are 2, 7 and 10 years old. She also takes care of one child who is 13 years old. Sada is the president of a group called Ubwuzuzanye and this group is well known in the business of selling women’s clothes. The hours of their business are from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Sada and her team are now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their business through adding the new business of selling men’s clothes such as jeans, shirts, etc. In addition, they will also start selling children’s clothes.

As the majority of the members of this group do not have their own houses, they hope that with the use of this loan, they will earn more profits, which in turn will allow them to individually achieve their goals.

loans.use: To add the selling of men's and children's clothes

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Mrs. Theary M. is a villager in Chek village in Kandal province and she was born in 1972. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to sell for supporting herself and her family.

In the rice field, Mrs. Theary M. now faces some problems because her field has infertile soil and it is far from the irrigation system. Thus, in order to improve her production of rice, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline for her water pump.

Mrs. Theary M. is single and lives in a household of five members.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Kek

texts.en:
Mr. Kek T., 27, is the father of a lovely, young child who is not yet enrolled in school and who is dependent on him. He is married to Thai Lek, 29, who works as a seamstress in the garment industry.  

Kek T. is a local farmer who plants rice and vegetables on the land that he received from his parents. Kek T. lacks some accessories that he needs to support him in his farming. Thus, he is applying for a Kiva loan of $800 to buy insecticide, fertilizer, crop seeds and a pump for his farm. 

Note: Mr. Kek T. was not available when the photo taken so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy insecticide, fertilizer, crop seeds and a pump

loans.name: Mamatmurod

texts.ru: Лакаев Маматмурод проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 51 год. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Более 8 лет занимается растениеводством. Он в основном сеет пшеницу. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений..
texts.en:
Mamatmurod L. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 51 years old, married and has 6 children. He has a secondary education. Mamatmurod has been involved in agriculture for over 8 years. He primarily grows wheat. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda O. is from the village of Christine, District 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 38 years old, is married, and has four infant children. Luzviminda owns and operates a computer games business, managing computer games in the local community every weekend (Saturday and Sunday) and when there's no classes. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In addition, she wants to reopen her general store when she receives the loan. In 2007, Luzviminda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. Luzviminda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: labour et achat d’engrais

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh T. K. D. was born in 1975. She lives in Khu5 village and is married with one child. Her husband is a carpenter.  

Anh T. K. D. has a small shop which makes wood items such as doors and furniture including beds and tables.  The family monthly income is about 5,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). This is the first time she is participating with Kiva partner SEDA. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to expand her shop.

loans.use: To expand her shop.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Valle Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Mujeres del Valle esta compuesto por 5 personas empresariales del pueblo de Santa Maria en Jamastran, El Paraíso. Los integrantes del grupo son la Sra. Leyla del Carmen M. C., la Sra. Neybi Sofia R. O., la Sra. Julia Amparo O., la Sra. Yolanda Maribel M. V. y el Sr. Félix O. M..

 A continuación se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan diariamente para generar ingresos monetarios:

 La Señora Leyla del Carmen M. C. es madre de tres hijos y reside con su compañero de hogar, el señor Josué Herrera, en Santa Maria de Jamastran, El Paraiso. 

Leyla es una vendedora ambulante que vende cosméticos en su comunidad. Algunos de los productos que Leyla tiene a la venta son: Cremas para el cuerpo, cremas faciales, desodorantes, lociones, shampoo, acondicionador y brillos labiales. Leyla lleva varios años vendiendo a sus clientes de la comunidad creando una red leal de consumidores muy felices con su nivel de atención. El negocio de Leyla ayuda a pagar los gastos de la casa y la educación académica de sus tres hijos. 

Leyla utilizara el préstamo para surtir su inventario con los productos mas populares, como ser lociones, desodorantes y brillos labiales al igual que para la compra de nuevos productos, como peines, lápiz labial y sombras. Con las ganancias del negocio, Leyla cubrirá los costos académicos de sus hijos al igual que mejorar su nivel de vida.

 La Sra. Neybi Sofia R. O. es compañera de hogar del señor Sebastián M. con quien tiene 4 hijos. Sebastián emigro a los Estados Unidos en busca de una mejor vida y le manda remesas a Neybi todos los meses para ayudar con los gastos familiares. 

Neybi vende productos de uso personal como ser brillos labiales, talcos, shampoo, acondicionador, cremas corporales y cremas faciales. Neybi lleva a cabo la mayoría de sus ventas de manera ambulante en la aldea de Santa Maria, Jamastran. Con las ganancias del negocio, Neybi ha podido sacar adelante a su familia proveyéndoles una educación para un futuro mejor. Neybi utilizara el préstamo para comprar mas productos y así poder incrementar la variedad que ofrece a sus clientes para mejores ventas.

 La Sra. Julia Amparo O. tiene cuatro hijos y esta casada con el Señor José Rodríguez. Julia y Jose residen en la aldea de Santa Maria en Jamastran, El Paraiso. Jose es un agricultor que siembra maíz y frijoles todos los años. Julia lleva varios años preparando comida desde su propia casa después que el comedor vecino dejo de operar y los clientes le pidieron a ella si podía cocinarles. La mayoría de la clientela de Julia es de la Policía Nacional dentro de su aldea y del Chichicaste. Con este préstamo, Julia pagara la instalación de una caseta en frente de su casa para vender comida rápida y golosinas. Julia utilizara las ganancias de su negocio para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

 La Sra. Yolanda Maribel M. V. tiene 3 hijos y esta casada con el Señor Walter Ardon con quien reside en la aldea de Santa Maria en Jamastran, El Paraiso. Yolanda se dedica a la venta de pan y golosinas desde hace varios años de forma ambulante. Cuando hay juegos de fútbol en su aldea, Yolanda prepara su canasta de pan y golosinas para caminar al estadio y vender comida a los espectadores. Durante la semana, Yolanda se dedica a hornear pan para venderlo a las pulperías de la aldea. 

Yolanda utilizara el préstamo para cubrir los gastos de la compra de huevos, harina de trigo, aceite, manteca, margarina, azúcar, levadura, carne de res, repollo, tomate, cebolla, harina de maíz y frijoles. Las ganancias del negocio ayudaran a Yolanda y su esposo para apoyar a sus hijos en que continúen con sus estudios escolares.

 El Sr. Félix O. M. se dedica a la sastrería en su pueblo de Santa Maria en Jamastran, El Paraiso. Félix no tiene hijos pero ayuda a una sobrina que depende de el. Félix se dedica a la confección de pantalones de hombre y trajes de mujeres desde hace varios años. A pesar de que Félix reside en Santa Maria tiene muchos clientes que viajan desde comunidades cercanas por sus servicios ya que la calidad de su trabajo es bien conocida. Félix utilizara el préstamo para comprar más telas y accesorios de sastrería. Con las ganancias de su negocio, Félix podrá mejorar su nivel de vida y cubrir los gastos de vivienda con su sobrina.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres del Valle" ["Women of the Valley"] is made up of 5 enterprising people, from the village of Santa Maria in Jamastran, El Paraíso. The members of the group are Leyla del Carmen M. C., Neybi Sofia R. O., Julia Amparo O., Yolanda Maribel M. V. and Félix O. M.. The following sections describe the diverse activities they carry out each day to earn their income: Leyla del Carmen M. C. is the mother of three children and resides with her live-in partner, Josué Herrera, in Santa Maria de Jamastran, El Paraiso. Leyla is a traveling salesperson who sells cosmetics in her community. The products she sells include body and facial creams, deodorants, lotions, shampoo, conditioners and lip gloss. Leyla has sold these products to her customers in the community for several years, building up a loyal network of customers who are very happy with her level of service. Leyla's business helps her pay the household expenses and the educational fees for her three children. Leyla will use the loan to expand her inventory with the most popular products, such as lotions, deodorants and lip gloss, as well as buying some new products, such as combs, lipstick and eye shadow. With the earnings from her business, Leyla will cover the academic costs for her children and improve her family's quality of life. Neybi Sofia R. O. is the common-law wife of Sebastián M., with whom she has 4 children. Sebastián emigrated to the United States in search of a better life, and he sends funds to Neybi every month to help with the household expenses. Neybi sells personal care products such as lip gloss, powders, shampoo, conditioner, and body and facial creams. Neybi makes most of her sales as a traveling salesperson in the municipality of Santa Maria, Jamastran. With the earnings from her business, Neybi has been able to help her family get ahead, providing her children with an education so they can have a better future. Neybi will use the loan to buy more products and thus increase the variety she offers to her customers, so she can improve her sales. Julia Amparo O. has four children and is married to José Rodríguez. Julia and Jose live in the municipality of Santa Maria in Jamastran, El Paraiso. Jose is a farmer who plants corn and beans every year. For several years, Julia has worked preparing food in her own house, after the small restaurant next door closed down, and the customers asked her if she could cook for them. Most of Julia's customers are members of the National Police from her municipality and from Chichicaste. With this loan, Julia will pay for the installation of a stand in front of her house from which she will sell fast food and snacks. Julia will use the earnings from her business to improve her family's quality of life. Yolanda Maribel M. V. has 3 children and is married to Walter Ardon, with whom she lives in the municipality of Santa Maria, in Jamastran, El Paraiso. Yolanda has worked for several years selling bread and snacks as a mobile vendor. When there are soccer games in her town, Yolanda prepares her basket of bread and snacks and walks to the stadium, where she sells food to the spectators. During the week, Yolanda works baking bread to sell in the corner stores in her town. Yolanda will use the loan to cover the expenses of buying eggs, flour, oil, shortening, margarine, sugar, yeast, beef, cabbage, tomatoes, onion, corn flour and beans. The earnings from her business will help Yolanda and her husband support their children, so they can continue with their studies. Félix O. M. works as a tailor in his village of Santa Maria in Jamastran, El Paraiso. Félix has no children, but he helps a niece who depends on him. Félix has made men's pants and women's suits for many years. Although Félix lives in Santa Maria, he has many customers who travel from nearby communities for his services, because the quality of his work is well known. Félix will use the loan to buy more fabrics and accessories for tailoring. With the earnings from his business, Félix will be able to improve his standard of living and cover his niece's housing expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying more products to expand her inventory

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley A., age 41, and her husband, Thomas A., a farmer and driver, age 41, are working to put their four children through high school and college.  They live in Silang, Cavite.

Shirley has been running a decorative flower and plant store as well as a Jeepney and tricycle operation business for the past five years, and hopes that the PHP 12,200 generated from these endeavors each month will continue to support her family.

Shirley has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT)* since 2006 and is on her eighth loan.  Shirley is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to buy more stock for her flower business and to help out with costs that arise through her Jeepney and tricycle business.  

Shirley is currently looking for a PHP 10,000 loan to help pay for additional fertilizer for her plant farm, which was damaged in a recent typhoon, and to help cover registration fees for the Jeepney and tricycle.  Shirley hopes that the additional capital will help her fully recover from the typhoon and allow her to begin expanding her flower selling business.  She hopes for a stable, happy, and peaceful life for her and her family.   

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: Registration fees for their own jeepney and fertilizers for their flower farm

loans.name: Sulton

texts.en: The agriculture business is one that requires much effort for the simple reasons that it requires sun exposure, the physical exertion of moving animals from one place to another, as well as the work it takes to tend to various crops. Sulton, has dedicated himself for already ten years to cattle raising which supports his humble family who so rely on him. Currently, Sulton has turned to IMON International for a loan of 5,600 Somoni to purchase calves that he can raise. It’s important to note that the granting of this loan will not only benefit him, but also his children and wife whom he loves greatly. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma belongs to a small city called Raiwind which is famous for its dairy and agriculture industries. She is 29 years old and married. She has given birth to four-year-old Adiba and one-year-old Mariam, both of whom are very young and have not started to attend school yet. 

Najma is a very hardworking and caring lady. She takes care of her family and manages the household chores. She also handles her clothes sewing business after doing the household chores. She sews clothes for her neighbors. She is good at her work and gets regular orders. She does this work to financially support her family. 

She is married to A. R., who is 34 years old and operates a laundry business in the market. He is renting a shop for that purpose. He has been operating this business for the last ten years. He also sells washing items such as bleach powder, Surf detergents and washing soaps in his shop and also uses them to wash the clothes in his laundry.
 
Naima has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan money her husband will buy the above mentioned laundry items for his laundry shop. Najma has confidence in her husband that he will be able to successfully upgrade his business by making positive use of the loan money. 
She is a regular Asasah loan user and has maintained a good credit record. This is her 4th loan application.

loans.use: Purchase washing items for laundry shop

loans.name: Ma. Esperanza

texts.en:
Ma. Esperanza J. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 45 years old and has four adult-aged children. Ma. Esperanza is separated from her spouse. To make a living, Ma. Esperanza makes & sells food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling dried fish and homemade sausage, or "longganiza," in the local community. Ma. Esperanza has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ma. Esperanza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Esperanza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Ma. Esperanza is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ma. Esperanza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Tumuka Ole

texts.en:
Tumuka Ole N. is 41 years old. He is married to Kisieku N., and has five school-going children.  He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

Tumuka is a farmer.  For the past seven years he has been farming on his own piece of land.  He learned about KADET through a friend, who is also a registered client of KADET in his area. This will be his second loan from KADET.  He is planning to spend twenty thousand to buy fertilizer and chemicals for his ten-acre wheat farm, and the remaining ten thousand on spraying the wheat.  He intends to buy some farm machinery with the anticipated profit from his expanded farming activity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chemicals for his wheat farm, and to spray the wheat

loans.name: Jerry Jose

texts.es:
Jerry de 38 años, es albañil constructor, vive en Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas).

Desde pequeño el papa le enseño a ser albañil, cuando creció y se dio cuenta que necesitaba dinero para solventa sus gastos inicio la profesión de albañil trabajando independientemente y por contratos a podido mantener a su esposa y tres hijos de 9, 5 y 6 años de edad. Hace todo tipo de construcción de casas, readecuaciones etc.

Ahora necesita comprar con el préstamo zinc, ladrillos y arena para poder construir una casa y tener dinero para los estudios de sus hijos. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa ya que en el invierno se llena de agua las calles.
texts.en:
Jerry is 38 years old and works as a construction mason.  He lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban zone named “Orquídeas,” meaning orchids, because there were many orchids growing there when the area was discovered).

His father taught him to be a mason when he was a boy.  When he grew up and realized that he needed money to pay his expenses, he began working as a mason, both independently and under contract, so that he could support his wife and three children, ages nine, five, and six.  He does all kinds of construction of homes, remodeling, etc.

Now he needs a loan to buy zinc metal sheeting, bricks, and sand so that he can build a house and be able to pay for his children’s education.  In the future he would like to finish his own house because the streets flood in the winter.

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
This is forty-six-year-old Foday F.. Born in Binkolo village, this husband and father of five children is a small-scale businessman in Makeni city. His wife is a businesswoman, too, and his children are all attending primary and secondary schools. 

Foday wants a loan of SLL 3,000,000 to invest in his business. He sells used clothes. He has been in this business for twenty-five years now. However, his business has been growing at a very slow pace due to the lack of sufficient capital. Thus he has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan in order to expand his business. With this loan, he will buy bales of used clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.use: Buy bales of used clothes for resale

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael, a 38-year-old businessman, operates "Mukulima shop", a retail shop in Nairobi. In his shop, Michael sells products like maize and wheat flour, sugar, soap, and cooking oil among other household products. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy maize and wheat flour, sugar, soap, and cooking oil among other products. Michael is also a mechanic. He is married and a father of three. He describes himself as hardworking and visionary and hopes to be financially independent in the future.

loans.use: To buy maize and wheat flour, sugar, soap, and cooking oil among other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of food products for restaurant activity

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius K. is 46 years old and married to Rose Njeri, who also contributes to the family income. They have four children. He has been growing crops for nine years, and earns an income of 3,800 per  month. 

Julius is taking his fourth loan with KADET with which he plans to buy fertilizer and pesticide. He hopes to expand his farming activity to increase profits and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Amparo Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Amparo de 36 años, habitante del Municipio del Coral Chontales, su familia esta conformada por su esposotrabaja en la Alcaldia Municipal el Coral obteniendo un salario mensual el cual le permite colaborar en los gastos del hogar  y 1 hija mayor de edad la cual colabora en los quehaceres de su pulperia, la Sra. Amparo desde hace 10 años tiene establecida su pequeña Pulperia la cual le genera ingresos diarios de donde abastece el sustento de la Familia. 

Necesita este financiamiento para ampliar la venta de productos y poder sastifacer la demanda de sus clientes permitiendole mejorar las fuentes de ingreso a nivel familiar; ella cuenta con exelentes recomendaciones por ser una persona responsable, amable y con muchos deseos de superacion.  

Su mayor sueño es que no les falte el pan de cada dia y ampliar su Negocio.
texts.en:
Amparo is 36 years old and lives in the municipality of Coral Chontales.  Her husband works in the Coral Chontales town hall. He contributes his monthly salary to the household expenses. She also has an adult daughter who contributes what she earns working in her general store.  Amparo’s small general store, which she established 10 years ago, generates a daily income that provides the family’s daily sustenance.

She needs this loan to increase the sale of products and be able to satisfy customer demand which will allow her to improve her household income. She has excellent recommendations for being a responsible, kind person who has a strong desire to succeed.  Her greatest dreams are to make sure that her family does lack daily bread and to expand her business.

loans.use: To supply her general store with products.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua B. is divorced and has nine dependents. Ekua makes palm oil in Abura for sale. Ekua wants to produce in larger quantities, so she is asking to use the loan to purchase additional palm fruits to process for resale. The income she makes is used to provide for the basic needs of the family. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional palm fruits to process for resale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is married and the father of two children who are 3 and 6 years old. His older child attends school while he works as a farmer and sells his goods in a local market. Peter has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kes from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a cow and expand his poultry business. The extra income he earns from this loan will help him expand his farm and improve his family's living standards. He is determined to increase the size of his poultry flock for the next five years.

loans.use: To buy a cow and more poultry.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna E. is from the village of Sta. Ines, Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old. Lorna is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling hot dogs & sausage kebabs in the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Etanislada Norma

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la comarca el jicarito, soltera con 2 hijos los que estudian en el colegio de la localidad, actualmente está trabajando como maestro en el colegio sara maría parrales del poblado de san Jacinto, del cual tiene 26 años de desempeñar dicha labor, este cliente es el segundo crédito que obtiene con la empresa, lo ha efectuado atraves del convenio de financiamiento con dicho colegio, ya que dichos créditos le han ayudado a mejorar las condiciones y el nivel de vida.
texts.en: She is originally from the community of Jicarito. She is single and she has 2 children who are in school in the community. She works as a teacher in the Sara Maria Parrales school in the community of San Jancinto. She has 26 years in the business and it is the second loan she has accessed through the organization. She has accessed them through Convenio at the school. These loans have helped her improve her living conditions and their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Margina Lissette

texts.es:
Margina es una joven soltera, que habita junto a sus padres, en donde juntos han venido mejorando su vivienda.
Hoy en día labora en un banco de la capital, teniendo tres años estables en su puesto, lo que está contenta por tener la bendición de su trabajo. 
Afodenic ha dado el beneficio de poder hacer las mejora de infraestructura mediantes los financiamientos, en donde han avanzado mucho, siendo su cuarto ciclo, en donde comprara materiales para enverjar su ventana y su puerta ya que están inseguras. En donde comprara materiales de soldadura,  varillas entorchadas, platina,  tubos, pintura para pintar, cener, entre otros. Para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Margina is a young, single woman who lives with her parents.  Together they have been working to improve their home.

Margina works in a bank in the capital.  She has been in her post for three years and is happy to be blessed with having work.  Afodenic has helped Margina to improve the infrastructure of her home through their loans.  She has made a lot of progress and is on her fourth loan cycle.  She will buy materials to put grilles up at her windows and door as they are not safe.  She will buy welding materials, bars, disks, pipes, paint, etc. in order to start the job.

loans.use: to buy welding materials to make grilles for her windows and door

loans.name: María Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sequita se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, su gente es muy trabajadora, dedicada a sus familias y muy orgullosa de sus raíces.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 24 años de edad,  está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene un niño de dos años de edad. Su esposo es ebanista y ella realiza los créditos para el negocio de él.

Su esposo tiene un taller de ebanistería  en su casa donde realizan muchos trabajos a base de madera como muebles, sillas, puertas, camas, ventana, etc. Trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00. Realiza trabajos para personas que llegan hasta su establecimiento y también entrega en Manta y Portoviejo en algunos almacenes. La madera la compra en un aserradero en Manta.

Este crédito lo van a emplear para comprar madera, pintura, selladores, clavos, pega y otros materiales para la elaboración de sus obras. Esta en el Banco Comunal hace ya siete años y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que ofrece la institución.
 
Sus sueños son tener su casa bien acabada y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
The “La Sequita” communal bank meets in La Sequita Paris which belongs to Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manta.  Its residents are very hard working, dedicated to their families and very proud of their roots.

We found Maria, 24, in this place.  She’s married and has a two-year-old son.  Her husband’s a cabinet maker and she takes out the loans for his business.

Her husband has a cabinet making shop at home where they do all kinds of jobs based on wood like: furniture, chairs, doors, beds, windows, etc.  She works Monday through Saturday from 8am until 5pm.  Work is done for people who come by the establishment and also items are delivered to stores in Manta and Portoviejo.  The lumber is purchased from a sawmill in Manta.

They will use this loan to buy lumber, sealants, nails, adhesive and other supplies used to make their objects.  

She’s been in the communal bank for 7 years and likes it because of the additional benefits offered by the institution.

Her dreams are to have a well furnished house and to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy lumber, paint, sealants, nails, adhesive, etc.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, called Kasur. It is well known for its tanneries industry. Her home consists of two rooms and is made of bricks. Her husband’s name is J. I. and he is involved in a dairy business. He keeps some goats and a buffalo at home. He gets up early in the morning and gets milk from the cattle to sell in the community to earn good profits. 

Razia herself is a housewife. She stays at home and does her household responsibilities. In her spare time, she also takes care of the cattle by providing them with timely food and water. She has given birth to six children. Her eldest son is a daily wage labor while one daughter does embroidery work for clients in the community. The remaining children are getting their education and studying in different classes. 

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to buy another buffalo which will help her husband increase milk productivity and sales. Her husband has been operating his business for the past three years and Razia is hopeful that an investment will help him provide better financial facilities for the family as a result. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for a dairy business.

loans.name: Goreth

texts.en:
N. Goreth lives in the Kyebando Nsooba neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.   She also takes care of additional family members (her sister). Goreth   has a poultry farm.  She has been in this business for two years, and she works 6 days out of every week. 

Goreth sells her products from home, wholesale or retail.    She  has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bags of chicken feed.    The main business challenges for Goreth include seasonality and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own 2000 chickens.  

Goreth lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Magali Del Pilar

texts.es:
Magali soltera de 31 años de edad, vive en casa propia con servicio de  agua y luz, ubicada en el caserío Lagunas   a unos 15 minutos de distrito de   Mórrope y a 30 minutos del  departamento de  Lambayeque.  Todas esta zonas se dedica a la actividad agrícola,  ganadera, artesanía  y turismo.

Magali ha puesto  en su domicilio su tienda de productos de primera necesidad (leche, azúcar, arroz, azúcar, todo tipo de golosinas, gaseosas, etc.),  desde hace algún tiempo para seguridad y comodidad de ella y de algún modo pueda atender a cualquier hora a sus  clientes, en la cual  encuentran todo lo que necesitan para su uso diario, con el negocio que ha colocado trata en lo posible de que sus clientes estén satisfechos y por ende tener  un mejor nivel de vida.

Mediante una visita a Edpyme Alternativa Magali trata de adquirir un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para abastecer su tienda de más insumos y así pueda satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, con la finalidad de incrementar  sus ingresos.  

Magali es conocida por sus vecinos, por ser una mujer  alegre, dispuesta a ayudar a otros y con esfuerzo y trabajo salir adelante.
texts.en:
Magali, 31, is single.  She lives in her own house, which has electricity and water, located in the Lagunas hamlet about 15 minutes from Mórrope district and 30 minutes from Lambayeque Department.  The entire zone is dedicated to farming, raising livestock, crafts and tourism.

Magali set up a grocery store in her house (milk, sugar, rice, all sorts of snacks, soft drinks, etc.) some time ago for her comfort and security and to be able to tend to customers at any moment; they can find everything they need for their daily use here.  She does her best in her business to see that her customers are satisfied and as a result she can have a better life.

Through a visit to Edpyme Alternativa she tries to acquire a loan of 1000 new soles to stock her store with more items so that she can meet customer demand with the goal of increasing her income.

Magali is known by her neighbors for being a cheerful woman who is always willing to help others and to get ahead in life through her effort and work.

loans.use: to stock her store with foodstuffs.

loans.name: Yaneth Lourdes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yaneth Lourdes; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de queso, ella vende queso en forma independiente desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de queso. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar el queso como leche.                                        
                              
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yaneth Lourdes belongs to the Kanchary Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Yaneth Lourdes, age 24, is single and has one child.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling cheese.  She sells cheese in an independent manner from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  It is through this business that she gets her child ahead.  

She wants to expand her business of selling cheese.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies like milk to make cheese.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies like milk to make cheese.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a young woman from Palestine. She is a housewife and a mother of two children. Her husband Rabie sells retail items such as lighters, key-chains, hygiene items, etc. He uses a cart and wanders in the streets selling from market to market and door to door.

Diana took out a loan from FATEN for her husband who wants to increase the variety of items he sells but he can't pay for it all at once.
Diana is a conservative woman. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase items such as lighters, candies, and hygiene items to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last thirty-four  years. He is 57 years old, married to Margaret, and they have five school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan.  He repaid both his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow. He wants to boost his farm income by selling milk.

In future, John hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Esmeralda Perpetua

texts.es:
Esmeralda de 43 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Es una mujer trabajadora empeñada en salir adelante desde que se separo de su esposo con sus 3 hijos de 16, 9, 10 años decidió abrir un salón de belleza.

Comenzó hace 20 años atrás todo lo que es de bellezas antes de casarse pero desde hace 4 años que se separo  reinicio su actividad para tener mas ingresos y mantener a sus hijos. Labora sola de 10H00 am a 9H00 pm en su gabinete. Realiza corte de cabellos, tinturados y pedicure. Le dificulta en su local el tiempo que recorre sus clientes al llegar y por eso quiere ponerse su local mejor en la avenida principal para atraer mas clientes. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas tintes, esmaltes varios y adecuar su local. En un futuro desea establecer su local en otro mejor lugar.
texts.en:
Esmeralda, 43, lives in an urban zone in Las Orquídeas (so called because originally there were many orchids there) in Guayaquil.  She is a hard working person determined to get ahead since she separated from her husband with her three children who are 16, 9 and 10 years of age.  She decided to open a beauty salon.

She started 20 years ago doing everything related to beauty before she was married but for the last four years since separating she restarted her activity to earn more income and support her children.  She works alone from 10am until 9pm in her stall.  She does haircuts, hair coloring and pedicures.

A difficulty she has is that her customers have to travel a bit to get to her so she wants to set herself up on the main road to attract more customers.  With help from the loan she wants to buy more hair coloring, various nail polishes and to equip her locale.  In the future she’d like to put her salon in a better location.

loans.use: to buy hair coloring, nail polish and to equip the locale.

loans.name: Carlos' Group

texts.en: Carlos, Milton, and Byron are the members of Carlos’ Group. The group lives near the city of San Gabriel, Ecuador. Carlos, the group’s president, is 28 years old and single. He lives with his mother and does not yet have children. He is a person with a great capacity to move forward with his life. He is not frightened by struggling to achieve what he sets out to achieve each day. Carlos works toward his goals with great enthusiasm. Carlos is a farmer who concentrates on growing potatoes. He is seeking this loan to continue with his business and to ensure that he does not lose his harvest. He has worked with micro loans from FODEMI for two years and says that FODEMI has opened many doors for him. Carlos finds that microloans have helped him support the pursuit of his dreams. He hopes that this loan will help his business grow more each day and help fulfill his dreams to get ahead. He wants to give his family a better life and support his future children. Carlos’ dream is to buy a new estate farm and continue to constantly fight for increased well-being and a better quality of life in the future.

loans.use: to care for his potato crops

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
L. socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a L. provincia D. Cusco,  y departamento D. Cusco.

L. socia es L. Sra. Francisca; elL. tiene 43 años D. edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; L. socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. aretes, collares y pulseras, elL. venD. en forma ambulatoria desD. las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,L. socia realiza los aretes, pulseras y collares, por medio D. este negocio L. socia saca adelante a sus hijos, L. socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. venta D. bisutería y también quiere que su hijo termine D. estudiar L. carrera profesional D. biología. L. socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer los aretes, collares y pulseras y también para pagar L. mensualidad D. su hijo que estudia en L. universidad.

 L. socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Santo Domingo" communal bank, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Francisca. She is 43 years old, single, and has one son. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling earrings, necklaces and bracelets. She sells in an ambulatory manner from 9:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. She makes the earrings, bracelets and necklaces herself. This business has been the means by which she has helped her son to get ahead. She would now like to expand her jewelery sales business and would also like for her son to be able to finish his professional studies in the field of biology. She is requesting this loan to buy materials for making earrings, necklaces and bracelets, and also to pay her son's monthly tuition for attending the university.

Francisca is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with her repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy materials for making earrings, necklaces and bracelets, and also to pay her son's monthly university tuition

loans.name: Rommel

texts.en:
Rommel is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 
Rommel has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for 5 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy breads, biscuits & canned goods.
Rommel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rommel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy breads, biscuits & canned goods

loans.name: Tinei

texts.en:
Tinei is 46 years of age and married with eight children. Tinei owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Tinei needs a loan of 1950 Samoa tala (WST) to hire more workers (at about WST 20/day). She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 tala or US $146 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2009, Tinei joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Tinei's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to hire more workers (at about WST 20/day).

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 33 years old, single, and blessed with two children. She runs a grocery shop in EPZ, Kitengela. She has been in this business for the last four years and receives an income of KES.10,000 per month. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member.

This is her first loan. She will use it to buy stock e.g. tomatoes, onions, potatoes and for the expansion of her business. She will use the extra profit to start a cereal stall. She hopes to become the best cereal dealer in Kitengela in the next two years. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy stock like tomatoes, onions, potatoes and to expand her business.

loans.name: Baktygul's Group

texts.en: Baktygul is the leader of this group. She is 32, and together with her husband, she brings up two children. The older son studies at school and the second children is preschool age (under 7). Baktygul works at school as a teacher of the Kyrgyz language and literature. Seven years ago, with an initial investment of 5000 soms, the family opened a pavilion where they sell grocery goods. In this way, they earn about 7000 soms per month. This profit made it possible to purchase home furniture and cattle for breeding. With money received from the loan, Baktygul wants to purchase more products, such as cookies, canned goods, beverages, etc. In the future, with the profits gained from the trade, she wishes to buy a vehicle to decrease their transportation expenses. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, cookies and canned goods.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is 47 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling beauty products in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase more stock of beauty products to sell.
Merlie has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for six years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.
Merlie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Ahos-Si Group

texts.fr: AHOS-SI est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Agnès. Les membres du groupe sont des cohabitants. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Agnès est âgée de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Agnès est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Olivier. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Agnès n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Agnès mène comme activité depuis une quinzaine d'année,la vente de produits cosmétiques et des médicaments. Agnès s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à ainsi assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Agnès et aux autres membres du groupe AHOS-SI, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
AHOS-SI is a group with three members.  The group's representative (who is raising her hand in the photo) is called Agnès.  The members of this group live together.  With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group are requesting their first loan from ALIDé.  Agnès is 37 years old and lives in Benin.  She is married to a welder named Olivier.  The couple have four children who all attend school and are in their care.  Agnès herself never went to school.

In order to cover her own needs as well as those of her children, Agnès has been selling cosmetics and medicines for 15 years.  She stocks up in the markets in Benin.  This business makes her the income she needs to help cover her family expenses.  This first loan will allow Agnès and the other members of the AHOS-SI group to grow their businesses, their customer numbers and their income.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and medicines

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace, shown standing in front of her mini-shop, sells wakye in Takoradi. She is a widow and has five children. She has been selling wakye for 20 years. Her loan will be used to buy beans and rice to cook and then sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy land.

loans.use: to buy beans and rice to cook and then sell.

loans.name: Jasmin Group!

texts.en: Jasmin is 19 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga with her husband and child. She earns about PHP 2,500 a month by raising livestock, and is applying for a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy a new cow. She has been a member of PMPC for one year and leads a two-person loan group.  Although the members borrow as a group, each person has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Gilma

texts.es:
La Sra. Gilma pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen D. la inmaculada” del Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento D. San Martín. Tiene 65 años, está casada y tiene 03 hijos los cuales son independientes.

Hace 15 años, viendo la necesidad D. generar otra fuente D. ingresos para los gastos diarios, decidió emprender un negocio que inició con un préstamo D. S/. 100.00, dinero que le sirvió para comprar algunos casilleros D. huevos, paquetes D. papel higiénico, D. esta manera y con la ayuda del banquito comunal fue surtiendo su pequeña tienda surtiéndola con nuevos productos para vender como carne, huevos, todo tipo D. bebidas, granos y verduras, cuenta con una buena clientela, por encontrarse en una zona estratégica.  Ella cuenta con la ayuda D. su esposo.
Este préstamo D. S/. 1700.00 soles le servirá para el adelanto D. una conservadora que piensa comprar que le  ayudará en la conservación D. los productos cárnicos por más tiempo y así brindar productos D. calidad a sus clientes.
Gilma es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, su sueño es implementar un Mini Market donD. pueda brindar otros servicios a sus clientes, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y está muy contenta con lo que hasta ahora ha logrado.
texts.en:
Gilma belongs to the communal bank Virgen D. la Inmaculada, in the district of Tarapoto in San Martin province. She is 65, married and has three grown-up children.

15 years ago, seeing the necessity of generating another source of income to proviD. for the household expenses, Gilma decided to start a business, beginning with a loan of 100 nuevos soles which she used to buy some cartons of eggs and rolls of toilet paper. With this money and with the help of the communal bank, she stocked her little shop with products to sell, including meat, eggs, all kinds of drinks, grains and vegetables. She has a good customer base as her shop enjoys a strategic location.

Gilma has the support of her husband. This loan of 1700 nuevos soles will proviD. an advance on a cooler she is planning to buy to help her keep meat products fresh for longer and offer her customers a better quality of product. Gilma is an enterprising and hardworking woman. Her dream is to start up a mini-market where she can proviD. other services to her customers. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement and is very happy with what she has achieved up to now.

loans.use: to put a downpayment on an electric appliance.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 46-year-old married woman with eight children between the ages of 19 and 5. All of them are in school. For four years, she has had a business selling clothes in Buluk, South Sudan. 

Susan requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She aims to use the extra profits she generates as a result of this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Wiwe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WIWE est formé de trois  personnes qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. Le représentant de ce groupe, nommé Noudéhouénou Maxime, est celui dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Noudéhouénou Maxime est âgé de 24 ans et est  marié à une revendeuse du nom de Grâce. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, dont deux sont les leurs. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Noudéhouénou Maxime vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme les diverses charges de la famille. Noudéhouénou Maxime a arrêté l'école au cours primaire, puis a appris le métier de vitrier. Il y a cinq ans que Noudéhouénou Maxime mène cette activité. Parallèlement, Noudéhouénou Maxime vend des chaussures et des friperies dans sa région. Noudéhouénou Maxime s'approvisionne au Togo et au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Noudéhouénou Maxime sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WIWE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Wiwe group is made up of three people who come from the same tontine, or savings group.  The representative of the group, named Noudéhouénou Maxime, is the one with his hand raised in the photo.  This is the first time that the group has applied for financial support from ALIDé, in the hope of raising their level of business.  Noudéhouénou Maxime is 24 years old, and is married to a retailer named Grâce.  The couple cares for three children, two of whom are their own.  Among the children, some are in school.  Noudéhouénou Maxime lives together with his wife and children, and, along with his wife, provides for the diverse needs of his family.  Noudéhouénou Maxime left school at the primary level and then learned the glazier trade.  For five years, Noudéhouénou Maxime has run this business.  At the same time, Noudéhouénou Maxime sells shoes and second-hand clothing in the region.  Noudéhouénou Maxime stocks up in Togo and Nigeria.  With the goals of a more highly satisfied customer base and revenue and sales growth, Noudéhouénou Maxime is requesting his first loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the Wiwe group.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Maria Crisanta

texts.es: Crisanta tiene 28 años de edad esta casada con el señor Benito el cual es albañil y tienen 3 niños los cuales dos estudian, dice que  en su localidad la mayoría de las personas se dedican a hacer la artesanía de ocoshal y que es algo característico de su localidad y que todavía preservan sus raíces ya que la mayoría de la personas hablan el dialecto mazahua y visten con faldones de la cultura mazahua. Ella desde hace mas de 8 años se dedica a cultivar aguacate dice que su esposo fue el que emprendió el negocio para tener un poco mas de ganancias ya que con lo que ganad de albañil no le alcanzaba para mantener a su familia y por eso empezó hacer el huerto de aguacates. Platica Cris como de cariño le dicen en su casa en cuando no hay fruto hace artesanía de Ocoshal ya que la materia prima la sacan de las palmitas secas del encino. Ella quiere un préstamo para el mantenimiento de su huerto ya que comprara insumos como abonos orgánicos, calidra  para eliminar las plagas y ella quisiera comprar una bomba de agua para trasladar el agua hasta el huerto ya que tienen que contratar animales para que le suban el agua al cerro para regar los arboles. Esta muy contenta por que gracias a los créditos que  ha obtenido atravez de la financiera le han servido porque ha comprado insumos de mejor calidad y así puede ofrecerle a sus clientes un fruto de mejor calidad y dice que así poco a poco se ha abierto mercado en diferentes municipios de su estado y eso la tiene muy contenta por que quiere decir que los créditos le sirven de mucho. La meta que tiene doña Crisanta es seguir haciendo crecer el negocio y comprar una camioneta de uso para facilitar el transporte del aguacate ya que cuando van a venderlo tienen que agar flete.
texts.en:
Crisanta, 28, is married to Benito who is a bricklayer and they have three children two of which attend school.  She says that in her community most residents make ocoshal crafts  which are characteristic of her location and which still maintain their roots since most people speak the Mazahua dialect and wear traditional Mazahua skirts.

She says that she’s been an avocado farmer for more than 8 years.  She says that it was her husband who started the business to earn a bit more profits since what he earned as a bricklayer did not suffice to support the family so he started to make an avocado orchard.

Cris, which is what she’s affectionately called at home, relates that when there is no fruit she makes Ocoshal crafts since the raw materials for it are extracted from dry oak palm fronds.  She wants a loan for crop maintenance since she will buy farm supplies like organic manure, Calidra [brand of hydrated lime powder] to eradicate infestations; she’d also like to buy a water pump to pump water to the orchard since she now has to rely on animals to carry water up the hill to water the trees.

She is very happy because thanks to the loans she’s gotten from the lending organization she’s been able to buy better quality supplies so that she can offer her customers better quality fruit in the future.  She says that little by little this way she’s been opening up markets for herself in various municipalities in her state and this makes her very happy because she wants to say that the loans are very useful for her.  Crisanta’s goal is to continue to make her business grow and to buy a pick-up truck to facilitate transport of the avocadoes since they currently have to pay transportation costs when they want to go sell them.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and a water pump.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 24 years old, married, and has one child who is two and a half years old. Her husband works as a businessman. 

Rebecca has been selling clothes for the past three years. She has requested the loan to buy more clothes to sell. 

With the profits, she plans to start saving for her child’s education.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Khlood

texts.en:
The above photo with her husband. Khlood is a 25-year-old, married woman from Al Aqaba, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for her home improvement. She would like to buy a new refrigerator and some household items. In the future, she wants to improve her family's social economic status.

Since Khlood is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Sociedad Emprendedora Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SOCIEDAD EMPRENDEDORA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María Luisa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de juguetes, venta de mantas de lana, costura de chalecos, producción de zapatos, venta de llaves, taller de cerrajería, servicio de baño público, taller de electricista.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María Luisa es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una vecina que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de manta de vicuña; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con el préstamo que saco de Pro Mujer y con el concejo de su amiga empezó la venta de este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana de vicuña) que adquirirá en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente al elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, crédito y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.

En la imagen tres integrantes del grupo se encuentran en mala ubicación para sacar la imagen.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Sociedad Emprendedora” (Enterprising Society) is starting its third loan cycle as part of the Los Andes Community Center. This group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. María Luisa serves as the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling toys, selling wool blankets, making vests, producing shoes, selling keys, operating a metalsmith shop, managing a public lavatory, and operating an electrical repair shop.

This loan will benefit small businesspeople such as Sra. María Luisa. She says that she joined Pro Mujer eight years ago after receiving an invitation from a neighbor who is also a member of the organization. At the moment, she has a business in which she weaves and sells blankets from vicuña wool. María Luisa has become knowledgeable about her business since she started it with a loan from Pro Mujer. She began selling her products upon receiving advice from a friend.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying vicuña wool. She will acquire the material at the fairs in the city of El Alto and then use it for making the products that she sells from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generating income for sustaining her family. María Luisa is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, María Luisa said that she enjoys the health-related seminars, the loans, and the training offered by the organization. In the photo, three of the members are standing in a bad location for their picture to be taken.

loans.use: to buy vicuña wool.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine aged 29 years. She is married with 2 children aged between 2 and 4 years. Not yet go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 4 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Soda

texts.en: Living in a rural area of Phnom Penh city, Soda is a university student and 19 years old. Nowadays, she earns income to support on her living condition and her studying via working as IT assistant in a company. For Soda, this is her first time with VisionFund and she will use her loan portion to spend on tuition fee for Admin skill which she will go to study at abroad. She hopes that this loan can help her get a good job after graduated, so she can get higher salary to support on her family to get better condition.

loans.use: To spend on her tuition fee for Admin skill.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
Maria is a 40-year old woman living in Tampico, Tamaulipas. She has two children in her care, Alan and Paola, aged 9 and 5 years of age. They are her incentive to keep working and to make her business grow. Maria wants to give them a better quality of life and an education. Her husband works as a contractor but his salary alone is not enough to cover the family\\\'s costs, which is why she wants to help her husband with that responsibility. When she started her crafts were simple, but now her experience permits her to make more involved crafts. Her business entails selling her crafts and gifts, and she earns more clients day after day.

She requires $750USD to buy raw materials so that they may increase their production and meet the holiday demand. She wishes to keep working to support her family that needs her help.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria es una mujer de 40 años, vive en Tampico Tamaulipas; tiene 2 hijos a su cuidado Alan y Paola de 9 y 5 años respectivamente, los cuales son su incentivo para seguir trabajando y hacer crecer su negocio. Maria desea ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida y una educación; su esposo trabaja como contratista sin embargo su salario no le permite cubrir con todos los gastos de la familia por lo que ella quiso apoyar a su esposo con esta responsabilidad. Cuando inició sus trabajos eran sencillos, ahora la dificultad de elaborarlos es mucho mayor, ya que su trabajo consiste en la venta de manualidades y regalos, por lo que día con día Maria adquiere mas clientes.

Ella necesita de $750 USD para comprar insumos que le permitan tener mayor capacidad de producción y enfrentar la demanda navideña que esta en camino. Ella quiere seguir trabajando para apoyar a su familia y necesita tu ayuda, apóyala.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise and Raw Material.

loans.name: Terlan

texts.en:
Terlan is 46 years old and an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Ehmedbeyli village. He is married and has 2 children.
He has a lot of customers because his meat is always fresh.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to build a butcher shop. He plans to improve his business to increase the number of his customers in order to have a better income.
Terlan has been in this business for 4 years.

loans.use: To build a butcher shop

loans.name: Ruinah

texts.en: Ruinah  is 48 years old and married with two children. To supplement her husband's income, Ruinah  runs a sewing business in her house. In a day, Ruinah can earn about $3, coming to about $45 a month. She needs a loan of $50 to buy more fabric and thread, so she can boost her tailoring business and her income. She particularly would like to raise her income so she can pay for her children's education and to give them a better life than  the one she had while growing up.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients for her bakery/redientes para su elaboracion de panaderia

loans.name: Penh

texts.en: Mrs. Penh Khim is a 46-year-old wife and mother living in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. She and her husband run a stall selling a type of cereal made up of mixed vegetables, beans and grain to people in their community. She earns up to $7.40 a day from this activity. She intends to use this loan to buy more grain for this business so that she can increase production and sales.

loans.use: to buy grain for a cereal stall

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
Some time ago, Eleuterio worked as a truck driver, but downsizing in his company resulted in him being fired. This left him and his family without money to survive. With a lot of effort and with help from relatives, in 1991 Eleuterio and his family opened a general store, and little by little they began to increase their inventory and clientele. Thanks to the attitude of all his family, the business has become well known among the people who live in Sabinas.

However, like all businesses, this one has good times and bad times. Recently, they had many expenses, and so the store was left with a very low inventory. This is why they are requesting a loan of US $475, to be paid in 6 months, to be able to buy merchandise to have a better variety of products. With your help, Eleuterio and his family will be able to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Hace tiempo, Eleuterio trabajó como chofer de camiones de carga, pero un reajuste en su empresa, hizo que lo despidieran, dejándolo a él y su familia sin dinero para sobrevivir, y con mucho esfuerzo y la ayuda de sus familiares en 1991 Eleuterio y su familia comenzaron a vender productos de abarrotes, y así poco a poco comenzaron a crecer el repertorio de sus productos, y haciéndose de clientela. Gracias a la disposición que tiene toda su familia, el negocio está haciéndose más conocido entre la gente que vive en Sabinas.

Sin embargo, como todos los negocios tiene temporadas buenas y malas, y actualmente tuvieron muchos gastos, por lo tanto la tienda de abarrotes quedó con muy poca mercancía, por lo tanto están solicitando un crédito de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con esto poder comprar mercancía para tener mayor surtido en sus productos. Con tu ayuda la familia de Eleuterio podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: Buying merchandise to replenish his business' inventory.

loans.name: Phun

texts.en: Mrs. Phun S., aged 37, works selling garlic at the market, earning around $16 per day in revenue. Her husband is a construction foreman, making about $12 per day. They have three children who are students. She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to purchase more garlic from the grower in greater quantity, and therefore save money through a bulk purchase discount. She plans to use the leftover of the money to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase more garlic from the grower to sell.

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Amavi A. is 45 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. Her husband’s income is irregular and modest. Like other women in the village, she extracts palm oil that she then sells at the local market, which gives her enough income to fund more than half the family’s expenses. The current loan will help her increase her production significantly and therefore augment her income for the happiness of her children.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Amavi A. est âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Son mari a un revenu très irrégulier et modeste. Comme les autres femmes du villages, elle extrait l’huile de palm qu’elle revend sur le marché local , ce qui lu procure un revenu Pour financer plus de la moitié des charges familiales. Le présent emprunt l’aidera à augmenter sensiblement sa production donc augmenter ses revenus pour le bonheur de ses enfants

loans.use: To buy 40 bags of palm nuts from local villages to turn into palm oil

loans.name: Sevinj

texts.en: Sevinj A. is a 28-year-old married woman and she has one child. She lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. She has a small herd of milk cows, from which she sells 60 liters of milk per day to the local milk processing shop and to the supermarket. The demand for milk is strong so she firmly believes that she could sell more milk if she had a larger herd of cattle. Therefore, she is seeking a loan of $600 from the Normicro Saatli branch so that she can purchase another calf for breeding purposes to increase her monthly income.

loans.use: To increase the number of cattle in her herd

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis is an unselfish father who has always sacrificed to gain the well-being of his family. He manages livestock and has aspirations of converting his business into the largest breeder in the community. It is for this reason that he asks for a loan. He hopes to increase the number and variety of his livestock. Your important contribution will help him realize this dream.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Luis, es un padre de familia abnegado que siempre se ha esforzado por generarle bienestar a los suyos. Se dedica a la ganadería y tiene el deseo de convertirse en el ganadero más importante de su comunidad y es precisamente a este sueño que atiende la solicitud de su préstamo debido a que desea incrementar el número y la variedad de los animalitos que posee.Tu importante aporte contribuirá a concretar este deseo.

loans.use: To invest capital to increase the quantity and variety of his livestock

loans.name: Halima's Group

texts.en:
My name is Halima A. and I am a mother of two girls and two boys. Originally from the city of Faisalabad, I moved to Raiwind, Pakistan twelve years ago. My eldest daughter is married and all my other children attend school. I am a health worker and provide health services for women at my clinic, located at a nearby market. Raiwin is a small city with few clinics, and I would like to expand my clinic.

My friends who also require loans for their businesses include: Suriya B., who will fix her tractor; Shahnaz M., who wants to buy a dairy cow; and Mumtaz M., who wants to expand her grocery store.

loans.use: Expand medical clinic

loans.name: Thị Thơm

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Thơm (MS: 09010005), 37 years old, is a seamstress. Her husband farms egg laying chickens. They have a school aged child. Their daily income is 150,000-180,000 VND. She would like to take out a loan of 2,006,000 VND to buy feed for the chickens. Her group has 6 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers. (There is an extra man in the picture due to Lê Danh Dị has moved to other group.)
  • Lê Đắc Chỉnh (MS: 09010007), 37 years old, applies for a loan to buy feed for chickens.
  • Hoàng Thi Nhung (MS: 09010008), 37 years old, applies for a loan to buy feed for chickens.
  • Hoàng Thị Tuyển (MS: 09010009), 37 years old, applies for a loan to buy feed for chickens.
  • Hoàng Thị Hường (MS: 09010010), 32 years old, applies for a loan to invest in her grocery stand.
  • Lê Thị Hằng (MS: 09010012), 33 years old, applies for a loan to “đi chợ”
  • Lê Duy Sơn (MS: 09010013), 33 years old, applies for a loan to buy fertilizer for rice paddy.

Đi chợ, a general Vietnamese term, describes the everyday trading activity of small items at village open market. Traders seek opportunity to buy items which can be resold to others at a minimal profit. These items can be anything, including products such as a little fish or a small bundle of vegetables.
