At times the Traders don't have a stand, but rather sell their wares directly from their person.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị Thơm (MS: 09010005), năm nay 37 tuổi. Chị làm thợ may, chồng chị chăn nuôi gà đẻ trứng. Anh chị có một con đang đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 150.000-180.000 VND/ngày. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám cho gà. Anh Lê Đắc Chỉnh (MS: 09010007), năm nay 37 tuổi. Anh vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám cho gà. Chị Hoàng Thi Nhung (MS: 09010008), năm nay 37 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua thức ăn cho gà. Chị Hoàng Thị Tuyển (MS: 09010009), năm nay 37 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám cho gà. Chị Hoàng Thị Hường (MS: 09010010), năm nay 32 tuổi. Chị vay để lấy vốn mua hàng bán ở chợ. Chị Lê Thị Hằng (MS: 09010012), năm nay 33 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để có thêm vốn đi bán hàng. Anh Lê Duy Sơn (MS: 09010013), năm nay 33 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua lân đạm bón lúa. ( Ảnh nhóm: Thừa Bác Lê Danh Dị vì đã chuyển sang nhóm của cô Thu)

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Radojka

texts.en:
Radojka B. is a widow living in the small village of Plocniku.

She is applying for her first loan in the amount of 600 KM (Bosnian Marks) ($475) to support her small farming business, where she raises poultry and sells eggs.

Her business is her main income in addition to her pension. She has no children or spouse. Radojka plans to use the loan to expand her business and buy more chickens for fattening.

loans.use: To buy more chickens.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is thirty five years old. She has three children who are in school. She has been trading in weave-ons and local soaps for ten years now. Her dream is to expand her shop to include assorted weave-ons and hair creams, shampoo and activators to make it a one-stop shop for her customers, especially beauticians who typically demand such items. She is a group member of “Yesu Nti” (meaning for the sake of Christ) Trust Group. Peer pressure and support provide additional incentive to repay, because if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the repayment amount.

loans.use: To buy assorted weave-ons and hair creams, shampoo and activators

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia S. is twenty-eight years old and is married with two children. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood. Lydia is very skillful and talented hairdresser. Lydia also has four apprentices who help her. 

She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service, so she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products to serve her customers.  

She is a member of the Progress Trust community group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and provide support to one another to repay the loans. Lydia appears in the photo with her apprentices. She is holding one of her children.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Tom P. is a 52-year-old widow who works as a fisherwoman on Tunle Sap Lake in the Siem Reap Province of Cambodia, earning about $2.50 per day.  She has three children, two of whom are married, and  cares for her two young nephews in the Anglung Samnor Commune.  She often works with her eldest brother, who also earns about $2.50 per day.  Tom has recently seen an opportunity to expand her business by upgrading her tools and equipment, such as fishing nets and traps, and is therefore requesting a loan of $500.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools, such as nets and traps.

loans.name: Luz Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela G. vive en la calle caupolican de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz . Gabriela  es madre soltera, tiene una hija de  13 años, actualmente paga el alquiler de dos habitaciones y una pequeña cocina. Para obtener ingresos Gabriela presta un servicio de amplificación para fiestas y eventos similares en las diferentes zonas de la ciudad de La Paz. Solicita  crédito para comprar una pantalla gigante, lo cuál le permitirá hacer cobros extra por sus servicios

Su historial es bastante confiable, por eso, califica para obtener un nuevo credito.
texts.en:
Gabriela G. lives on Caupolican Street in the Tembladerani district of the city of La Paz. She is a single mother of a 13-year-old daughter. Currently Gabriela is renting an apartment with two bedrooms and a small kitchen. To earn a living, she rents out amplifiers at parties and similar events throughout La Paz. Gabriela is requesting a loan to purchase a large projection screen, which will allow her to charge extra for her services. Gabriela has a reliable credit history. As such, she qualifies to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: José

texts.es: El señor José tiene 50 años, esta casado y tiene 4 hijos y esta dedicado al oficio de ser carpintero hace mas de 30 años, comenta que realizar este trabajo actualmente tiene sus dificultades por el hecho de que hoy día hay poca materia prima ósea maderas, por lo que sus muebles en gran porcentaje esta hecho con la combinación de metal, su especialidad es la de fabricar muebles de cocina, cunas, cama, etc.nAlgunos de sus clientes son las mueblerías de las ciudades de  Tobatí, de Caacupé, Paraguari, como así también clientes en forma particular muy especialmente de la ciudad de Tobatí. Los prestamos obtenidos de la Fundación Paraguaya lo invirtió en la compra de maderas, y varillas metálicas, así también logro comprar herramientas manuales. Tiene proyectado con uno de sus hijos incorporar al taller, el servicio de herrerías, para el efecto están pensando en un nuevo préstamo que le permita compra las  herramientasn
texts.en:
Jose is 50 years old, and is married with four children. He has been dedicated to the craft of carpentry for 30 years. He says that most recently finding work is difficult because raw materials, like wood, are hard to find. A high percentage of what he makes is made with a combination of wood and metal. His specialties are kitchen furniture, baby cribs, beds ect. Some of his clients are furniture retailers in the cities of Tobati, Caacupe, and Paraguari. The loans he obtained from the Paraguaya Foundation were invested in the purchase of wood, and metal support rods along with other manual tools. He is in the planning stage of opening a repair shop with his son, and with this newest loan it will permit him to purchase the tools he needs.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of specialty woods

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Bunthoeun S. is a 41-year-old widow with six children who all live in Thorm Ney village in Takeo Province. One of her children is employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Mrs. Bunthoeun S. is a fishmonger in the local market but this business is not as lucrative as it once was, so she is seeking a loan to buy a cow to start a cow-breeding business.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a cow-breeding business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana S. is forty-one years old.  She is married with three children who are currently in basic school.  She lives with her husband and children in Atebubu.  Atebubu is a farming community.  The inhabitants produce food crops like maize, yams, millet, beans, etc. 

Juliana is a hardworking woman who works to support her husband in taking care of the family.  She is a second hand textiles dealer.  She sells ladies’ clothes in her community market, and treks to nearby towns to sell as well.  She has been in business for eight years.  Juliana says she buys the textiles in bales from Kumasi, the regional capital town.  

It is her desire to buy more bales so that she can travel to other markets to do business.  She hopes the loan will help her to achieve her dream of giving her children a top quality education.  She hopes that she can increase her profit margin to help her husband take very good care of the family. 

Mary is in a group called ‘Maranatha’ Trust Bank in her community.  The members in the group guarantee one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy textiles in bulk.

loans.name: Rachel Mbeyu

texts.en:
Rachel Mbeyu G. sells second-hand clothes and sweets in the Likoni neighborhood of Mombasa, Kenya. She began this business six months ago. She used to sell small items like biscuits, doughnuts, balboa seeds (which are seeds from the Balboa tree, colored and sugared to sell in small packs). Second-hand clothes provide a higher profit for Rachel and she prefers to sell non-perishable items. 

Rachel purchases her stock from Kongowea Market in Mombasa from wholesalers on a fortnightly (14 days) basis. She says that kids clothes sell the fastest and that she is able to make a 2,000-3,000 KES profit in a month. 

Rachel is applying for a loan of 200 USD in order to buy more clothing and to build a stand (a kibanda) to sell the clothes from. 

Rachel relies on this business to supplement her income as a primary school teacher. She has been teaching for 29 years and is two years from her retirement. After her retirement from teaching, she will concentrate on her clothing sales in order to continue to support 2 of her 4 children who are still dependents. Rachel says “the future will open itself for me as I retire.”

loans.use: To acquire more stock of used cloths and build a "kibanda" (small stand)

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita A. is a seaweed grower. She also owns a store where she sells a variety of goods. She is 47 years old and has 8 children. Her husband, Ramon A., helps her raise their children. She previously worked as a checker in a furniture company. She was not happy about her previous job because of its low salary, so she decided to start a seaweed farming business. She dreams of having a bigger store someday. In this way, she will be able to send all her children to school. 

She is asking for a CEVI loan of Php 17,000 ($375 USD). Her loan will be used to buy seaweed seedlings. This will help her increase the size of her farm. 

CEVI is helping seaweed farmers like Juanita to grow their businesses. They are provided with credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage to sustain their businesses.

loans.use: To buy seaweed seedlings and merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Catalina Del Carmen

texts.es:
La microempresaria Catalina del Carmen Gutiérrez G. tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos, los cuales estudian y además le ayudan en sus negocios. Doña Catalina se dedica desde hace 12 años al negocio de la comercialización de lácteos (queso y crema). Con este negocio a podido salir adelante en los gastos del hogar. 

Sin embargo esta microempresaria que tiene espíritu de superación, ha incursionado desde hace 2 años a la compra y venta de mariscos (chacalines, jaiba y ostiones). Para este negocio a comprado una pequeña embarcación (cayuco) con un motor fuera de borda en el cual se transporta donde los pescadores artesanales y les compra dicho producto.

Una vez que tiene acopiado (Cuenta con termos y freezer) cierta cantidad de mariscos los traslada a la capital en donde ya tiene compradores, estos son dueños de restaurantes y hoteles que ofrecen estos tipos de platillos.

Esta microempresaria ha tenido por parte de ADEPHCA mas de 6 créditos y en todos a pagado en tiempo y forma, actualmente esta solicitando su crédito numero 2 con Kiva y mantiene los dos negocios, por un lado la venta de lácteos el cual administra su hija y el de los mariscos que personalmente ella lo atiende.

En esta ocasión esta solicitando comprar 300 libras de chacalines los cuales compra a US$ 1.50 dólares cada libra, 20 galones de ostiones que compra a US$ 7.50 dólares cada galón y 80 docenas de jaiba las cuales compra a US$ 5 dólares cada docena.
texts.en:
The micro-entrepreneur Catalina del Carmen Gutiérrez G. is 35 years old, married, and has two children who are in school and also help her with her businesses. For the past 12 years, Catalina has dedicated herself to selling dairy products (cheese and cream). With this business, she was able to get ahead with the household expenses. In addition, this micro-entrepreneur who has a great spirit and desire to supersede, also has seafood business that she’s had for 2 years. For this enterprise, she purchased a small motorboat (cayuco) that she uses to visit the local fishermen to buy her products. Once she has accumulated a certain amount of seafood (she has a Thermos and freezer), she transports them to the capital where she has buyers. These include restaurant owners and hotels that offer these types of dishes. This businesswoman has had six loans with ADEPHCA that she has paid back in full and on time. Currently, she is requesting her 2nd loan with Kiva. She cares for the seafood end of the business personally, while her daughter tends to the dairy side of things. On this occasion, she requests a loan to purchase 300 pounds of shrimp at US $1.50 per pound, 20 gallons of scallops at US $7.50 per gallon, and 80 dozen crabs at US $5.00 per dozen.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shrimp, scallops and crab.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es: Zenaida tiene 20 años, es una joven muy alegre y sonriente, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de cuadernos, lapiceros, libros, etc, ella tiene una librería en su propia casa, la cual le ha dado el dinero necesario para vivir, vende muy rápido sus productos, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en los labios. A Zenaida le gusta vender, sabe que mientras más lo hagan sus ingresos serán mejores, pero le es muy difícil y cansado permanecer todo el día dentro de su librería, ya que no puede salir a la calle con la libertad que ella desearía. Con los 2 años de experiencia que tiene en este trabajo, ha decidido hacer crecer su negocio y espera para un futuro cercano, tener una librería más grande. Este es el tercer préstamo de Zenaida con MFP, siempre ahorra dinero de sus ventas para poder pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, es una socia muy amable y siempre trabaja por el bienestar de su banco comunal. Con la cantidad que ahora solicita ha decidido comprar más productos para incrementar la mercadería de su librería.
texts.en:
Zenaida is twenty years old, a happy and smiling young lady, and lives in the house that she inherited from her parents. She is dedicated to the selling of notebooks, mechanical pencils, books, etc. She has a bookstore in her home which has given her the money necessary for living expenses. She rapidly sells products, and she is always ready to receive her customers with a smile on her face. Zenaida enjoys selling and knows that the more she does the better her income will be, but it is very difficult and tiring to remain inside her bookstore for the entire day as she cannot go out and about with the liberty that she would desire. With the two years of experience that she has in this line of work, she has decided to grow her business and hopes in the near future to have a larger bookstore.

This is the third loan that Zenaida has taken with MFP, and she always saves the money from her sales to be able to make her payments on time. She is a very friendly member of her communal bank and always works for the wellbeing of it. With the money that she is asking for she has decided to buy more products to increase the merchandise of her bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Monad

texts.ru: Монад – женщина 49 лет. Замужем, имеет 5-х детей. Занимается продажей сладостей и кондитерских изделий, которые ей поставляют домашние кондитеры. Муж занимается частной деятельностью, пособничеством у мастеров. Монад старается расширить свой бизнес и закупать импортные конфеты и сладости, потому, что потребность на них очень большая. Этим она хочет увеличить свой семейный доход. Монад очень надеется что полученный кредит поможет ей в достижении ее цели.
texts.en:
Monad is a woman of 49 years of age. She is married and has five children. She sells sweets and confectioneries which are homemade by confectioners who supply them. Her husband works as an assistant for various repairmen. Monad tries to expand her business and buys imported candy and sweets because the demand for these goods is high. She wants to increase her input into family's budget. Monad is very hopeful that this loan will help her in achieving this goal.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Augusto Cesar

texts.es: El señor Augusto A., reside en un barrio que se llama Memorial Sandino en la ciudad de Managua, tiene 58 años de edad, casado, y con un hijo de 10 años de edad. Trabaja como vigilante desde hace 19 años el cual ha adquirido experiencia. Con este crédito quiere invertir en comprar  materiales de construcción para hacer las mejoras a su vivienda y poder dar a su familia una mejor comodidad y seguridad. Sus planes es pode seguir construyendo su casa, a si como apoyar a su hijo a que estudie.
texts.en:
Mr. Augusto A. lives in a neighborhood called Memorial Sandino in the city of Managua, is 58 years old, is married, and has a ten-year old son. He has worked as a guard for 19 years and has acquired a lot of experience. He wants to invest this loan in the purchase of construction materials for improvements to his home and to be able to give his family more comfort and security. His plans are to be able to continue constructing his house and thereby support his son who studies.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to make improvements to his house

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 33 years old and comes from a suburb of a town in Banovići. She is married and has one child who is in primary school. She is a diligent young woman who works hard in her fields to produce as much food as possible to sell. Her husband is employed but in his free time he works with his wife in agriculture. They have a small tractor and it helps them to work their fields more easily. Fatima decided to take her first loan from WWI in the amount of US$425 to purchase poultry and poultry feed. She has clients who buy vegetables from her and they will buy chicken meat also. This will increase Fatima`s household income.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and poulltry feed

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Ángela M. se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual es atendido por ella misma en su establecimiento.

Es de importancia destacar que ella ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel por medio de los créditos. Hoy en día, una vez más acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un nuevo crédito y así salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo para continuar.
texts.en:
Ángela M. earns her living running her own mini market in the city of Chinandega. It's important to stress that she has succeeded in getting ahead thanks to the support of loans from Ceprodel. Now she is coming back to Ceprodel to benefit from a new loan, which she really needs to move forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Madiore

texts.en:
Madiore T. owns a small rice farm. She is 45 years old and the mother of three children. The proceeds of her farm go to purchasing the basic needs for their family. Aside from rice, she plants vegetables in their backyard, a short distance away from their house. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to pay for the manpower during land preparation. Preparing the land is the most crucial thing to achieve a better yield. She hopes that with her loan she can have better returns from her farm.

Through CEVI, Mrs. T. is able to sustain her livelihood all the more. CEVI helps her get a loan, as well as training and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To pay for the manpower during land preparation.

loans.name: Mrs. Rin Sao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people living in Khav village in Takeo province make up this village bank, and they will use this loan for various purpose. Mrs. Rin S. is the 29-year-old village bank president. She is a basket maker, saving money for her family. Her husband, Mr. Chea Knet, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Although they work hard, they still need more money to provide a better house for their family. Thus, Mrs. Rin S. decided to ask for a loan to buy zinc and timber to repair the house. This couple has three children who are attending the local school.

Four members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. Borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy zinc and timber to repair a house

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun T. started selling fish in her busy local market a number of years ago and has gained a lot of customers from this business. She is a single mother blessed with four teenage children; most of them help meet the family’s expenses by working in a restaurant. With a loan, Bun T. hopes to be able to buy fish in greater quantities for resale. With the extra profits, she hopes to improve her and her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fish in greater quantities for resale

loans.name: Placida

texts.es: Placida está casada con Juan Felipe de profesión policía, tiene 3 hijas de 22, 20 y 15 años. Posee vivienda propia, en la cual vive con sus dos hijas menores. Se dedica a la venta ambulante de comida en el mercado de la ciudad. El esposo es policía  y está destinado actualmente en el Chapare. Se dedica a esta actividad, hace 15 años aproximadamente la competencia es alta, pero cuenta con clientela fija, la cual demanda sus productos  principalmente por la  calidad, sabor e higiene de sus comidas. El destino del crédito es para incrementar el capital de operaciones del negocio  y la compra de un freezer. El presente es el octavo  préstamo  al que accede Placida, con excelente comportamiento y puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Placida is married to Juan Felipe—a police officer. They have 3 daughters ages 22, 20, and 15. They own a house in which they live with their 2 youngest daughters. She sells food as a street vendor at the city’s market. Her husband is stationed in el Chapare. She has been in business for approximately 15 years. Competition is high, but she has a fixed clientele that demands her products mainly because of the quality, taste, and cleanliness of her meals. This loan will be used to increase working capital and to purchase a freezer. This is Placida’s eighth loan. She is an excellent client who is very punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital and purchase a freezer

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es: Martha Isabel O. B. tiene 47 años. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio, pero es importante resaltar que su negocio nació con el objetivo de apoyar en los ingresos de la familia, ella es una persona que ha luchado para salir adelante. El financiamiento es solicitado para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima como es masa, comal, cal y maíz. Su deseo es mantener su negocio y lograr tener más recursos.
texts.en:
Martha Isabel O. Baltodanois is 47 years old. She has been making and selling tortillas for more than 12 years. It is important to know that she started her business in order to support her family. Martha is a person who has struggled to get ahead. She is requesting a loan to use as operating capital to buy supplies such as flour, lime, corn and hotplates. She hopes to maintain her business so that she can have more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Maria Maxima

texts.es: La Sra. Maria se dedica a la reposteria ubicado en su domicilio, actividad con la cual sostiene a su familia D. tres integrantes y a su hija D. 21 años que es una niña especial y cubre los gastos D. la escuela especial a la que tiene que asistir. A traves D. los años hasta el dia D. hoy se pudo evidenciar el crecimiento del negocio D. la señora Maria, incrementando su maquinaria, diversificando sus productos y aumentando la cantidad D. pedidos por dia.
texts.en:
Maria runs a bakery from her home. This work supports her family of three and the expenses of a special needs school that her 21-year old daughter has to attend. Throughout the years Maria's business has grown, as she has purchased more equipment, diversified her products, and increased the number of customer requests received every day.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials (flour, baking powder, soft drinks, ice cream)

loans.name: El Manguito Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Manguito, se formo en S. Pinotepa Nacional Oaxaca; está integrado por 14 clientes, llevan un año (3 ciclos)trabajando con credito que Fundacion Realidad ofrece, todos los integrantes se dedican a la elaboración y comercialización de productos como son:Abarrote, tamales, refrescos, helados, totopos, ropa, perfumes y zapatos por catalogo, merceria, lenceria, tortillas de maíz elaboradas a mano, tacos, maíz a granel y pescado fresco, debido a la zona geografica en que se encuentra la locaidad estos tipos de productos tienen buena demanda en la región y por consecuencia buenos ingresos algo muy aceptable comenta la señora Alicia D. T. ella es clienta de 71 años de edad que junto con su hija Rosario que actualmente ya no esta en el grupo por cambiar de domicilio fueron quienes conformaron el grupo invitando a sus vecinos para formar el mismo,  comenta doña Alicia que el credito recibido por la institución le han beneficiado demasiado a todos los integrantes ya que les dá el medio de trabajar y contribuir a los ingresos de sus familias mas ahora que la situación aconomica del país esta en crisis y el ingreso de sus esposos no son suficientes para solventar los gastos que generan sus hijos para que acudan a la escuela.
El recurso que solicitan del credito lo utilizarán para invertir en la elaboración y compra de productos para vender como son:compra de maíz, leña, bolsas de plastico, carne fresca, chiles seco para prepar mole, articulo de abarrotes, refrescos, pago de fletes de las personas que compran articulos por catalogo asi como renta de lanchas y compra de gasolina  de las pesonas que venden pescado freco.
ellan tienen la esperanza de que Fundación Realidad continue brindandoles el servicio financiero  ya que dependen de eso para que continuen trabajando y a futuro tener un negocio que le genere ingresos y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
The Manguito Group was formed in S. Pinotepa Nacional Oaxaca. It is comprised of 14 members. They have been working for one year (three cycles) with loans that Fundacion Realidad offers. All of the members make and sell products like groceries, tamales, soft drink, ice cream, tortilla chips, clothes, perfume, shoes by catalog, notions, lingerie, handmade corn tortillas, tacos, bulk corn, and fresh fish. Due to the geographic region they are located in, these types of products are in good demand in the area. As a consequence, their income is very good and acceptable, according to Alicia D. T.. She is a 71 year old member who joined with her daughter, Rosario. Currently she is not in the group because she moved. They were the ones that founded the group by inviting neighbors to join. Alicia comments that the loan received from the institution has really helped all of the members. It gives them a means to work and contribute income to their families. It really helps now that the country’s economy is in crisis, and their husbands incomes do not cover the expenses of the children going to school. They will use the loan they are asking for to make and buy products to sell like corn, wood, plastic bags, fresh meat, dried chilies to prepare mole, groceries, soft drinks, shipping charges for those who buy articles by catalog, rent for boats, and gasoline for those who sell fresh fish. They hope that the Realidad Foundation will continue to offer financial services. They are dependent upon them to keep working and to have a business in the future that generates income and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials and products to sell

loans.name: Mary Niza

texts.en: Mary Niza E. is from the town of Manticao. She is 29 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Mary Niza owns and operates a business raising livestock. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Mary Niza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros L. is from Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old. L. is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, L. owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for sale. The main source of income for the business comes from selling pigs. Milagros has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Milagros joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milagros has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from GDMPC. Milagros is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used purchased additional feed for her pigs. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Milagros from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase feed for the pigs

loans.name: Maryserah

texts.en:
Maryserah is a 26 year old married mother of two. She runs a dairy in Machakos, a busy market town near Nairobi. She has been in this business for three years and previously ran a salon, which she closed because it was not financially stable. Maryserah earns extra income selling potatoes. Her husband is employed as a security guard.  

She is requesting a loan for 20,000 Kenyan shillings, which she will use along with some savings to buy: buckets and a gauge for 4,000 shillings, coolant for 6,000 shillings, and a counter for 15,000 shillings. She hopes to expand the business into a wholesale supplier, getting milk direct from farmers, and also to revive her salon along with a training school for salon workers. She describes herself as hardworking, capable, and able to exploit any opportunity.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Nsasa Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Rose is 36 years old and the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is married and has 4 children aged 12 – 18 years, all of whom attend secondary school. She hopes to see her children achieve the highest possible level of education.  

Rose has a drug shop business that she has owned for 10 years. Because she operates in a rural setting, many customers pay for her merchandise on credit, and though it is sometimes difficult to collect the money she is owed, she is still able to make 140,000 UGX in profit every week. She says that her good customer care keeps her customers coming back to her, which has allowed her to plan an expansion. She is a very determined lady, and she needs a loan to be able buy more drugs for her drug shop.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for resale

loans.name: Mable Amonya

texts.en:
Mable is married to Peter and they have one child, Nelson.

Mable was introduced to KADET through existing clients and she is servicing her second loan with no previous loan history. 

Mable has a primary school which she operates as her source of business. She shall use the entire loan to renovate the classrooms of her school. Her school is located in a densely populated area with low income earners, and thus most of her students come from within the area. Mable anticipates that she will be able to make some extra profits from which she will construct a more permanent structure and use it as a school. This will upgrade the school standard. 

Mable hopes to own a secondary school. She believes she is focused and innovative.

loans.use: to renovate the classrooms of her school

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida C. is a 52-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Panaquiao, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store, locally known as a 'sari-sari' store.

Nida’s husband Eduardo is 54 years old and works as a laborer in sugarcane plantation, and they have 6 children who are between 9 and 31 years old. Some of her children have work while the others are still attending school and also helping to run the business.

Nida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 in the hope that she would be able to help improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income, earning an additional Php 4,000 from her business activities.

Nida is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 12,000 was used to fund operations of her sari-sari store, and it had a positive impact in both the business and improving the family’s living conditions. Now she is requesting her 5th loan, in the amount of Php 12,000, which she intends to use on general store business. Nida is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M., age 44, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Mercelito M., a driver and mechanic, and they are blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn income so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own automotive repair shop and eatery for eleven years.

Erlinda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her automotive repair shop and eatery.   

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business. She plans to use the loan funds to buy supplies for her automotive repair shop and ingredients that she needs for her recipes.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have a good and comfortable life with her family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her automotive repair shop and ingredients for her recipes.

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
This group of entrepreneurs named their group 'In God We Trust'. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their families' well-being. 

Alpha Y. K. pictured on the left is the leader of this group. Alpha was born in one of the villages that make up Sanda, in northern Sierra Leone. The 55-year-old is married to a businesswoman and they have 4 children. Three of his children are in secondary school and one is in primary school. For 15 years now, Alpha has been selling different types of bags – traveling bags, school bags, etc. With his share of the loan, Alpha will buy dozens of bags to add to his business.

loans.use: Buy dozens of bags to add to his business

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es:
La  Señora Luisa Amanda C. Velásquez, Labora como conserje en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de Managua, ella tiene tres  hijos a su cargo,  y estos  se encuentran en edad escolar, es madre soltera, ha trabajado un crédito con CEPRODEL durante un años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como, zinc y perlines para cambiar el techo de su casa de habitación ya que las que este se encontraba en mal estado..
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Luisa dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luisa Amanda C. V. is a caretaker at the Manuel Olivares Rodriguez Institute in Managua. She is a single mother with three school-age children. Luisa has been working with CEPRODEL for a year. Thanks to CEPRODEL funding, she has been able to invest in some home improvements. This new loan will help Luisa afford building materials like zinc and shingles, which she can use to repair her roof. The point of all this is to provide her children with more security and a higher standard of living. Luisa says the loan will help her improve the quality of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repairs and renovation.

loans.name: Raoufath

texts.fr: Née en 1977 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, O. Raoufath vit depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Agbodjèdo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Raoufath est mariée à GBADAMASSI Latifou, un imprimeur, et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Raoufath vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs différents besoins. Raoufath n'a jamais été à l'école. Il y a près de sept ans que Raoufath mène comme activité la vente de tissus et des produits de beauté de façon ambulante. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé au Togo, que Raoufath se ravitaille. Raoufath a bénéficié autrefois de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Aujourd'hui encore, Raoufath sollicite un troisième prêt, en vue d'élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. Par ricochet, Raoufath pourra se faire plus de revenu et améliorer son niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Born in 1977 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, Raoufath O. has lived for around ten years in the Agbodjèdo district of Cotonou. Raoufath is married to Latifou GBADAMASSI, a printer, and has three children, all of whom are at school. Raoufath lives alone with her children and provides for their various needs herself. She has never been to school. She has for almost seven years been running a business selling fabrics and beauty products on a door-to-door basis. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market, and in Lomé in Togo. Raoufath has benefited in the past from two loans from ALIDé and repaid them correctly. Today, she is applying for a third loan with a view to increasing the level of her activity and to being able to respond better to her customers' demands. Indirectly this would allow her to make more money and improve her life.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Penh

texts.en:
Mr. Penh S. is 53 years old and he lives in Angk village in Kandal province. He is a government worker who can only get a low salary to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Man Yorn, is a farmer who owns 3.571 hectares of land to cultivate rice on to support her family. 

Now they have a problem because it is the right time to do farming on their rice field in the dry season, but they did not have money to do this. Thus, Mr. Penh S. decided to ask for a loan to do farming in this current year. He is the father of three children of whom all are attending local public school. His wife is also in the photo.

loans.use: To do dry season farming

loans.name: Agatona

texts.en: Agatona Q. is from the village of Talisay, Gingoog City. She is 39 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Agatona owns and operates a business buying copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production) in the local community and selling it in the city. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Agatona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase more copra to sell. Agatona is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be her 5th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more copra to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 40-year-old married man from Lebanon. He has three people living in his household. He has a business polishing cars. He has been operating this business since 1999 and has been working in the field for 21 years. He is proud of his fast and high quality services. He notes that he has faced some challenges in developing his business due to the war in Lebanon and lack of adequate financing.

He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner. He plans to use the loan to make improvements to his house, specifically painting it. He believes that these improvements will have a positive impact on his family. This will be his second loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To make improvements to his house

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary C. is from the town of Banga. She is 35 years old. Mary is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Mary owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Mary has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Mary joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Mary is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the third loan taken out by Mary from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Madame Maimouna Sangaré est une femme mariée de 44 ans et mère de 4 enfants.  Elle vit dans une famille polygame avec son mari, ses enfants et sa coépouse dans le quartier Médine de Bougouni. 
Elle a vite abandonné l’école au profit des activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat  vente de légumes et des condiments alimentaires. Elle a appris cette activité  auprès de sa grande mère.
 Avec plus d’une quinzaine d’année d’expérience, Madame Maimouna Sangaré maîtrise  bien son activité et est très appréciée au marché de Bougouni. 
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, Maimouna décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle  est à son premier prêt.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, une grande quantité de légumes dans les villages environnants  de Sikasso auprès des producteurs et dans la foire hebdomadaire.
Elle effectue sa vente au grand marché de Bougouni à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs.
Elle espère réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000FCFA. 
Avec ce bénéfice elle compte agrandir son entreprise afin de devenir une grossiste.
texts.en:
Ms. Maimouna Sangaré is a 44-year-old married woman and the mother of four children.  She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, children, and co-wife in the Médine district of Bougouni. She had soon dropped out of school in favor of revenue-generating businesses, especially the buying and selling of vegetables and condiments.  She learned this business from her grandmother.  With over fifteen years of experience, she has a good command of her business and is much appreciated at the Bougouni market. In order to satisfy her clearly-growing customer base, Maimouna decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her first loan.  She intends to use this loan for buying a large quantity of vegetables from producers in the village surrounding Sikasso and at the weekly fairs. She makes her sales at the big market of Bougouni to a customer base composed of retailers and consumers.  With this loan, she hopes to make a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA.  She plans on using the profits to expand her enterprise in order to become a wholesale merchant. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying vegetables

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon Q. is from the village of Napisik, Sulipat. She is 32 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. Corazon owns and operates a quarrying business, primarily selling sand and gravel in the local community. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns a monthly net income of 7,200 PHP. 

In 2004, Corazon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to invest in expanding the business. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used use as start-up capital for food vending. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Corazon from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: start-up capital for a new business venture in food vending

loans.name: Progreso Hacia Adelante 1, 2 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Miguelina is the coordinator of her group, Progreso Hacia Adelante (Forward Progress). She makes her home in a simple structure with her longterm partner and two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to raise her children in the community they live in. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying cooking.

Miguelina is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for two years. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying rice, beans, chicken and oil. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business.

This associate began with Esperanza because she wanted to earn more money and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Miguelina’s group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for its baseball players and its sugarcane industries. The main economic activity is the free-trading zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy more rice, beans, chicken and oil to cook and sell

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La Sra. Aurora G. tiene 35 años, esta casada con el Sr. Jose Vargas, juntos tienen 2 hijos, los cuales acuden a la escuela cerca de su domicilio. 

La Sra. Aurora vende comida en su mismo domicilio, prepara platos tipicos como majadito y otros platos como charque, chicharron de chanco. El Sr. Jose es constructor Albañil, se dedican a estas actividades desde hace ya mucho  tiempo, por lo cual tienen los ingresos necesarios para la educacion de sus hijos y gastos familiares en general.

Requieren del Préstamo para finalizar la construcción de su vivienda y asi darles mejor condicion de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aurora G., 35, is married to Mr. José Vargas. They have two children who go to a school near their home. Aurora sells home-made food. She prepares typical regional dishes like majadito (shredded, dried meat with tomatoes and other ingredients; sometimes served with a fried egg on top) and others like charque (salted beef), chicharrón (fried pork rinds). José works in construction as a bricklayer. They have been in these occupations for a long time now so they earn sufficient income to pay for their children’s education and general family expenses. They need the loan to finish building their house so that they can thus provide better living conditions for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home construction.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Suon L., 45, is a widow who lives with two children and her father in Takeo province. Since 2007, she has been selling cakes and is able to make about US$ 1.50 in profit each day.  Her children are garment factory workers, making US$ 2 each per day. Suon L. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Roxanne Faith

texts.en:
Roxanne Faith M. is from the village of Sinian Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. Roxanne Faith owns & operates an agricultural business, raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Roxanne Faith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. This will be the first loan taken out by Roxanne Faith from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Mrs. Chan Rein Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, located I. Ou Kralang Duol village I. Takeo province, is made up of twenty people. They have selected Mrs. Chan R., who was born I. 1965, as the village bank president. They will each use their portion of the loan I. various ways to improve their family's standard of living.  

Mrs. Chan R. is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She has a problem because her field has infertile soil. So, to improve her rice production, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire a machine to plow her field. 

She is the mother of three children, one of whom is a seamstress I. a garment factory, another one is a construction worker, and the third is a student. Her husband, Mr. Pheap Ngen, is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita R. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. She is 33 years old. Cristita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Cristita runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income comes from selling food and daily use products. Cristita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Cristita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cristita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Cristita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP that she will use as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This loan is her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation.  Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template to help field partners post their loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Working capital and to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan vive en el pueblo de Achacachi con su familia. El es productor lechero y a la vez es sastre, la producción de leche es su principal fuente de ingresos para su manutención.
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera, el cual le permitirá incrementar su producción de leche. 

Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Juan lives in the village of Achacachi with his family. He is a dairy farmer and also a tailor. The milk production is his main source of income to support himself.

Juan will use this loan to purchase a dairy cow, which will enable him to increase his milk production.

This is his first loan with Impro.

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es:
Fausto C. C. tiene 31 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

FAUSTO  pertenece a la Ventanilla Casaiche Chilipamba ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería como vacas lecheras y chanchos, esta ventanilla tiene 20 miembros.

FAUSTO se dedica a la agricultura de maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y a la ganadería cría vacas lecheras, las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y animales para engordar y después vender. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es ponerse comprar casa, carro y terrenos para tener sus animales.
Le gustaría hacer deporte
texts.en:
Fausto C. C. is 31 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and 3 children.  He lives in Guaranda canton in Bolívar province.

Fausto belongs to the Casaiche Chilipamba solidarity group which is located half an hour from Guaranda.  It is a group that works in agriculture and farming livestock such as dairy cows and pigs.  The group has 20 members.

Fausto grows corn, wheat, beans and potato and also raises dairy cows.  He makes his purchases in Guaranda and sells in the wholesale market in the same town.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies for sowing corn, wheat, beans and potatoes and also animals to fatten and then sell.  The support from the loan will help him to fulfil his family's financial needs.  His dream is to be able to buy a house, car and land for his animals.

He likes to take part in sports.

loans.use: To buy supplies for sowing corn, wheat, beans and potatoes.  To buy animals to fatten and then sell

loans.name: Aurelie

texts.en:
Aurelie is 49 years old. She is married and has nine children who are between 5 and 25 years old. All her children go to school and her husband works as a businessman as well. Aurelie sells a variety of commodities in her shop, such as sugar, beans, potatoes and maize flour, and has five years experience working in this business.

She says that her business is successful because it has allowed her to look after her family and pay her children's school fees. She has requested a loan to add more commodities for sale and hopes to buy livestock and rent a business house from the profits of this business. She dreams to own a big shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, potatoes and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Divina Chelegat

texts.en:
Divina Chelagat K. is a 47-year-old lady.  She is a widow and has two children.  They live in Eldoret town in a place called Road block, where her business is situated. She has been in this business for three years now and she gets a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be Divina's first loan from KADET and she plans to buy timber for carpentry work.  With the income, she will buy more varnish (oil used to apply on the final finish of finished product to make the furniture shine), buy more timber, and also pay for labour for her workers. 

In the future she plans to continue educating her children to the highest level, and also open another shop for her business.

loans.use: To buy timber for capentry work

loans.name: Mukisa Development Group-Mpigi

texts.en: 35-year-old Florence K. has been in retail for the last four years. She credits her husband with coming up with the idea of starting this business. Florence is happily married with three kids. Before starting this business, she was working in a construction company. She now has her own small construction company. At her shop, she mostly sells home supplies such as soap, sugar, and bread. This business generates 350,000 shillings in profits monthly. With this loan, Florence, who belongs to Mukisa development group, says she is going to buy more goods for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more goods for resale

loans.name: Edelmira De Los Angeles

texts.es: Edelmira De Los Ángeles tiene 39 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este medio de vida que con mucho entusiasmo ha logrado obtener, ella es una persona muy luchadora  inicio este medio de vida porque algunos familiares le proporcionaban ciertos productos para que Edelmira los ofreciera fue así con el paso del tiempo que logro obtener su propio negocio. El crédito está destinado para la compra de calzado, perfumes, ropa en general, toallas entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Edelmira De Los Ángeles is 39. She sells general merchandise. She has had this way of life for over 7 years and achieved it with great enthusiasm. She is a very hard-working person. She started this business because some family members gave her some products to sell. With the passing of time she was able to have her own store. The loan will be used to purchase shoes, perfumes, general clothing and towels, among other items.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Gulzamira's Group

texts.en:
Women are vulnerable members of community. In Kyrgyzstan their rights are well-guarded by NGOs and legal foundations. But every woman has a special strength inside--a mother instinct, when a child can become an iron stimulus for overcoming all life's hardships. Gulzamira is a happy mother of three children and has a special story to tell.

Gulzamira J., 41, is the leader of this group. She’s been running a clothing sales business in a market in a small town called Tashkomur. While Gulzamira is at work, her three children have to wait for their mother to come home in the evenings. She sells retail while buying wholesale goods imported from China. 

Gulzamira is a very skilled saleswoman; she knows how to find an individual approach to every customer and always ends up persuading them to buy something more. She does a lot to attract as many customers as possible, because the competition is strong. She is very concerned with the types of clothing she has, therefore she tries to follow customers’ tastes, styles, and pricing preferences. With this loan she wants to buy winter clothing of a variable assortment. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar S. is 31 years old and single. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last seven years in Kitale town, western Kenya. His main products are eggs and vegetables that are all sold locally.

Edgar has requested a loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry farm. The extra income from the sale of eggs will help him improve his livelihood and pay school fees for his siblings. He plans to expand his poultry farming and acquire a posho mill (a mill that grinds wheat or maize into flour) in the next five years.

loans.use: For poultry farming

loans.name: Eligio

texts.en:
This is Eligio B., 52, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Josephina B., a housewife, and is father to their children. By the grace of God, Eligio has managed to support his children's schooling. At this time, he is working hard to send his children all the way through college. This is a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Eligio, as he himself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Eligio operates their jeepney service, which is basically used for public transportation.  He is also a farmer who grows, tends and harvests his own crop from his land. He mostly grows seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines, like pineapples, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. Also in his product inventory are garlic and onions, tomatoes and other staples for simple cooking recipes. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a small income of around Php400 every day on his jeepney operation.

To help him continue the operation of his business, he is requesting a Php9,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizers, seedlings and other farming needs for the crop. He will also use part of this loan to pay for the cost of renewing the registration of his jeepney. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 
 
Eligio dreams to be able to give his children a good and high quality education through all his hard work in his business. He faithfully meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: For the renewal of the registration for his jeepney, and for planting materials for his farm

loans.name: Sara Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Sara Patricia H. A. ella es trabajadora activa de una entidad estatal de San Rafael del desempeñándose en el cargo de asistente de tesorería tiene Veinte y tres años  de trabajar para esta institución, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  siete créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Sara Patricia H. A. currently works for a government organization in San Rafael as the assistant treasurer, and has worked for this organization for twenty three years. She is married. She has had seven loans with CEPRODEL and each one has been used to purchase building materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, etc., to improve and enlarge the house where she lives. These loans with CEPRODEL have been of great help to her since through them she has improved her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials - sand, cement, stone, blocks, etc.

loans.name: Jose Lizandro

texts.es:
Jose de 35 años, tiene una pequeña tienda hace 6 años atrás. Poco a poco ha comenzado a surtir su negocio con víveres y papelería. En la actualidad trabaja con ayuda de su esposa. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso siempre quiere surtirlo con víveres y papelería como cuadernos, plumas, bebidas, snack etc. Tiene con su esposa tres hijos de 8, 5 y 2 años de edad por eso quiere el préstamo para tener mas ingresos y darle una mejor vida. Con el préstamo quiere comprar snack, bebidas, cuadernos etc.
texts.en:
José is 35 years old and has owned a small store for 6 years.  He has gradually stocked his business with food and stationery products.  His wife currently helps him in his work.

José has many aspirations for his business.  For this reason, he always wants to keep it stocked with food and stationery products such as exercise books, pens, drinks, snacks, etc.  He and his wife have three children aged 8, 5 and 2.  He would like this loan so that he can make more income and provide his children with a better life.  He will use his money to buy snacks, drinks, exercise books, etc.

loans.use: to buy snacks, drinks and exercise books

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: Gregorio, de 49 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Fidelia de 50 años y su hijo menor Rogelio de 24 años, a quienes dese brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Cuando era niño, los padres de Gregorio le enseñaron todo lo que debía saber de la chacra y poco a poco a medida que pasaba el tiempo, él se fue encargando de las tierras de sus padres. Ahora tiene extensas tierras de cultivo, en las cuales cosecha café y plátano, para luego venderlos en el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que es la actividad que le da de comer a su familia, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es cuidar sus productos de las plagas. Desea con muchas ganas, comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda transportar sus productos. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es un socio muy solidario con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en: Gregorio is 49 years old, he is a simple hard-working man.  He lives in his own home alongside his wife Fidelia who is 50 years old and his youngest son Rogelio who is 24 years old whom he wants to provide a better quality of life to.  When he was a kid, Gregorio's parents taught him everything he needed to know about farming. Little by little as time passed on, he became in charge of his parent's land.  He now has extensive land to cultivate where he grows coffee and bananas to later sell at market in the city of Pichanaki. The part he likes most about his job is cultivating the land since this activity is what feeds his family.  He has been farming for 12 years and considers protection against plagues to be the most difficult.  He very much wishes to purchase an automobile so that he can transport his products with it.  This is his 8th loan with MFP; he was always been punctual with his payments and hopes to do the same now.  He is a very supportive member with his communal bank and his fellow members.  With the 2,500 Nuevos Soles he requested, he will purchase more fertilizer to improve his crop.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cigarettes, body creams, mattresses, palm-oil, rice, soap, toothpaste, etc. in larger quantities

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en: Raymond is 29 years old and lives in West Point. He’s single and has one child, age 3. Raymond has been selling men shoes for 11 years now and needs to expand his business since his shop is very small. He’s requesting a loan to purchase more shoes for his business. In the future, Raymond plans to build houses and invest in farming.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for his business

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis Alfredo nació en la ciudad de Puno, tiene 56 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con sus 3 hijos. Desde dos años y medio que tiene un pequeña restaurante – pollería, Luis Alfredo es el administrador de su restaurante que tiene como nombre particular “El Fogón”. Luis Alfredo tiene crédito con  la Asociación Arariwa, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal “Templo del Inca” porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, será para implementar el local para brindar mejor el servicio y desea comprar ollas, cocinas y muebles.
 
Luis Alfredo es persona emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante sus hijos y su sueño es abrir una cadena de restaurantes - pollerias.
texts.en:
Luis Alfredo was born in the city of Puno. He is 56 years old and lives in the city of Cuzco with his 3 children. For two years and a half he has had a small restaurant, a chicken restaurant. Luis Alfredo is the manager of his restaurant, which is named “El Fogón”. Luis Alfredo has a loan with the Asociación Arariwa. He is very happy to know that he has financial support, since he has always shown himself to be responsible with his payments. He also enjoys being a part of his community bank called “Templo del Inca” [Inca Temple], because all of its members are responsbible and very supportive. He is grateful to those people who will be the lenders and it will be very useful in his business' progress. With the loan he is asking for he will outfit his locale to offer a better service. He wants to buy pots, stoves and furniture.  
 
Luis Alfredo is an enterprising and hardworking person who is getting his children ahead. His dream is to open a chain of chicken restaurants.

loans.use: to offer better service, and to buy pots, stoves and furniture.

loans.name: Rosa Narciza

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa Narciza D. 50 años D. edad tiene casa propia la cual se encuentra ubicada en el caserio D. Casablanca. Vive con su hijo. La Sra. Rosa se dedica a la venta D. cerveza desD. hace mas D. 8 años. Está solicitando el crédito para incrementar la compra D. cerveza. Su sueño segun nos comenta es incrementar el negocio. La Sra. está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a tráves D. este financiamiento.
texts.en: Rosa is 50 years old and has her own home in the hamlet of Casablanca, where she lives with her son. She has maD. a living selling beer for more than eight years. She is requesting the loan to increase her beer purchases. Her dream is to expand her business. Rosa is very grateful for the support we are providing through this loan.

loans.use: to increase her beer purchases.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is from the village of Elburgon, Narok-Kenya.  She is 41 years old, married and has five school-aged children.  She has been practicing mixed farming for about eight years and earns KES 26,400 in a month. 

She has never borrowed from any other MFI and this is her first loan which she plans to use to buy farm supplies like manure, seeds and insecticides. 

She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: buy farm supplies like manure, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
A married mother of five, Luisa is 62 years old and lives in Lower Salug Daku, Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur, where she has been growing rice to earn a living for 20 years. She has also been an elected Barangay Councilor for more than nine years.

A member of Paglaum Multipurpose Cooperative for almost two years, Luisa has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers for her rice field, and hopes to produce even more rice in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her rice field.

loans.name: Marlon Anibal

texts.es:
Marlon, vive con sus padres, es soltero, no tiene hijos, pero si dos hermanos de 13 y 10 años de edad, él se dedica a la agricultura  junto a su padre, trabaja todos los días de la semana iniciando a las 6:00am. Por el momento están sembrando maíz con su padre pero necesitan abono y fertilizantes para fortalecer la plantación.
Él solicita un préstamo para adquirir los insumos agrícolas, que son tan necesarios para el desarrollo del maíz, con el que espera no correr el riesgo de que sus cultivos se vean dañados por plagas.
Para Marlon su propósito es apoyar a sus padres con el trabajo diario, para poder sustentar las necesidades del hogar y ayudar a sus hermanos menores.
texts.en:
Marlon lives with his parents.  He’s single and has no children but he does have two siblings who are 13 and 10 years old.  He is a farmer alongside his father.  He works every day of the week starting at 6 in the morning.  For the moment, he and his father are farming corn but they need manure and fertilizer to strengthen the crops.

He is asking for a loan to acquire farming supplies which are so very necessary for the corn’s development and that he hopes will keep him from running any risk of having his crops damaged by infestations.  For Marlon, his goal is to support his parents with daily work to meet household expenses and help his younger siblings.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.pt:
