Nasceu na Cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, ao sul de Mocambique casado e pai de 3 filhos de idades entre 4 a 11 anos de idade.Fez a 11ª classe e parou por falta de condicoes financeiras. vive na casa propria EM  BOANE ( PROVINCIA DE MAPUTO) com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mãe enviando dinheiro para ajudar nas despesas alimentares.
Nunca saiu de Maputo PROVINCIA, é funcionario permanente no Ministerio da Educaçã ha 17 anos e trabalha numa Escola como docente. Tem um  salario mensal de 11.500.00mt e um rendimento no seu negocio de venda de roupa usada diversa onde tambem consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos.Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem são clientes e este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (fardos de roupa usada para homens e mulhers, e outros), os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 8.400.00mt, 15.000.00mt, 20.000.00mt, e 32.000.00mt, todos para sua obra. 
Sonha em ampliar o seu negocio construindo um estabelecimento de venda, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Salvador was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of that same name, south of Mozambique. He’s married and the father of 3 children, aged between 4 and 11. He completed 11th grade and stopped due to a lack of financial means. He lives in his own house in Boane (Maputo Province) with his family and also supports his mother by sending her money to help with her food expenses.
He has never left the province of Maputo where he has been a permanent employee of the Ministry of Education for 17 years and works as a teacher at a school. He has a monthly salary of 11,500 meticals (MZN) and an income from his second-hand clothing sales business of around 5,000MZN, some of which he spends on household expenses and some of which he saves in his bank account.
He has never had loans from any other banks. He heard about Hluvuku through friends who are also Hluvuku clients and this is his fifth loan with Hluvuku for the value of 20,000MZN, with which he intends to buy products (bundles of second-hand clothes for men and women, amongst others). His first loans were for: 8,400MZN, 15,000MZN, 20,000MZN and 32,000MZN, all for his build work.
He dreams of expanding his business by building a commercial establishment, for which he intends to take out more loans with Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase bundles of second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, la señora Maria Eugenia se dedica arduamente a laborar como secretaria de oficinay se dedica a esta labor desde hace sietes años. Es soltera, tiene a su cargo tres hijos.

Actualmente ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para pagar gasto de consumo de energia y recibo de agua y saldar otra deuda de prestamo, por medio de esta obra brindarle mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Eugenia works arduously as an office secretary in the Managua municipality.  She has been doing this for seven years.  She is single, and she has three children under her care.

She has now come to Ceprodel to request a loan to pay for electricity expenses, the water bill, and another debt from a loan.  This will give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for some personal expenses.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Leonila has a food shop where she sells home made ice creams. She has had this business for 2 years. She is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making home made ice cream.

Leonila is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Leonila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making home made ice cream.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 35-year-old married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 14 years old.

Jessica is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She helps her husband till their land and plant rice. She also raises pigs and ducks to help augment their income. Jessica plans to use her loan to purchase feeds, fertilizers and herbicides.

In the future, Jessica hopes to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Pho

texts.en:
Pho sells recycling materials and drives an auto rickshaw. His wife Navy is a garment worker. They have been married since 1990 and have five children -three sons and two daughters. The family lives along National Road Number 6, about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

All of Pho’s children are in school, and one of them is in university. So, Pho his asking for another loan of $300 to pay the school fees for his son who is in university.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for his son who is in university.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a 54-year-old married woman with five children. The oldest child is 29 years old.

Rufina is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Rufina is able to buy their basic needs through her income from the farm. She has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. Rufina hopes to continue farming and earning.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. She is 41 and married, and she has four children between 19 and 4 years old. All are in  school. 

She has been in the farming business for 10 years, producing maize and eggs for the local market. She also trades in cereals in the local market for additional income.

Joyce has made a loan request of 80,000 KES with Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry birds and build a bigger and better poultry unit in her farm. This is her third loan after two of 40,000 KES each. She says the loans have been beneficial and she hopes the third one will boost her business more by enabling her to buy more birds and build a bigger unit and help her meet her family's needs, especially educating her children.

She hopes to be the major supplier of eggs in the area.

She laments the high costs of feeds in farming.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds and build a better poultry unit.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: El señor Edwin es productor lechero  también vende afrecho.  Con el dinero del crédito adquirirá ganado lechero, un par de vacas lecheras para aumentar la producción de leche y sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Laja  en la provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz; es soltero  y  no tiene hijos. Esta es la primera vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva. Es cliente Impro desde el año 2010.
texts.en: Edwin is a dairy farmer; he also sells bran.  He will use the money from the loan to buy dairy cattle: a pair of dairy cows to increase milk production and his income.  He lives in a house of his own located in Laja, Los Andes Province in La Paz Department.  He’s single and has no children.  This is the first time his loan will be channeled through Kiva.  He has been an Impro client since 2010.

loans.use: to buy a pair of dairy cows.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha a 47-year-old housewife married to Harb, a 52-year-old man who works in a printing house.

Aisha and her husband started a small business buying large quantities of salt and different types of spices and re-packing then in small packages or small amounts that are not available in the market in special packages of her design. 

Aisha’s husband helps her in printing the packages and in the marketing process. Now Aisha wants to expand her business by buying more spices that are still not included in what she sells, hoping that one day she will be able to open her own spices store in the area.

Because Aisha is a conservative person, she asked her husband to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: To buy more spices to sell

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 49 years old,  married, and has five children between ages of 14 and 27. She sells potatoes and charcoal, which she has been doing for six years. 

Claudine is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more potatoes and charcoal to sell. The profits will be used to pay school fees and for saving for her future. Claudine would love to see her business prosper and run her own charcoal store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal  and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica, de 26 años de edad, es una mujer extrovertida y muy sociable, además de trabajadora y emprendedora. Es soltera, vive en compañía de su padre, su madre, sus dos hermanos de 24 y 15 años de edad, y su abuela, instalados cómodamente en casa de sus padres. Mónica se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa de vestir de damas, además de lencerías, para eso cuenta con el apoyo de su tía que vive en la ciudad de Lima y cada fin de mes le envía la mercadería, y luego ella realza la venta a sus amistades y vecinos en forma personal en su casa. Desde hace 4 años que se dedica a éste negocio, tiempo que le valió para ser conocida en su zona. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder contar con un ingreso económico para solventar algunos gastos personales y de sus estudios universitarios, así como el tiempo que le deja para poder dedicarse a ellos. Sin embargo la impuntualidad de algunos clientes le perjudican en el pago de la mercadería que compraron. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, está agradecida con el apoyo financiero, por eso se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de vestir femenino, en mayor volumen y a menor precio, para así obtener un mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Mónica, age 26, is an outgoing and sociable woman. In addition, she is enterprising and a hard worker. Mónica is single and lives with her father, mother, two brothers (ages 24 and 15), and her grandmother. They all live comfortably at her parents’ house. Mónica sells women’s clothing and lingerie. She has the help of her aunt who lives in the city of Lima and sends her merchandise every month. Mónica sells her products to her friends and neighbors by visiting them in person at their homes. She has been in this business for four years and has become known in her area. What she likes about her work is being able to generate an income so that she can pay for some of her personal expenses and her university studies. The time she has remaining is devoted to her education. However, some of her customers are late in submitting payments for the merchandise they purchased.

This will be her third loan with the MFP organization. Mónica is grateful for the financial support. For this reason, she promises to complete her payments. The amount she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of women’s clothing so that she can acquire a large volume at a lower price. This will help increase her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing.

loans.name: Calvery Shg Group

texts.en:
Ellah is the facilitator of the Calvery SHG group. Ellah and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ellah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Ellah joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Ellah had a very good maize yield, harvesting 15 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ellah was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Ellah will invest in livestock rearing and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Calvery SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Ellah with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sidy  Ndiaye

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié , père de trois enfants qui vont tous à l'école.Il exerce le métier de chauffeur de car de transport de touristes qu'ils conduit dans les différentes sites culturels du pays.En outre, il dispose d'un véhicule de transport urbain.Les revenus que génère ce taxi lui permettent d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.Il parvient ainsi , chaque mois à  payer les frais scolaires de ses trois enfants, les factures d'eau, d'électricité ainsi que ses charges locatives.Malheureusement, depuis deux mois, le moteur du taxi est tombé en panne , le plongeant ainsi dans des difficultés pour une prise en charge correcte des besoins de sa famille. Afin de réparer le véhicule, il sollicite un prêt de 400000f pour acheter un autre moteur.Son ambition est de relancer et d'élargir ses activités.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married man, the father of three children who all attend school. His job is driving a bus transporting tourists whom he conveys to various cultural sites in the country. Moreover, he has an urban transport vehicle. The income from this taxi allows him to improve living conditions for his family. In this way, he manages every month to pay the school fees for his three children, the bills for water and electricity and his rent. 

Unfortunately, for two months now, the taxi's motor has been out of commission, causing him difficulty in supporting his family correctly. In order to repair that vehicle, he is asking for a loan of 400,000 francs to buy another motor. His ambition is to get his businesses going again and expand them.

loans.use: to buy another motor.

loans.name: Djibairou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Djibairou  est commerçant depuis plus de 16 ans .Il est âgé de  29 ans et marié donc une personne responsable qui répond aux exigences de la dépense quotidienne.
Le crédit va lui servir acheter des tissus. Avec les bénéfices des son activité il pense à ouvrir une autre boutique
texts.en:
Djibairou has been in retail for over 16 years. He is 29 and married, which makes him a responsible person who can deal with daily expenses.
Thanks to this loan, he will be able to buy fabrics. With the profits generated by this activity, he plans on opening another store.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Cecilia Maria

texts.es:
Cecilia de 28 años de edad, es una mujer casada y junto a su esposo tienen 3 preciosos hijos a los cuales adora mucho. Ella y su familia viven actualmente en casa de los padres de su esposo, quienes le han brindado gentilmente un espacio para tener su negocio y pueda salir adelante como familia; Cecilia tiene una bodega, en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, arroz, azúcar, leche, enlatados, entre otros, ella lleva aproximadamente trabajando en su negocio desde hace 8 años, los que han sido de lucha constante y de perseverancia, tuvo la idea de tener este negocio debido a que en su ciudad se viene trabajando un proyecto, el cual consiste en transportar gas a través de unos tubos que pasan por diversas ciudades del sur del Perú, a raíz de ello habían muchas personas que laboran en este proyecto y necesitaban comprar productos de primera necesidad y es por ello que se animó a tener este negocio, también influyó que en los alrededores de su casa no se encontra ninguna otra bodega.

Cecilia  se ha esforzado mucho por salir adelante, antes de tener su negocio ella trabajaba como empleada del hogar, luego se dedico a la agricultura, a su vez su esposo logro ingresar al proyecto de transporte de gas como operario y no solo eso, desde entonces juntaron dinero para tener un negocio, al cual actualmente se dedica Cecilia, ella cree que le está logrando sus objetivos en el negocio por el buen trato que brinda a los clientes y porque tiene variedad en los productos que ofrece, pero sobre todo por su carisma que brinda en la atención.

Cecilia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que se le brindará, ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio y también remodelará su negocio, con esta mejora tendrá mas ingresos y su negocio se verá mucho más atractivo para los clientes, estos nuevos y mejores ingresos le permitiran ahorrar y cumplir su gran sueño: "Hacer de sus hijo unos profesionales de éxito"
texts.en:
Twenty-eight-year-old Cecilia is a married woman.  She and her husband have three beautiful children she adores.  She and her family currently live in her husband's parents' home.  They generously offered her a space for her business so they can all get ahead as a family.  Cecilia has a small grocery store in which she sells necessities such as groceries, rice, sugar, milk, and canned goods, among other things.  She has had her business for eight years and those years have been full of constant struggle and perseverance.  She got the idea to start this business because there is a construction project going on in her city to transport gas in tubes that pass through different cities in the south of Peru.  Because of this, there have been many people working on the project who needed to buy necessities and that is why she decided to set up this business.  She was also influenced by the fact that there isn't another grocery store near her house.

Cecilia has worked very hard to get ahead; before starting her business, she worked as a maid, then she worked in agriculture.  As far as her husband is concerned, he managed to get work in the gas transport project as a laborer.  What's more, from that moment they put money aside to start a business and that business is the one Cecilia currently has.  She believes that she is achieving her business goals because of her good customer service and because she offers variety in the products she carries, but most of all because of her charisma when helping customers.

Cecilia is very thankful to be a Kiva borrower because thanks to the support she will receive, she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business and she will also remodel it.  With these improvements, she will make more income and her business will look much more attractive for her customers.  This new, better income will allow her to save and achieve her greatest dream, which is to make her children successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to remodel her small grocery store

loans.name: Domithile

texts.en: Domithile is 40 years old. She has five children, three of whom are enrolled in school. Domithile sells food products, and she has been running this business for seven years. She has requested a loan to buy items such as beans and sorghum to sell. She plans to save the profits. In the future, Domithile would like to own a store.

loans.use: to buy additional food items to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a widowed woman. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Jannat

texts.en: Jannat is a 22 year-old, Lebanese single woman. She lives with her Parents and one sibling. Her parents cooperates together and represents the main source income. And as for her she is still attending university and works also as an nurse in a hospital in her town.  She is very tender and cares a lot about all of her family members. Today, she is eager to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to pay her university educational fees. She said that she is very happy with the loan that will allowed her to continue her education suitably

loans.use: to pay her university educational fees.

loans.name: Marie-José

texts.en:
Born in 1973 in Lome, Miss Marie-José L. is unmarried and cares for two children. After her training in hairstyle, she managed with some difficulty to open a salon which she maintains today with rigour and determination. The quality of the service that she offers grew an abundant but demanding customer base. She seeks to improve her service by selling all the beauty products (wicks, cream-coloured, etc.) in her salon. This new project of Miss L. requires financial means she currently does not have. For that purpose, she needs financial support. For this purpose that Miss L. requests a credit of $900. This credit will constitute the purchase of the wicks, of the cosmetic and different products. Thus, she will be able to modernize her salon, attracting more customers.

Translated from French by Farron Blanc, a Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1973 à Lomé, Mademoiselle L. Marie-José est célibataire et a à sa charge deux (02) enfants. Après sa formation en coiffure, elle est parvenue difficilement à ouvrir un salon qu’elle tient aujourd’hui avec rigueur et détermination. La qualité du service qu’elle offre lui a procuré une clientèle abondante mais plus exigeante. Elle cherche alors à améliorer sa prestation en vendant sur place dans son salon tous les produits de beauté (mèches, crème, etc.) Ce nouveau projet de Mlle L. demande assez de moyens financiers dont elle ne dispose pas actuellement. Pour y parvenir, elle a besoin d’un appui financier. C’est à cet effet que Mlle L. sollicite un crédit de $900. Ce crédit va constituer un fonds de commerce pour l’achat des mèches, des produits cosmétiques et autres. Ainsi, elle pourra moderniser son salon pour attirer plus de clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase hair dressing equipement

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a married man with three children who all depend on him. He currently specializes in selling sugar cane, mainly to school children. This small loan will enable him uplift his business.

Fred also plans to diversify into kiosk business to sell sweets and other small kiosk items prefered by school children. We are proud to be associated with this humble beginning and our desire is to see Fred established as a businessman. Well worthy of our support.

loans.use: Sugar Cane Seller

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.en:
Maria Virginia has been in the business of baking and pastrymaking for 12 years, she learned the profession from her mother. She had always wanted to have her own business in order to help with the family’s expenses. She began with this work that he knows perfectly, thanks to the quality of her products, the sales have increased and now she also supplies several businesses that are in the area of her home. Virginia is married and has two daughters who at present are studying and during their free time help her.

Virginia wants to make her business grow and to offer her products in a bigger number of establishments, for this reason she is requesting for a loan of $1,200, that she will use to buy the supplies needed in the elaboration of her products. She promises repay it over a period of 6 to 12 months. You can be a part in the development and success of her business, and therefore improve the quality of life of this family. Don’t hesitate and support her!

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 12 años Maria Virginia se dedica a la venta de repostería y panadería, oficio que aprendió de su madre y como siempre había querido tener su propio negocio para ayudar con los gastos de su hogar, lo empezó con esta labor que conoce perfectamente, gracias a la calidad de sus productos, las ventas se han incrementado y ahora surte también varios negocios que están cerca de su domicilio. Virginia es casada y tiene dos hijas que actualmente están estudiando y en sus ratos libres le ayudan en el negocio.

Virginia desea hacer creer su negocio y ofrecer sus productos en un mayor número de establecimientos, por lo que ahora solicita un crédito por $ 1,200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de los insumos que requiere en la elaboración de sus productos, ella se compromete a retornar esta cantidad en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes formar parte en el desarrollo y éxito de este negocio, y mejorar así la calidad de vida de esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Sang's son, 18 years old, works as a day laborer to take care of his mother who is 64. They borrowed $250 from a bank for the poor to buy a cow. Their average income is $16 per month per person. Sang wants to borrow $ 75 to invest in their livestock. Sang plans to repay the loan over the space of  5 months.

loans.use: expand their livestock

loans.name: Nália Paulina

texts.pt:
Nália Paulina V. is a 30-year-old single mother of 2. She lives in the Guava area of Maputo and runs a beauty shop in the ‘3 de Fevereiro’ neighborhood. She entered the program in March of this year with an initial loan of 6,000 MT (meticais) which was properly repaid. She is entering her second cycle with a loan of 12,000 MT to be repaid in 8 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Nália Paulina V. tem 30 anos de idade e mãe solteira de 2 filhos. Vive no bairro Guava em Maputo e tem um salão de beleza no bairro 3 de Fevereiro. Entrou para o programa em Março do presnte ano com um empréstimo inicial de 6.000MT e comportou-se muito bem no reembolso. Vai para o 2º ciclo e vai tomar 12.000Mt para pagar em 8 meses.

loans.use: Purchase products for the business

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma J. is 42-years-old and is raising 3 sons and 1 orphaned nephew with her husband. While her husband works as a driver for schools, transporting books and chemical equipment between Kenya and Tanzania, Salma decided to start 2 small businesses of her own.

Three years ago, Salma began working to supply eggs to various hotels and cafes around Dar es Salaam. At 6am on Mondays, Thursdays, and Sundays, she collects the eggs from the wholesalers and distributes them during the rest of the day. Buying a tray of 30 eggs for around $2.70, she can sell them for about $3.50. During certain festive seasons of the year, she travels to Zanzibar, an island 4 hours by ferry from Dar es Salaam, to sell trays there for about $6.40 each.

Salma’s second business is a fruit stand in front of their home, which she just opened 3 months ago. There, she sells mangos, papaya, watermelon, and bananas. In two weeks, she can make a profit of around $30 from her fruit sales.

Salma hopes to take out a loan to buy more eggs in order to increase her business as an egg-supplier. She belongs to the group Airport (due to their location near the national airport), which consists of 17 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to supply to hotels and cafes

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has a retail shop in Kiyinde. I’ve got to tell you, I think the women of Kiyinde are the main act. The men go fishing and the women run the joint while the men are out in their boats. But a few guys hold down the fort during the day. John is one of those guys. For the past nine years, John has been operating a retail store where he sells bread, maize flour, beans, sugar, popcorn, salt, cassava and other basic essentials.

John is married with 10 children and he takes care of 7 orphans. Actually, I have found that in the more remote villages there is a definite increase in the number of children in the families. When I came into Kiyinde on a one hour boda boda, motorbike, on a rutted dirt road, I was immediately taken by the number of children in town.

John has a very pleasant personality and his store serves a vital need in a village as remote as Kiyinde.

loans.use: John plans to use his loan to stock his store with bags of flour, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen sells Juanes in the town of Bellavista, San Martin.  Juanes is a dish typical of the region which consists of chicken and rice wrapped and cooked in a palm leaf.  Carmen sells her meals in the street because she doesn’t own or rent a locale; she doesn’t think it’s necessary.  She’s been selling her Juanes for 12 years and has many loyal customers. She says she always provides customer-oriented service and the best tasting food.

Carmen is 44 years old, married and has three grown children.  With hard work and savings, Carmen and her husband were able to buy a small home and send two of their children to University.  She started the business to help her family financially so their children would have more opportunities than they had previously.  

Carmen is a member of the community bank Mujeres del Futuro and is requesting a loan of NS./ 1000, that she will pay off in 6 months.  With the loan she would like to buy large quantities of rice, chicken, and cooking oil.  The large quantities will lower the cost necessary to prepare the Juanes and help her save even more money.  Carmen would one day like to improve and expand her family's home.

loans.use: Buy large quantities of rice, chicken and cooking oil.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is in her late fifties and she is the mother of four children. She has been separated from her husband for more than fifteen years. Since then, she has been working hard to lift her family up out of poverty. Brigida runs a liquor store which a large number of people visit day and night to purchase beer, wine, whisky, energizing beverages, and other alcoholic drinks. Brigida explains that ‘Presidente’ (the principal Dominican beer) is the most sold because "people consider it the best beer of the world and drink it as if it were water."

Brigida hopes that her business will help her buy her own house sooner or later. With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy more drinks to satisfy her customers’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase beverages for a liquor store

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix, 32, is a teacher. He's married and has a 3 year old son. His wife works as a caretaker at the same school where he works. They live in the "municipio" of Ticuantepe in the San Antonio Sur neighborhood of Managua. Felix has worked as a teacher for 13 years, leading classes for primary schood students. His goal is to continue to improve his professional skills and he's now studying English. He needs a loan to buy construction materials and build a garage on his house. Little by little, Felix has improved his house, all thanks to his own labor. He hopes to continue the work and improve the lives of his wife and small son.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Don Felix M. es un profesor de 32 años de edad, casado y tiene un pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad. Su esposa se desempeña como conserje del mismo Centro de Estudio donde labora Don Felix. Habitan en el municipio de Ticuantepe, en el barrio San Antonio Sur. Tiene 13 años de ejercer la profesión de maestro, se dedica a impartir clases al área de primaria. Su meta es seguir profesionalizandose, actualmente se encuentra estudiando el idioma inglés. Requiere del préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y construir el garaje de su vivienda, poco a poco Don Felix ha ido levantando su vivienda, y todo esto gracias a su trabajo. Desea poder seguir desempeñandose en su labor y salir adelante con su esposa y su pequeño niño.

loans.use: Buy building materials for a garage.

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es:
Señora Noemí is married and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. She has a one-year-old boy. Her husband is a cabinet maker, and he helps her a lot with their homes expenses. She decided to work on her own with the goal of making more income.

This woman's business is selling filing cabinets, display cabinets, and tires. She has always worried about offering good service to her customers and having high quality products. This is why she hopes that her business is more prosperous in the future. She is requesting this loan to buy filing cabinets, display cabinets, and tires to offer to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Noemí es casada, vive en el barrio Memorial Sandino, tiene un niño de 1 año de edad, su esposo es ebanista y le ayuda en gran medida con los gastos del hogar. Se decidió a trabajar por cuenta propia con el fin de percibir mayores ingresos.

El negocio de esta señora es vender archivos, vitrinas y llantas. Ella siempre se ha preocupado por brindar una buena atención a sus clientes y que sus productos sean de calidad. Es por esta razón que ella en un futuro espera que su negocio sea más próspero. Este préstamo lo esta solicitando para comprar archivos, vitrinas y llantas para ofrecele a sus clientes

loans.use: To purchase display cabinets, filing cabinets, and tires

loans.name: Sarmila

texts.en:
Sarmila S. is a resident of Thecho, Lalitpur. The majority of people living in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. Sarmila S. has four members including herself in her family. Her son is studying in grade 3 and her daughter is in pre-school. 
Her husband's name is Dev Krishna S.. He is a carpenter and opened his furniture shop 3 years ago. Her husband makes different varieties of furniture like beds, tables, chairs and wardrobes.  The family totally relies on shop income. Therefore Mrs. Mali seeks a $375 loan to buy timber to make enough furniture.

loans.use: To buy tumber

loans.name: Qadir

texts.en: Qadir N. is a 51-year-old man who has been breeding calves in the Internally Displaced People Settlement of Bilasuvar region since 1993. He is married and has five children. Qadir receives financial support of $70 US monthly from the government. But this is not enough considering the fact that Qadir is unemployed. His main source of income is calf breeding. He is applying for $1000 US to expand his number of calves by purchasing three calves for $300 US and fodder with the remaining money for $100 US.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary has been trading in the market for the past ten years. She is divorced with two children. Mary enjoys selling and is motivated to work hard because she dreams of a better future for her children. She trades onion, ginger and eggs. She wants to use the loan to buy and then sell rice, sugar and vegetable oil. She hopes to use part of her profits to support her children in school. She belongs to the community group called ‘Living Faith Trust Group’. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral  and provide peer pressure to repay loans.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar and vegetable oil for sale.

loans.name: Haitham's Harakati Group

texts.en:
Haitham is married with four children, aged 3, 5, 9, and 13. She has owned and run a school since 2004. She works at her business each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $200 (US Dollars) in sales.

Haitham hopes for a loan to buy more school items to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Zalhata, Sada, and Rabia who also have businesses.

loans.use: To buy more school items for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Bound

texts.fr:
Monsieur N. Bound est née le 23 juillet 1980 à Lomé la capitale du Togo. Il est célibataire et détient un établissement de débit de boisson dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Il a commencé cette activité depuis l’année 2005 et accueille bien ses clients. A côté de son bar dénommé « BOAD-LOI », il a crée un centre de diffusion de match de football permettant aux jeunes de son quartier d’être au parfum de l’actualité sportive mondiale. 
Après un prompt remboursement de son premier crédit, il sollicite ce second pour faire l’approvisionnement par l’achat de 50 casiers de sucreries et 65 casiers de bières. Ainsi avec le revenu de cette activité, il arrive à satisfaire ses besoins.
texts.en:
Mr. Bound N. was born on July 23, 1980 in Lomé, the capital of Togo. He is single and has a drinks outlet in the Agoè neighborhood in Lomé. He began this business in 2005 and is good at welcoming his customers. Next door to his bar called « BOAD-LOI », he has opened a hall showing football games so that the young people in his neighborhood can get a whiff of what's going on in the world of sports .

After having promptly reimbursed his first loan, he is asking for a second to stock up by buying 50 cases of soft drinks and 65 cases of beer. Thus, with the income from this business, he will be able to support himself.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin Peña tiene un taller donde realiza servicios  de muellería en automóviles y mantenimiento de los mismos en general. Su esposa es comerciante de camisas a detalle en la feria de la calle  Tumusla (feria popular de la ciudad de La Paz). Con ambas ocupaciones apenas cubren la  manutención de sus 6 hijos de 16, 14, 12, 10, 6, 4 años de edad. La familia vive en la casa de sus padres (no pagan alquiler) ubicada en la Zona Villa Huayna Potosí de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito será usado para comprar maquinaria (compresora y una gata hidráulica semi industrial) para facilitar y agilizar su trabajo. 
 
Es su cuarto crédito con Impro, su buen comportamiento de pago le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Martin Peña has a workshop where provides bodywork and general maintenance services for automobiles. His wife is a shirt seller in the Tumusla Street Market (popular market in the city of La Paz). With both occupations they just cover the basic needs of their 6 children who are 16, 14, 12, 10, 6, 4 years old. They live in her parents’ house (they do not pay rent) located in the Villa Huayna Potosí zone of the city of El Alto. This loan will be used to purchase machinery (compressor and a semi-industrial hydraulic press) to facilitate and improve his work. It is her fourth loan with Impro and her good payment behavior permits her to access another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Machinery

loans.name: Ni Ketut Murti

texts.id: Usaha beternak babi ini sudah lama ditekuni oleh Ni Ketut Murti usaha ini dilakukannya untuk membantu suaminya membiayai kebutuhan hidup keluarganya. Saat ini Ni Ketut Murti tinggal berdua dengan suaminya karena anaknya sudah menikah dan tinggal dengan keluarganya masing -masing. Ni Ketut Murti mengaku selama ini  ia sangat berkeinginan untuk mengembangkan usahanya, namun hal itu sulit dilakukanya karena modal usahanya yang pas-pasan sementara kebutuhan hidup keluarga yang semakin hari semakin meningkat. Dengan kandang yang sederhana Ni Ketut Murti memulai usahanya. Saat ini Ni Ketut Murti memelihara 1 ekor induk babi dan dalam waktu 6 bulan  sudah bisa menjual hasil ternaknya yaitu anak dari induk tersebut dengan sekali beranak bisa 8 sampai 10 ekor. Melalui program DINARI Ni Ketut Murti mendapat  pendampingan serta pinjaman modal usaha  sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,- dengan jangka waktu pinjaman selama 6 bulan dan pembayaran dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjamamn. Dengan tambahan modal tersebut Ni Ketut Murti menggunakan untuk membeli pakan dan satu bibit babi lagi sehingga Ni Ketut Murti berharap usahanya bisa lebih maju dan berkembang sehingga bisa mendapat panghasilan yang lebih meningkat dari hasil sebelumnya dan kehidupan keluarganya bisa lebih baik.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Murti has been farming Pigs for a long time to help her husband pay for daily living expenses. Currently she only lives with her husband as her children have gotten married. Ni Ketut Murti has expressed her willingness to grow the business, however it is difficult due to limited funding and rising cost of living. Ni Ketut Murti started with simple pig pens. Currently she farms 1 breeder pig, and in 6 month, she hopes to sell the piglets. In one breeding cycle, her pig can produce 6-8 piglets. Ni Ketut Murti is seeking training and a 6-month $475 loan from DINARI. Ni Ketut Murti Plans to use the loan to purchase feeds and an additional breeder pig. She hopes that her business will grow to give her higher income in the future for her family.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase breeder pig

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 56-year-old woman who has a buy and sell business. She sells different kinds of vegetables and fruits at nearby markets in Sibalom, Antique, five days a week earning a daily net income of Php120.00 (approximately US$2.00). With various challenges she has overcome in her life, she learned that one should be courageous in facing problems. She has moved from different places and found Antique to be her home where she could start up her business.

She was approved to borrow her first loan amounting P5,000.00 payable for 1 year.

She joined ASHI to help her sister’s family in the nearby barangay and save for the future since she is living alone. Through industry and discipline, she dreams of expanding the buy and sell business with additional capital to purchase a variety of stock to be sold to her customers. She wants to save to own a house and lot in the future, and to share and help in the community.

loans.use: Buy and sell vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Le jeune Abdoulaye F. exploite un cyber et un télécentre dans le populaire quartier de Kandé Banéto. Grâce à cette activité il arrive à gagner sa vie et à entretenir sa peite famille. Il sollicite ce prêt pour augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Young Abdoulaye F. runs a cybercafé and a telecenter in the popular Kandé Banéto neighborhood. Thanks to this business, he manages to make a living and to provide for his small family. He's seeking this loan to increase his income.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his income

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Mr. Thon C. lives in Hang Heng village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, he gets a little rice revenue to support his family. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy rice because her family hass insufficient rice for eating. His wife, Mrs. Teas Sokha, is a coconut middleman. Mr. Thon C. is 43 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. His wife is presented with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy rice for eating.

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo A. sells clothes. She has been in this for a long time. The demands for her clothes are high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. Iyabo is 40 years old and married with 2 children. She is indeed grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Lisbeth Yurico

texts.es:
Lisbeth es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles.
Lisbeth es casada, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo, Lisbeth tiene una ferretería, su local esta ubicado en una avenida en la casa de su mama, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de personas, también vende agregados.
Lisbeth necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de un carro.
Lisbeth sueña con construir su casa y comprar un carro para repartir sus productos a domicilio.
texts.en:
Lisbeth is a member of the Community Bank “Los Claveles.” She is 21 years old, married, and has 1 son. She has a hardware store that is located in her mother’s home. Several people help her and she also sells little trinkets. Lisbeth is asking for 3,000 soles that she will use to help pay for a car. Lisbeth dreams of building a home and buying a car in order to go door-to-door selling her products

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: help pay for a car

loans.name: So Chhea

texts.en: Mrs. So Chhea M. lives in Prey Veing village in Takeo province. She is a chicken breeder. Her husband, Mr. Uk Ratana, is a farmer who owns a piece of land used to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a construction worker. Although they try to work hard, they still earn less income than needed to support their household better. In order to improve their living, Mrs. So Chhea M. decided to ask for a loan to buy four piglets and pig food to start a business breeding pigs to earn more income. She is 26 years old and the mother of two children; both are in the local school.  Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy four piglets and pig food to start a business breeding pigs.

loans.name: Assadullo

texts.ru: Ибодов Ассадулло проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 46 лет , женат и имеет пятерых детей. Живет в одном из дальних кишлаков района. Старший сын находится в России на заработках. Сам клиент работает в сельском хозяйстве. Арендует землю. Сейчас планирует засеять арбузами. Поэтому обратился к нам за кредитом для покупки семян , пленки , а так же горюче смазочного материала. Это поможет ему своевременно засеить землю и получить качественный урожай. Засеивать хочет скороспелый сорт , урожай которого  будет готов уже в июне месяце.
texts.en:
Assadullo I. lives in the Khuroson district. He is 46 years old, married and has five children. He lives in one of the distant villages of the district. His oldest son is working in Russia. Our client works in agriculture. Assadullo leases land. Currently, he is planning to plant watermelons. He requested a loan from us in order to purchase seeds, plastic and petroleum-based lubricants. This will help him to sow the land and obtain a quality harvest. He wants to plant a quick-ripening variety, which can be harvested as early as in June.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of watermelon seeds, plastic and petroleum-based lubricants

loans.name: Elvira Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Elvira G. es una madre casada y con dos hijos que mantener el cual se dedica a su negocio de salón de belleza atendido por ella misma en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua.

La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de trabajo del salón y así continuar adelante buscando la manera de cómo mejorar su negocio y lograr la satisfacción de todos y cada uno de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elvira Gonzalez is a married mother of two children. She supports them by running a beauty shop in the Mayareo market of the city of Managua. She is coming to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of materials for her salon, this way she can continue to find ways to improve her business and achieve the satisfactions of each and every one of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for her business.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Né le 09 Août 1978 à N’Golo-Diassa situé à environ 6 km de la ville de Sikasso, Monsieur Moussa Berthé vit avec deux enfants et son épouse dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie  dans son village natal, relevant de la préfecture de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Moussa Berthé est  mécanicien de profession depuis maintenant huit ans et mène  parallèlement à son métier l’achat et la vente des pièces détachées d’occasion. Il  est beaucoup sollicité  par les garagistes et propriétaires de véhicule  pour la qualité de ses articles.
Pour permettre  à sa clientèle  plus en plus croissante  d’acquérir des pièces automobiles d’origine de qualité et sans faire le tour de la ville, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis le 10 septembre 2008 et avec laquelle il est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Son prêt précédent a été remboursé par anticipation.
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter,  des bielles, arbre à cames , pistons, jantes, etc. Les marchandises (pièces) achetées proviennent  des véhicules  démontés sur place et sont revendues dans son magasin au sein de son garage.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on August 9, 1978 in N’Golo-Diassa, located about 6 km from Sikasso City, Mr. Moussa Berthé lives with two children and his wife in a large traditional extended family in the village of his birth in Sikasso Prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He has been a mechanic by profession for eight years now. And concurrent to this trade, he buys and sells used spare parts. He is in high demand by those in the garage business and by vehicle owners for the quality of his merchandise. To enable his burgeoning customer base to acquire quality auto parts and without having to run about town to do so, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso on September 10, 2008. He is now on his second individual loan. His preceding loan was repaid in advance. With the current loan, he intends to buy piston rods, camshafts, pistons, rims, etc. The merchandise (spare parts) comes from automobiles disassembled locally and is resold in a store located within his garage. He envisions using this loan to realize a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to augment his working capital, to help with family expenses, to make loan interest payments, and to invest the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used spare parts

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo, quien es trabajador dependiente, y con sus 2 hijas quienes la ayudan mucho en su negocio. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la crianza de pollos en su propia casa, en un pequeño galpón que construyó su esposo. Una vez que sus animales están listos para la venta, ella misma los sacrifica y los vende listos para la parrilla, con esta modalidad tiene mejores ganancias. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce a muchas personas y entabla buenas relaciones con sus clientes, además su vivienda, que es también su puesto de venta, esta ubicada en un lugar muy transitado. Para un futuro cercano, Luz quiere mandar a construir dos galpones adicionales para tener mayor espacio para sus animales. Con MFP ya tiene 3 préstamos, lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos son bien organizados y dinámicos para el trabajo en equipo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más pollos bebé y alimento balanceado para criarlos adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Luz is 48 and lives with her husband, who is a salaried worker, and her two daughters who help her out a lot in her business. For the past 5 years she has earned her living growing chickens at her house in a small coop that her husband built. As soon as her chickens are ready for sales she kills them herself and sells them ready to cook, which earns her more money. What she likes about her work is that she gets to meet a lot of people and develop good relationships with her customers. In addition, her house, which is also her place of business, is located in a very busy area. In the near future Luz would like to have two more coops built so she can have more space for her chickens. So far, Luz has had 3 loans with MFP. What she likes about her village bank is that everyone is well-organized and excited about working on a team. She plans to use her loan to buy more baby chicks and nutritious feed so she can raise them well.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baby chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en: Lenie I. owns a 2.5-hectare (6-acre) farm. She is 39 years old and the mother of four children. While she is waiting for the next harvest to come, she also sells food items in the streets to supplement their income. The money that she gets from her farm and from selling food is used to buy the basic needs in their home. She wants the best for her family. She wants her children to graduate in college so that, when they are older, they are able to easily provide themselves with a good life. Lenie is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. From the start, she knows that her loan will be a big help in running her business, especially in buying the needed fertilizers for her farm. She thinks and believes that her loan will go far to improve her harvest. CEVI is continuously helping her sustain their livelihood. She receives not just CEVI loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of fertilizer and other farming needs

loans.name: Ma. Salvacion

texts.en:
Ma. Salvacion A. is 32 and is married to Eduardo A., who is 36. They have 2 children.  Ma. Salvacion sells food while her husband worked as an electrician in a privately-owned electronic shop, which repairs televisions and other electronic devices. Television repair was his major task. Though both Ma. Salvacion and her husband were earning, their income could not meet the increasing financial needs of their family. Therefore, Ma. Salvacion and her husband decided to request a loan from ASHI in order to start up their own business.

In Ma. Salvacion's house, a mini-electronic repair shop was set up and is managed by her husband, while she sells barbeque and entertains customers that come in. Eventually, her business grew and they were able to acquire many customers from all over the municipality. Ma. Salvacion requests a larger loan to sustain the increasing and growing demand of their business. Someday she hopes to have her own shop that can employ other people to work with her husband. She also dreams of sending her two children to college and that they have their own careers in the future.

loans.use: materials needed for television repair

loans.name: Pheobe Akoth

texts.en: Pheobe is a mother of six children, and also looks after orphans in her community. She has a business selling vegetables in a kiosk at the market.  Pheobe would like to use her loan money to improve her business by adding new produce to her stock of vegetables. Pheobe’s main goal is to feed her children and the orphans she cares for, and to try to pay their school fees.

loans.use: To buy a wider range of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is 45 years old and the mother of five children. Her children are currently in school.

To support her household, Georgina has been selling vegetables like tomatoes, onions and peppers at Okaishie market in the Greater Accra region. She says selling these products is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her make a good income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica del departamento de León, el señor Reymundo E. dedica sus esfuerzos a la actividad agrícola la cual es la siembra de maíz en sus manzanas de tierra donde espera tener una buena cosecha para beneficiar a su familia y a sus hijos que necesitan de su apoyo. 

La razón por la que ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar el crédito para la compra de los insumos agrícolas como lo son crea e insecticidas para aplicarlos a los cultivos y de esta manera obtener una buena cosecha,
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica in the city of Leon, Reymundo E. invests his efforts in his agriculture business. He sows and harvests corn in his fields. He hopes to have a good harvest for the sake of his family and for his children that require his support.

He has appraoched Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan to purchase items he needs for his plantation, such as insecticides, to ensure a good harvest.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase items for his plantation.

loans.name: Maximina Rosa

texts.es:
Maximina tiene 44 años de edad, es separada y vive con una hija de 13 años de edad, la última de sus cinco hijos, en el distrito de Monsefú, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace año y medio empezó a vender tarjetas de recarga de celulares en un pequeño establecimiento cercano a la plaza de armas de Monsefú, luego implementó su negocio con la venta de accesorios para celulares y desde hace algunos meses ha incursionado con las recargas virtuales.

Ella nos explicó que actualmente sus clientes prefieren el servicio de recargas virtuales ya que las consideran más seguras que las tarjetas; todos los días va a un Banco de la zona al menos dos veces a depositar dinero para que la empresa que le brinda el servicio le otorgue el saldo necesario para mantener su negocio.

El negocio ha ido desarrollándose de buena manera ya que se encuentra cerca al centro de su ciudad, las ganancias que percibe de su negocio las invierte en el cuidado de su hija menor, que aún estudia; de su madre, de 70 años de edad, y en el pago del alquiler del establecimiento en donde trabaja.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más accesorios de celulares y también con la ampliación del saldo para realizar sus recargas virtuales, para ello se encuentrra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Maximina desea ampliar definitivamente su negocio incursionando en la venta de celulares y su más grande anhelo es tener una local propio, para así poder invertir más en la educación de su hija y brindarle la oportunidad de estudiar alguna carrera superior.

Ella es una mujer muy querida y r espetada por sus vecinos y clientes, ya que a pesar de que se separó hace nueve años ha sabido salir adelante, ganándose con mucho esfuerzo el sustento económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Maximina is 44 years old, separated, and lives with her 13-year-old daughter, who is the last of her 5 children. They live in the district of Monsefú, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

One and a half years ago, she began selling cards to ¨top-up¨ cell phones in a small establishment close to the Plaza de Armas of Monsefú. The she expanded her business to include the sale of cell phone accessories, and for a few months she has also ventured into virtual refills for cell phones.

She explained to us that currently her customers prefer the service of virtual refills since they consider them more secure than cards. Every day she goes to a bank in the region at least two times to deposit money so that the business that offers her the service, grants her the necessary amount to maintain her business.

The business has been developing in a good way since it is close to the center of the city. The profits that she receives from her business, she invests in caring for her young daughter, who is now studying, and also for her mother who is 70 years old, and in the payment of the rent for the establishment where she works.

She wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more cell phone accessories, and also with the expansion of the amount to make virtual refills. For this she is requesting for the first time a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Maximina wishes to permanently expand her business venturing into the sale of cell phones, and her greatest wish is to have her own location, so that she can invest more in her daughter´s education and offer her the opportunity to get a college degree.

She is a woman who is very beloved and respected by her neighbors and customers, and since she separated nine years ago, she has kept going forward, with a lot of hard work earning the economic means of support for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cell phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Many people who do not have property or money to leave their children always say that the one legacy they can leave them is an education. Education is a treasure that once possessed, cannot be stolen or given away, and when used wisely, can open a whole new world for just about anyone whether they started from poverty or wealth. Gloria P. who lives in the village of Brgy. Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental also believes that education is the one thing she can give her children to prepare them to rise above their situation and improve their lives.

Gloria is 50 years old and married to Fernando P. who presently owns and manages a fishing business. They have three children, two of whom are already gainfully employed, and a younger daughter who’s in her fourth year of High School. It is Gloria's dream to send her daughter to college to earn a degree, get a stable job, and have a good life.

Fishing is the main source of income for the family because of their proximity to the sea. At first, Gloria relied wholly on her husband's income as a fisherman. But maintaining a fishing business requires a capital infusion from time to time, especially to cover repairs and maintenance of the nets and boat. This is the reason why Gloria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1995—to access new capital so that her family could sustain their fishing business.

With consecutive loans from NWTF-Project Dunggano, that Gloria borrowed and repayed, their income increased and Gloria saw her husband's fishing business become stable and sustainable. This prompted her in 2004 to take out a loan to start a general store so she could supplement her husband's income and help with the family's expenses. Her subsequent loans were alternately used to increase the working capital of her general store and the family’s fishing business, and have helped earn her an average monthly income of PHP 5,000.

For now, Gloria’s focus is in the expansion of her general store. Her 9th cycle loan of PHP 19,500 was used to add to her working capital so she could have more inventory to sell. For her 10th cycle loan, she is again requestion PHP 19,500 to continue expansion of her store. She intends to use the income to supplement her husband's earnings to help support the family and set aside something for her daughter's college education.

About NWTF:_In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few women but thousands of them. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a meager $1 a day, to creating realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa does her best to earn a living for her family. She is married and has 8 children. Like any mother, she wants her kids to have proper education and finish school. She runs a general store and enjoys selling to her neighbors and other customers.

Felipa is in need of additional capital for her business. She is applying for a loan of Php 4,000 to buy goods for her store. This loan will be very helpful to Felipa and her business venture.

loans.use: adding to her inventory

loans.name: Mrs. Chamroeun Born Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank loan consists of nineteen people who all live in Trapeang Veaeng village in Takeo province. Mrs. Chamroeun B. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation she is a weaver. Now she is requesting a loan to buy more raw materials for her weaving. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's life with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Tun Heng Ly, is a teacher in a high school in the local district. Mrs. Chamroeun B. is 55 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a beautician, another is employed in an organization, and the remaining attends the local school. All the members are presented in the picture bU. some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for her weaving.

loans.name: Eni

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Eni M. from Tukuyu. She is married with five children between the ages of 8 and 19.

Eni has been running a local restaurant business since 2005. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough, wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot, sticky dough made from maize flour), and plantain (a cooked, savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces. Eni works at the business for between nine and twelve hours per day, seven days per week, and currently earns about $90 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to improve the quality of her business premises. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Eni thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To improve the quality of her business premises

loans.name: Bukari

texts.en:
Bukari Y. is married and has five dependents. He has been through senior high school. Bukari sells car batteries, fans, and starters at Abura near Cape Coast, which he has been doing since 1999. His wife is a petty trader.

Bukari uses his income in feeding the family, paying school fees, and utility bills. Bukari will use the loan to purchase car batteries, car fans and car starters to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Bukari plans to save part for school fees and also expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase car batteries, car fans, and car starters to sell

loans.name: Cristina Tomas

texts.pt:
Cristina Tomas D. S. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 42 anos de idade, divorciaD. e mãe de 3 filhos de 18, 14 e 12 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 6ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.

 Nunca mudou de cidade continua a viver em Maputo desde a infância, tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 4 anos e não possui nenhum empregado. Aprendeu esta actividade com suas amigas que o exercem ha mais de 7 anos, consegue um rendimento mensal de 2.500.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainD. poupa algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa) mensal.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas de Xitique que também são clientes. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 8.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (óleo, ovos, farinha, sabão, açúcar e outros) para aumentar o volume D. sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 6.000.00mt, 6.000.00mt e 8.000.00mt todos para mesma actividade.
 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar no comércio e concluir a sua obra para oferecer melhores condições de habilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Cristina Tomas was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in the South of Mozambique. She is 42 years old, divorced and the mother of 3 children who are 18, 14 and 12 years old. All of the children are in school. She only went to school until the 6th grade due to her parents lack of financial resources. She owns the house she lives in with her family and does not support anyone else.

She has lived in Maputo all her life. She has had her own business for over 4 years and doesn't have any employees. She learned the activity from her friends who have been in the business for more than 7 years. She makes 2.500.00mt a month which goes towards house expenses. She saves some money through "Xitique", a traditional rotational savings system.

She has never had loans from other banks. She came to know Hluvuku through her "Xitique" friends who are also members. This loan, in the amount of 8.000.00mt, is her fourth. She intends to purchase supplies (cooking oil, eggs, flour, soap, sugar and others) to increase her inventory. The previous loans were for 6.000.00mt, 6.000.00mt and 8.000.00mt and were used for the same activity.

In the future, she would like to request more loans to invest in her business and finish her construction to offer better living conditions to her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna AlmeiD.-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory (soap, cooking oil, rice and others)

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Sat P. is a good mother to three children, one of whom is married and the other two are single and no longer in school. To help contribute to the family’s daily expenses, one of her sons has a business repairing vehicles.

Sat P. owns a store along the street where she sells gasoline that she buys on credit from a gas station. Another source of family income comes from her husband, who is a taxi driver.

Sat P. is taking out her loan to build a fence around her house. She intends to use the remaining loan to buy spare parts to supply her son’s vehicle repairing business.

loans.use: To build a fence around her house and to buy spare parts for her son's business

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Batjargal is 28 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Zavhan province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a "ger". He operates a transportation service and meat-trading business with the help of his wife in their town.

Batjargal's wife is mainly responsible for selling the meat and he is responsible for transporting people's goods and luggage from and to the countryside and center of the province. He transports 1-2 times per month during the warm weather and 2 times per season during cold weather.

He started his business with the help of his father in 2000. With years of business experience, he was able to start his own transportation business in 2007. He manages the finances of the business and advises his wife on the day-to-day operations. They have gained much experience and are planning to continue and maintain their business for the future. With their business gain they were able to make the remaining payment on their new truck and bought a carpet for their home.

For the future they want to build a house for themselves. Batjargal says, “I want to save enough money for my children's education while they are young. Also I would like to buy a car for myself.” He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to purchase fodder to sell to herders in remote areas.

loans.use: to purchase fodder to resell

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred M. is from the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Mildred is married and has 2 infant children. Mildred owns & operates a general store. She sells a variety of products such as soy sauce, candies, noodles, eggs, salt and shampoo to the local community. Mildred has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Mildred joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mildred is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mildred from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a 40-year-old married woman and mother of 4 unemployed children. She has been working as a farmer for the past 15 years, and with her business she helps her husband with the family income. She owns an agriculture tent where she cultivates all kinds of fruits and vegetables according to the season. And she distributes her harvest to the agriculture market in her village to be sold.

Today, Theresa is requesting a loan of $1,200 to perform maintenance on the agriculture tent in addition to preparing additional tents to increase her harvest and make more profit for her family.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on the agriculture tent in addition to preparing additional tents

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth B., age 43, is married with five children: two are in high school and three are attending elementary school. Lilibeth lives with her family in the province of Rizal in the Philippines. Her husband works long hours as a taho vendor to support the family. To supply additional income, Lilibeth wants to expand the family variety store business through obtaining additional working capital. 

Lilibeth would like to receive a loan of 19,000 PHP to purchase an inventory of rice, liquors, cases of beers, canned goods, and other supplies for her variety store. Lilibeth believes that offering a wider assortment of goods to her customers will increase traffic to her variety store and maintain customer loyalty in the community.

Since the course of her membership in ASHI, Lilibeth has achieved strong performance with regular attendance to group meetings and solid repayments.  Lilibeth is thankful for access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams. With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that their expanded business will continue to flourish to improve the family’s quality of life and fund all of her children’s college education.

About ASHI: 

Ahon Sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase an inventory of rice, liquors, cases of beers, canned goods, and other supplies for her variety store

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo is 48 years old, married with 3 children. His children are doing well at school. Taiwo is a hardworking man and he sells for long hours to support his household. He sells drinks at retail prices to his customers. He hopes to be a major drink distributor in the future. He is requesting a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. He says thank you to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim U., 52, lives with her husband, Mr. Lay Lang, in Kaoh ChamraeU. village in Kandal province. They have four children, one a laborer, one a grocery seller and the other two are farmers. Mr. Lay Lang owns a plot of land to grow vegetables and Mrs. Sim U. sells vegetables in the local market. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it, but she does not have a motorbike for transportation. So Mrs. Sim U. is asking for a loan to buy a motorbike to support her business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Lakshika

texts.en:
Lakshika is a 34-year-old married woman living in the town of Kekanadura, in the Matara area of southern Sri Lanka. She and her husband have two sons.

Lakshika manages a business making coconut oil, in which she partners with her husband. She and her husband have been doing this business for four years now.

Lakshika has requested a 25,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to purchase dry coconuts to be turned into oil. She hopes to continue to see success in her business with the help of this loan.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy dry coconuts for making more coconut oil

loans.name: Carlos

texts.pt:
Carlos Z. nasceu na Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, tem 46 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 28, 20, 09 e 06 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 10ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras e teve que iniciar a trabalhar muito cedo. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 irmaos e 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ele.
Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo cumprindo o serviço militar em 1981, em 1986 casou se e fixou sua residência onde continua a viver actualmente. Trabalha como agente de medicina geral no hospital militar e tem um salário de 10.180.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária. 
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus oficiais de credito que vinham fazer a mobilização no serviço. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 30.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, blocos, chapas, barrotes e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua casa. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir e mobilar a sua casa, pretende ainda solicitar para a compra de uma viatura.
texts.en:
Carlos Z. was born in Inhambane Province in southern Mozambique. He is 46 years old, married, and has four children, ages 28, 20, 9 and 6. All the children go to school. Carlos finished tenth grade but did not continue because of financial difficulties and because he had to start working while very young. He lives in his own house with his family and supports two brothers and two younger relatives (nieces or nephews) who live with him. In 1981, he left Inhambane to come to Maputo while completing his military service. In 1986 he got married and established a home, where he is still living today. Carlos works in general medicine in the military hospital and has a salary of 10,800 meticais per month. He uses the money for household expenses and saves some in his bank account. He has never had loans from other banks. Carlos learned about Hluvuku through its loan officers, who came to his workplace to run an enrollment drive. This is his third loan, and he is asking for 30,000 meticais. He intends to buy construction materials (sand, cement, blocks, zinc sheets, beams and other items) to continue construction on his house. Carlos promises to pay off this loan on time so he can take out other loans. In the future he would like to ask for more loans to finish building and furnishing his house. He also intends to ask for a loan to buy a vehicle.
