Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sand, cement, zinc sheets, blocks and other items

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To extend her farming land, purchase weedkiller and fertilizer

loans.name: Pargev

texts.en:
Pargev K. lives in Sevan city with his parents, his wife and their one-year-old child. Pargev is 27 years old.

Since 2008, Pargev has been working in a gas-filling station as a working shift manager. And, since 2009, he has run a food shop and fast-food stand in the same gas-filling station. Also he does home delivery of fast food.

Pargev has taken a loan from Nor Horizon four times and now he is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan that he will use to buy a small trailer. He intends to carry his fast-food stand in that trailer.

loans.use: To buy a small trailer for his business

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es: Víctor R. M., tiene la edad de 40 años, está casado, y tiene  5 hijos, de 22, 20, 18, 17 y 7 años, y son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de mercadería. El se dedica a la venta de artículos para el hogar.  Desea tener un inventario más variado de artículos para la venta, también desea  hacer nuevas rutas para ofrecer  sus productos para  el hogar y así ir ampliando su clientela. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.
texts.en:
Víctor R. M. is 40 years old, is married and has 5 children who are 22, 20, 18, 17 and 7 years old, they are his main priority. He wants the loan to buy merchandize. Víctor sells household articles and wishes to have a greater variety of inventory for sale and to have new routes to offer his household products so that he can increase his clientele. This is not his first time getting a loan with FUDECOSUR and is very happy with the help that he has received. In the future he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and more economic stability and to keep growing in his personal and professional life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce ( to buy household articles)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: cement,stone, and corrugated metal roofing

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen P., 41, is a weaver of traditional Cambodian silk, an activity that earns her an income of USD 2.5 per day. Her husband (pictured here because P. was not available) is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Their eldest child is currently employed at a local garment factory and earns an income of USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

P. is requesting a loan of USD 700 in order to purchase more raw silk so that she can produce more silk products. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits toward necessary repairs to her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.
 
P. resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk in order to produce silk products

loans.name: Siraji

texts.en:
Siraji, aged 40, wants a loan to buy soda, water, soap and salt for his shop. He started as a conductor and later advanced to driving which he has done for the last twenty years.

Siraji lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda, in a permanent house. He dreams of educating his children and expanding his retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase soda, water, soap and salt to sell in his shop

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov K., 27, sells rice in the local market of her TaK. province. She is married with one child, who is still living at home. Her husband sells mosquito nets and blankets. She typically makes about US$5 a day and would like a loan to expand her business. In order to increase her profits, she is asking for US$1200 to purchase more rice to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more rice to sell

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani K. is a single mother who is bringing up 2 children. She is an English teacher and Ministry of Foreign Affairs employee in the past.  

Ani started a sales business in 2004 to bring more financial stability to her home, be more independent and insure her children’s brighter future. Ani  sells in children’s clothing from a rented booth in “Tashir” market. She has applied for this loan to purchase new inventory.

loans.use: To purchase children's clothing.

loans.name: Folkin Antonio

texts.es: Folkin Antonio tiene 33 años, es casado y tiene 3 hijos, todos menores de edad. El señor se dedica a la venta de artesanía, los cuales distribuyen de manera ambulante en diferentes lugares y departamentos. Ya tiene 10 años que dio inicio a este negocio ante la falta de trabajo que aqueja a nuestro país, además que él era trabajador del campo y los trabajos de ese rubro cada día se vuelven más escasos. El señor desea invertir este crédito en la compra de artesanía, ya que además de vender en su casa también. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener una pulpería grande en su casa de habitación, y algún día dejarle algo bueno a sus hijos con lo cual puedan mantenerse.
texts.en:
Folkin Antonio, 33, is married and has three minor children.  He sells crafts in an itinerant manner in different places and departments.  He started the business 10 years ago because of the lack of employment opportunities in our country.  Besides, he used to work in the fields but those kinds of jobs are becoming rarer every day.

He wants to use the loan to buy crafts because he also sells them from home.  His dream has always been to have a large grocery store in his home and someday leave something good for his children that they can support themselves with.

loans.use: To buy crafts.

loans.name: Jaime Gonzalo

texts.es:
Jaime Gonzalo Y. Y. tiene 25 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Jaime pertenece a la Ventanilla Casaiche Chilipamba ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería como vacas lecheras y chanchos, esta ventanilla tiene 20 miembros.

Jaime se dedica a la agricultura de maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y a la ganadería cría vacas lecheras, las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo fréjol y papa  y animales para engordar y después vender. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es ponerse comprar casa y comprar terrenos.
Le gustaría que el crédito sea el monto más alto.
texts.en:
Jaime Gonzalo Y. Y. is 25 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children.  He lives in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  He has 3 children.

Jaime belongs to the Casaiche Chilipamba solidarity group which is located half an hour from Guaranda.  It is a group that works in agriculture and farming livestock such as dairy cows and pigs.  The group has 20 members.

Jaime grows corn, beans and potatoes and raises dairy cows.  He makes his purchases in Guaranda and sells in the wholesale market in the same town.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies for sowing corn, beans and potatoes and also animals to fatten and then sell.  The support of the loan will help him to fulfil his family's financial needs.  His dream is to be able to buy a house and land.

loans.use: To buy supplies for sowing corn, wheat, beans, potatoes and to buy animals

loans.name: Nelson Jacinto

texts.es:
Nelson de 43 años, tiene una tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive con su mama en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. 

La esposa de Nelson comenzó con la idea de vender víveres por la ventana de su casa ya que no tenían local y querían tener ingresos para poder mantener a sus cuatro hijos. Les favoreció mucho vender víveres ya que por el sector donde viven no había tienda porque estaba apartado de la ciudad ya que cruza un rio por ese sector. En la actualidad tienda ya su tienda ubicada en la parte delantera de su casa trabaja los dos desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm. Venden en la tienda arroz, azúcar, lácteos, bebidas, etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere surtir mas su tienda comprando arroz, azúcar, harina etc. En el futuro quiere tener una tienda grande y que cubra con las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nelson, 43, has a shop in the front part of his home. He lives with his mother in the Playas canton, one of the tourists spots in Ecuador with a great supply of seafood. 

Nelson's wife began with the idea of selling provisions out of the window of their home as they did not have a local store and they wanted to have an income to be able to look after their four children. It worked well for them selling provisions as in the area where they lived there was no store because it was separate from the city as a river crosses through this area. Currently their store is located at the front of their home and they both work from 7.00am until 9.00pm. They sell rice, sugar, milk products, drinks, etc in their store. 

With this loan he wants to stock his store buying rice, sugar, flour etc. In the future he wants to have a big store and to fulfill the needs of his customers.

loans.use: Rice, sugar, flour

loans.name: Horolsuren

texts.en: Horolsuren A. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and adult son in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia. She and her family live together in their own ger, which has a fence. Her husband operates a transportation business, in which he using his own truck to supplement the family income. Horolsuren operates a meat trading business out of a stall at the Harhorin market, one of the big markets in the city. She purchases a large amount of meat during the summer and fall and preserves it for sale in the winter when it is in high demand. She started her business in 1994, and has since become very experienced in her trade. Today, her business is a very stable operation, and her working capital exceeds 4,000,000 MNT, while her daily average sales income has reached 220,000 MNT. In the future, she hopes to continue managing her business and keep it sustainable so that she can afford to one day buy her own apartment for her family. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve a large amount of meat.

loans.use: To purchase and preserve a large amount of meat

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andrés, de 53 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Agustina de 40 años y sus 2 hijos menores Jonier de 11 y Yosy de 7 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo que realiza Andrés es el cultivo de cacao, café y hojas de coca, todas las mañanas junto a su esposa comienza sus días cultivando y regando sus tierras, los ánimos que posee lo ayudan mucho en esta labor, ya que es una actividad que necesita de esfuerzo físico, pero él sabe que ningún esfuerzo esta de más con tal de brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, ya que siente que los meses de trabajo lo están recompensando, lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta el mercado de la ciudad de San Francisco. Con el tiempo, desea juntar el dinero necesario y comprarse un auto, con el cual pueda transportar sus cultivos. Este es el décimo sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte lo ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y motivo por el cual es muy respetado por sus compañeras de grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas, ya que desea mejorar la productividad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Andrés is 53 years old.  He is a very kind and hard-working man who lives in his own home with his wife, 40 year-old Agustina, and his two dependent children: 11 year-old Jonier and 7 year-old Yosy, for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life.

Andrés grows cacao, coffee and coca leaf.  Every morning, together with his wife, he begins his day farming and irrigating his land.  The energy he has helps him a lot in his work since it is an activity that requires a lot of physical effort.  However, he knows that no effort is too much if it helps him to offer his family the best in life.  What Andrés most likes about his work is harvesting his crops since he then feels like the months of work have been rewarded.  He has been in this business for 13 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be transporting his crops to the market in the city of San Francisco.  Over time, Andrés would like to gather together the money he needs to buy a car which he would be able to use to transport his crops.

This is Andrés' tenth loan from MFP.  He knows that this support will help him a lot in making progress in his work.  He is a very responsible member of his community bank which means that he is very well respected by his fellow group members.  He will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles he is requesting to buy manure and insecticides since he would like to improve the productivity of his land.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and insecticides

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor de 25 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de Usulután, donde vive con sus padres, es soltero, todos en su casa trabajan y él se dedica a la venta de medicina, sus ventas las realiza de forma ambulante, todos los días de la semana, ya tiene establecidas sus rutas y clientes que visitar.
El necesita comprar más mercadería para vender, por lo que solicita un préstamo para realizar esta inversión, comprando medicamentos distintos, teniendo un negocio más fuerte y prospero.
Su objetivo es ser un vendedor mayorista, atender toda la zona y ampliarse con empleados, realizar también una buena inversión con este préstamo y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Victor is 25 years old and lives with his parents in San Rafael Oriente, located in the department of Usulután. He is single and everyone in his house works. He works selling medicine and he makes his sales everyday on foot. Victor already has his established routes and customers that he visits. He needs to purchase more merchandise to sell, which is why he is requesting a loan to make this investment, purchasing different medicines to have a stronger and more prosperous business.

His goal is to be a wholesale vendor, serving the entire zone and expanding the business with employees. He also wants to make a good investment with this loan and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase medicines

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua M. is a divorced woman, who takes care of seven dependants. To earn a living, Ekua fries fish, which she sells in Abura. Ekua uses her business income to support her dependants.

Ekua is seeking a loan in the amount of $350 to purchase additional fish, which she would then fry and sell to her customers. Ekua plans to reinvest the expected increase in profits generated as a result of this loan back into her business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional fish

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man living with his parents and two siblings. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a taxi driver since 2008. Despite his young age, he has to work hard each day to help his father to cover the family expenses.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to replace his shuttle bus’s engine with a new one so that he can transport his clients safely without facing any vehicle damage.

loans.use: to replace his shuttle bus’s engine with a new one

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a married woman who lives in Cadiiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a business venture selling fish. Her husband Bernie, who is 43 years old, works as a fish vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are between 11 and 21 years old. Sonia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 20 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Sonia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10.000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 21st loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for fish vending so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children & for house improvements. Sonia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish vending

loans.name: Srey Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Aun S. is 43 years old and her husband, Mr. Changly Thong, is 43 year-old (pictured together). They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1994 and have three children – one son and two daughters, all of them are in school.

Srey Aun is a garment factory worker. Her husband is lathe operator. She is requesting her first loan of $500 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Lucrecia Clementina

texts.es: Lucrecia Clementina se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, bolsas plásticas y platos desechables. Tiene más de 12 años de tener este negocio. Su mayor desafío es poder mantener a su clientela, ella tiene cierto tiempo de trabajar con Fundación y se encuentra muy contenta con este medio de vida, compra sus productos en el mercado cada semana y los la mayoría de sus productos los ofrece de manera ambulante y en su vivienda. Solicita el crédito para la comprar gaseosas, productos plásticos entre otras cosas. Enfrentar  diferentes desafíos harán que cada día logre adquirir experiencia necesaria.
texts.en:
Lucrecia Clementina sells soda, plastic bags and disposable plates.  She has been in this business for more than 12 years.  Her major challenge is keeping her customers.  She has been working with Fundación Leon 2000 for a while and is very happy with this way of making a living.  She buys her products in the market every week and sells most of her products as an itinerant street vendor and from her home.

Lucrecia is requesting this loan to buy soda and plastic products.  Facing challenges in her business has enabled Lucrecia to gain experience.

loans.use: to buy soda and plastic products

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina, de 46 años es una mujer muy noble y responsable. Vive en su casa propia, junto  a su esposo Oscar de 41 años y sus 2 hijos menores de los 3  que tiene en total, por quienes trabaja arduamente. Por muchos años se dedicaba al bordado de chompas, junto a su suegra. Debido a problemas familiares se trasladó a otro distrito, desde entonces alquiló el puesto de su hermano en un mercado, en la que vende limones, ají, maíz morado entre otros productos. Durante este año y medio que lleva en esta labor, de a poco fue captando clientes y, de ese modo también fueron aumentando sus utilidades,  por lo que ahora madruga todos los días, para proveerse de mas mercaderías; solo que le apena; no disfrutar la infancia de sus hijos, como cuando se dedicaba al bordado de chompas. Pero, por lo demás se siente muy contenta, ya que sin dificultad alguna en todo este tiempo, le viene pagando el alquiler a su hermano. En vista de ello, le urge contar con mayor cantidad de mercaderías de su rubro y de varios precios. Y, de ese modo en el futuro desea comprarse su propio puesto y continuar realizando sus bordados. Se reincorpora a su grupo y para ella es su 8vo crédito con MFP, y se  compromete con los integrantes de su grupo a seguir trabajando como lo hacia, y sobre ser puntual en cada una de sus cuotas. Con el crédito, se comprará mayor cantidad de limones, ajíes y demás mercaderías, para continuar trabajando y de ese modo progresar.
texts.en: Guillermina is 46 years old she is a very noble and responsible woman. She lives in her own home with her husband, Oscar 41, and their 2 underage children (out of the 3 that they have) for whom she works arduously each day. For many years she embroidered sweaters with her mother-in-law. Due to some family problems, she moved to another district and since then she rented her brothers’ stall in a market where she now sells lemons, red peppers, purple maize among other items. During this year and a half she has worked selling the items and little by little she got some customers as well as her profits which are the reason she gets up early every day to have more merchandize. What Gullermina regrets is not being able to enjoy her children’s childhood as she did when she embroidered sweaters. Despite that, she is very happy since without any trouble she has been paying the rent to her brother. She needs to have a greater quantity of merchandize for her work in various prices. In the future, Guillermina wants to buy her own stall and continue her embroidery. She became part of her group and this is her eight loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and is committed to the other members of her group to keep working as always and to be punctual in each of her payments. With the loan, Guillermina will buy mostly lemons, red peppers, and other merchandize to keep working and progress.

loans.use: buy lemons, red peppers and other foodstuffs to stock her business.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont toutes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans à DIOUTIEBOUGOU  préfecture de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Ces  femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et de voisinage. 
Pour satisfaire leurs clientèles qui ne cessent de croître, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Avec ce  prêt Mama D., compte acheter, 500Kg de graine d’arachide et 300kg de beurre de karité auprès des fournisseurs des villages environnants. Elle effectue sa vente en détail et en gros, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché de Bougouni, aux consommateurs et revendeurs. 
Avec ce prêt Mama D. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the DJIGUISSEME group are all married; they are on average 34 years old and have three children. They live in extended traditional families with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children, and husbands. These women reside in DIOUTIEBOUGOU, in BOUGOUNI prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women got to know each other through trade, family and neighborly relations.
To meet the demand of their ever-growing client base, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their first loan as a group.
With this loan, Mama D. plans on purchasing 500 kilos of peanuts and 300 kilos of peanut butter from suppliers based in neighboring villages. She resells both retail and wholesale, takes cash and credit, door-to-door and on the Bougouni market, to both consumers and retailers.
With this loan, Mama D. hopes to make a monthly benefit of FCFA 30,000, which will be used for her family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more drugs for her pharmacy

loans.name: Rio Grande Las Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Río Grande Las Gaviotas se llama así porque la mayoría de sus integrantes son mujeres y porque tienen la característica como las gaviotas de ser libres en su trabajo y enfrentar todos los obstáculos que se le presente, siempre tratando de volar lo mas alto que puedan por cumplir sus objetivos. Y también porque pertenecen a la población de Río Grande que significa “piedra parada”.

La representante de este grupo es la señora Gloria una mujer muy trabajadora quien vive en unión libre con el señor Juan, tiene 3 hijos. Tiene un negocio en su casa en el cual vende sopes, empanadas de pollo y tamales. Ella solicito el préstamo para comprar mas insumos para la elaboración de sus antojitos ya que quiere invertir un poco mas en su negocio, con el dinero va a comprar, hojas para el tamal, pollo, chile y maíz para los sopes y las tortillas que son hechas a mano. Ella tiene 30 años con su negocio y comenta que la muy bien ya que guisa muy rico y la mayoría de sus vecinos le compran sus productos y gracias a este negocio pudo mantener a sus hijos y darles una educación.

Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
Susana: Venta de zapatos
Rosa: Venta de pollos
Esbeide y Gloria: Venta de antojitos
Francisca y Gonzala: Venta de ropa
Marina: Venta de refacciones para bicicletas
Virginia: Venta de colchas por catálogos
Candida: Venta de joyas de plata
Susana: Venta de tamales y tortilla
Sebastián: Venta de tabiques 
T.: Venta de mariscos
texts.en:
The name of this group is "Rio Grande Las Gaviotas". It is called this because the majority of the members are women who are like seagulls for being free in their businesses and for being ready to face any obstacle that comes their way. They are always trying to fly as high as they can to meet their objectives. They belong to the community of Rio Grande, meaning "standing stone". 

The representative of this group is Gloria. She is a very hardworking woman who lives with her partner, Juan, and she has 3 children. She has a catering business in her house, serving sopes (corn bowls with various savory toppings), breaded chicken, and tamales. She requests a loan to purchase ingredients to prepare her recipes. She wants to invest a little more into her business. With the funds, she plans on purchasing corn husks, chicken, chili, and corn to make sopes and hand-made tortillas. She has been in the business for 30 years and she says that she is successful, especially because her recipes are so delicious. The majority of her neighbors buy her products and it is thanks to this business that she has been able to support her children and to send them to school.

The following are the members of the group: 

Susana: shoe sales
Rosa: poultry sales
Esbeide and Gloria: catering
Francisca and Gonzala: clothing sales
Marina: sale of spare parts for bicycles
Virginia: sale of blankets by catalogue
Candida: silver jewelry sales
Susana: sale of tamales and tortillas
Sebastian: brick sales
T.: seafood sales

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare fast foods, including corn, chicken, chili, cheese, and lettuce.

loans.name: Maria Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 32 años de edad, ella vive con su familia en la zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, en una comunidad pequeña en vías de desarrollo y con muchos deseos de superarse.

Nancy es una madre de familia, que tiene dos hijos en edad escolar y por los que ella trabaja con dedicación. Nancy se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años en su propio domicilio y conoce el rubro a la perfección. Adicionalmente, Nancy vende  bebidas (gaseosas, agua)  heladas, lo cual le trae algunos ingresos. Nancy cuenta con clientela establecida en ambos negocios.

Ella ha logrado ahorrar para ir mejorando su calidad de vida. Sin embargo, aún le quedan cosas pendientes por hacer. Por ello  Nancy solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de materiales para ponerle piso a su sala y comedor.

Nancy estaría muy agradecida de concedérsele el crédito pues le ayudaría a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nancy tiene 32 años de edad, ella vive con su familia en la zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, en una comunidad pequeña en vías de desarrollo y con muchos deseos de superarse.

Nancy es una madre de familia, que tiene dos hijos en edad escolar y por los que ella trabaja con dedicación. Nancy se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años en su propio domicilio y conoce el rubro a la perfección. Adicionalmente, Nancy vende  bebidas (gaseosas, agua)  heladas, lo cual le trae algunos ingresos. Nancy cuenta con clientela establecida en ambos negocios.

Ella ha logrado ahorrar para ir mejorando su calidad de vida. Sin embargo, aún le quedan cosas pendientes por hacer. Por ello  Nancy solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de materiales para ponerle piso a su sala y comedor.

Nancy estaría muy agradecida de concedérsele el crédito pues le ayudaría a mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Colocar piso a sala y comedor.

loans.name: Baraka

texts.en:
Baraka, aged 27, is married to Tabitha and blessed with one child. He sells curios which he has been doing for two years, and he earns  a monthly income of KES.20,000.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, and this is his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the funds to buy more curios for resale.


Baraka intends to use the anticipated profits to educate his child and hopes to join international curio exporters in future.

loans.use: To buy curios for sale.

loans.name: Amavi Chantal

texts.fr: Mariée à un retraité et maman d’01 enfant, Amavi a commencé par vendre en 2000 les charbons de bois (un combustible très utilisé par les femmes africaines). Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin d’aider son mari retraité. Elle s’approvisionne à BASSAR et à KANTE et satisfait sa demande au marché de HEDZRANAWOE.
texts.en:
Married to a husband who is retired and the mother of one child, Amavi began to sell charcoal in 2000. (This is a fuel much used by African women.) 

This loan will allow her to bolster her business so as to help her retired husband. She buys her goods in BASSAR and in KANTE and satisfies her demand at the market of HEDZRANAWOE.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
Edwin, vive solamente con su abuela, posee una tienda en la cual ofrece productos de uso domestico como pasta dental, jabón, detergentes, alimentos no perecederos, entre otros, este negocio tiene varios años, ha sido estable y hasta el momento le provee lo necesario para sus gastos.
Él necesita comprar mercadería para surtir el negocio, para esto solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en aceite, azúcar, pan, boquitas y bebidas, todos estos materiales le ayudaran a mantenerse y a ofrecer a los clientes todo lo necesario.
Su objetivo es mejorar económicamente a través del desarrollo de su negocio, ayudar a su abuela y en el futuro tener su propia familia.
texts.en:
Edwin lives only with his grandmother.  He has a store selling home use items like tooth paste, soap, detergent, non-perishable food items, among others.  The business has been in operation several years.  It’s been stable and to date has provided what's needed to meet his expenses.

He needs to buy merchandise to stock the store.  He’s asking for a loan to do so investing in oil, sugar, bread, snacks and beverages.  All these materials will help him stay in business and offer his customers everything they need.

His objective is to improve economically through his business’ development, to help his grandmother and, in the future, to have a family of his own.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Las Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es casada, tiene 38 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 6 hijos 2 D. los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al comercio, a la venta D. helados, inicio este negocio en un momento D. necesidad familiar y tener dinero para el sustento familiar y hasta el momento lleva 6 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

DeciD. organizar un  grupo y así poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital D. trabajo para la veta D. helados, va a comprar frutas, saborizantes, leche, y entre otros insumos necesarios para la elaboración D. helados D. diferentes tamaños y sabores. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza D. animales y al comercio.
texts.en:
Sra. Francisca is 38 years old and married. She did not have the opportunity to study. Francisca has six children, two of whom are in school. She is a merchant who sells ice cream. Francisca started this business at a time of financial necessity and because she needed money to support her family. Now she has been in business for six years. She has the support of her husband, who is also a merchant.

Francisca decided to organize a group so that she could request a loan to increase her operating capital for selling ice cream. She plans to buy fruit, flavorings, milk, and other necessary supplies for making ice cream in different sizes and flavors. The other members of the group raise animals and have retail businesses.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making ice cream.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel, de 56 años, vive en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. En compañía de su esposa Dionicia y con el menor de sus 7 hijos, pues el resto son mayores y viven independientes. Se dedica a la agricultura desde muy joven, recuerda como los miembros de su comunidad se ayudaban mutualmente en sus chacras, y por eso sabe que trabajando en equipo las cosas salen mejor. En  la actualidad siembra papa y alverjas en sus chacras que son propias, junto a sus hijos mayores que le ayudan, luego de días de sacrificada labor reciben la recompensa que es una buena  producción de calidad. Como son varios los miembros de su familia no necesitan la ayuda de operarios, además dice que gracias al trabajo agrícola ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, y por eso lo considera un trabajo rentable, aunque no siempre obtiene una buena producción, por las plagas o el clima, dice que siempre se gana algo de dinero de la comercialización a los mayoristas de la ciudad. Además también se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, que vende cuando se le presenta alguna dificultad. Y como es un hombre emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado comprar algunas cabezas de ganado, pues quiere ampliar este negocio. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de cumutay” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Razón por lo que promete pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Manuel de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de alverja y varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para sus sembríos de papa “única”.
texts.en:
Manuel, 56, lives in the Cumutay rural community in his own house with his wife, Dionicia, and the youngest of seven children.  The other children are adults and live independently.  He has worked in agriculture from a very early age and remembers how the members of the community used to help each other mutually on their croplands, so he knows teamwork is important for things to work well.  Now, with the help of his oldest son, he plants potatoes and peas on his own cropland.  After days of hard work their compensation is a good quality harvest.  Since the family is quite large they do not have to hire workers and, thanks to this agricultural work, he has been able to help his children get ahead.  Therefore he considers his work to be profitable although the harvest is not always good, due to plague or bad weather; but there is always money to be made selling to the wholesale dealers in the city.  

Manuel also raises cattle in an effort to expand his business.  He belongs to the communal bank "Lindo amanecer de Cumutay" and this is his fifth loan through MFP.  He is grateful to everyone who has made this loan possible so he can continue working toward progress.  He is committed to paying back the loan on time.  Manuel plans to use the loan to buy bags of pea seeds and several sacks of natural fertilizer to plant "única" variety potatoes.

loans.use: To buy a bag of pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 6 children. 

Nelson has a shop where he sells canned goods, beverages & snacks. He has had this business for 12 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Nelson is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nelson hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 42 years old and married with five children.  He is able to provide for his family with the income he gets from selling milk.  He has been selling milk for one year.  In addition, he does farming for more income generation.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business.  He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 9,000 Kenyan shillings to buy solar lamps.

loans.use: To purchase solar lamps

loans.name: Mavlina

texts.en:
Mavlina is from the village of Kumistavi, Imereti Region, West Georgia. She is 49 years old and lives with her husband (Zurab), her 21 year old son and two daughters (22 and 20 years old). 

Mavlina’s daughters are students in a high-school. Zurab and his son are workers and they work in the village. Mavlina is leading the agricultural business for the family. In particular, she has 2 cows, produces on average 40 kg cheese per month, and sells it at the local market. At the same time, she has 100 nut trees. Nuts are sold in season to the wholesalers. Total average monthly income of the family is 1200 Laris. 

Mavlina requested credit for the realization of her new business idea. The village where she lives is a tourist zone in the country. Recently, because of the active promotion of tourism in the country, the amount of tourists increased in her village. She plans to start up a trade with grocery products. With the requested credit she will buy the products, which are most demanded by the tourists, and sell them from her home (as the home has a good location for trade business). 

This new business initiative will increase the income of the family. Mavlina will be able to provide better care for her children and pay the study fees for the daughters.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products for grocery store.

loans.name: Ruhizahon's Group

texts.en:
Ruhizahon is the treasurer of this group. She is 38 and married, and her husband works in Russia. She is raising a fourteen-year-old child, who studies at school. Seven years ago, with an initial investment of 3500 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS), Ruhizahon started breeding livestock. With profits gained from reselling livestock, she was able to repair her house, purchase home appliances, and improve her living conditions. 

With money received from this loan, Ruhizahon wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening, and further reselling. In the future, Ruhizahon wants to provide her son with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a vegetable vendor in her village. She buys vegetables in bulk and then sells them at retail price. She is planning to expand her business in order to increase her income. Therefore, she would like to request a loan of PHP 15,000.00. Teresita believes she must be diligent enough to work hard to achieve her goals and send her children to school so they can have a better future. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and that she will have a permanent business stall in the market. 

Teresita is now 42 years old. Her husband Bernando is working as a farmer. They live in the village of Rizal, with their two children: Mary Ann is 17 years old and in her first year of college, and Mary Jane is 15 years old and in her fourth year of high school. Teresita is thankful her family is still happy even in times of crisis. She hopes and prays to God that her family will remain healthy and away from any harm.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, tomato, carrots, garlic and onions

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a hardworking business man aged 60. He is married and blessed with five children, all of whom attend school.  He has been repairing vehicles for the last fifteen years to support his family. He has employed four people in his business.  

Joseph has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers.  In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He has requested for a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy spare parts.

loans.use: buy spare parts

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: This is 28-year-old Aminata. She is married and has two children. In 2007, Aminata established her plastic slippers business. She began her business by selling on market days in the villages. Now she has a stall and travels to various locations to sell. Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 950,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Aminata has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional plastic slippers for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Aminata plans to educate her children to university level. She pays fees for her children and attends to their medical bills. The loan has been helpful as she now has a stall while continuing with her trips to the villages to sell on market days. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for plastic slippers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for rice fields.

loans.name: Aleyda Patricia

texts.es: Aleyda, de 37 años de edad, habita en El Transito municipio pequeño donde la siembra de maíz es para consumo propio pero donde el comercio es su principal actividad económica. Ella inicio con capital propio con una pequeña mesa de plástico puso productos tales como dulces, snacks, jabones, detergentes  y comenzó  a vender, luego le agrego cosméticos para vender en su comunidad. Requiere el préstamo para comprar cosméticos, perfumes, granos básicos, productos de limpieza, verduras, vegetales. Estos son parte de los productos que mas vende y de los cuales necesita surtir su pulpería para seguir mejorando sus ventas. Su meta próxima es ampliar su negocio con nueva mercadería para vender y seguir luchando por el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aleyda, 37, lives in El Transito, a small town where corn is grown for personal use but where commerce is the main economic activity.  She started a small business with her own capital: she set up a small plastic table with such things as candy, snacks, soap and detergent and started selling.  Later on she added cosmetics to sell in her community.  

She needs a loan to buy cosmetics, perfume, basic grains, cleaning supplies, vegetables.  These are some of the products that sell the most and that she needs to stock in her grocery store to continue improving her sales.  Her next goal is to expand the store with new merchandise to sell and to continue striving for her children’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
El socio sigue teniendo su negocio de tienda de abarrotes que junto a su esposa trabajan en este negocio y tambien sigue trabajando como chofer en el servicio de taxi que hace la ruta hacia el distrito de Anta,el socio por medio de estos trabajos la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de servicio de taxi.El socio solicita el credito para comprar productos como arroz,azucar,leche,aceite al por mayor para implementar su tienda de abarrotes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member and his wife continue running his grocery business.  He also works as a taxi driver along the route to Anta.  Together they move their children ahead in life through these businesses.  He wants to expand and improve the grocery store and taxi businesses.  He is asking for this loan in order to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cooking oil in quantity, in order to stock his store.

He is grateful for the loan and has promised to make his payments on time.

loans.use: El socio solicita el credito para comprar productos como arroz,azucar,leche,aceite al por mayor para implementar su tienda de abarrotes.

loans.name: Juana Evangelista

texts.es:
Juana, nuevamente solicita un préstamo, para la compra de productos de primera necesidad, ya que su negocio necesita ser reforzado, por eso se decide a solicitar e invertir en maíz, aceite,  leña y otros que le son necesarios la elaboracion de sus productos.
Ella ha tenido una buena experiencia con el negocio y ha logrado aumentar su nivel de venta.
texts.en: Juana once again requests a loan for the purchase of basic supplies, since her business needs to be reinforced. For this reason she has decided to invest in corn, oil, firewood and other supplies that are necessary for making her products.  She has had a good experience with the business and has managed to grow her sales.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil and firewood.

loans.name: 2 Febrero Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “2 FEBRERO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Maríanela. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, tejido de chompas, venta de mantas, carnicería, venta de mantas y polleras.

La señora Maríanela indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de abarrotes) que comprará de la Ceja y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato  y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The February 2nd Communal Bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Center. This group consists of six members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Maríanela. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses in order to get ahead such as managing a neighborhood store, weaving sweaters, selling shawls, operating a butcher shop, and selling blankets and skirts.

Sra. Maríanela says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined the organization after receiving an invitation at a promotional event. Maríanela currently manages a neighborhood store where she has worked for several years.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying groceries. She acquires her merchandise in La Ceja and then eventually sells the goods from her vending post. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family as much as possible. Maríanela is in a common-law relationship and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Maríanela said that she enjoys the training classes.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Jose Gudiel

texts.es:
José, es agricultor, tiene 5 hijos, quienes le ayudan a trabajar en el campo, él aprendió el proceso de la agricultura por su padre, quien desde joven lo llevo al campo a realizar el trabajo, tiene una experiencia de 20 años, trabajando para su familia.
Él esta solicitando un préstamo para el alquiler de 10 manzanas de terreno, ya que se dispone a sembrar y no cuenta con suficiente espacio para realizar la milpa, este préstamo le facilitara el dinero para pagar el alquiler.
La aspiración de José es mantener a su familia y darles lo necesario, a través de su trabajo humilde como agricultor.
texts.en:
José is a farmer and has five children who work with him. He learned agriculture from his father, who started taking him to the fields to work since he was very young. He has 20 years of experience working for his family.
José is asking for a loan for renting 10 blocks of land because he is about to plant and does not have enough space for this. This loan will provide him with the money to pay for the land's rent.
José's intention is to support his family and provide them with what they need through his humble work as a farmer.

loans.use: renting 10 blocks of land for planting

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.en: Sylvie, age 36, is married to a carpenter. They have seven children and all of them go to school. Sylvie has been selling sorghum for one and a half years. She has requested this loan to buy more sorghum to sell. Sylvie is planning to use the profits that will be obtained from the business for savings.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Golngailom B Group

texts.en:
Hoineichong is 34 years old married woman bearing 4 children (3 sons and a daughter) who are still studying. She is the representative of the group GOLNGAILOM B and also the featured borrower with her hand raise in the picture. Her husband is engage in cultivation and they all reside in Pangjang.
Hoineichong engage herself in small business mention may be made of a tea stall. She tries her level best in supporting her family in meeting the daily expenses and also for paying her children educational fees. She mentions that she gets good numbers of customers, but she runs her tea stall at other premises which is a problem for her.
She applies for this loan so that she could construct a tea stall at her residence which would enable her to run her business smoothly without worries enabling her to earn more for her family .She is very thankful and is eagerly waiting for the loan. 
Likewise the rest of the members are engage in vegetable vendor, weaving, banana farm and are looking forward for the loan so that they could start their respective income generating activities.

loans.use: to buy necessary items for the construction of a tea stall.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
A dressmaker by trade, Jeanne A. was born in 1964. She is married and the mother of two children. Her husband, an electrician, does not have a regular income and so Mrs. A. must contribute in large measure to covering household expenses. Using an initial loan of $400, she started a business selling clothing and accessories, since there are not any clothing shops in her neighborhood. Her business has done well, but with all her household expenses, she finds herself without financial capital.

Mrs. A. is requesting a second loan, amounting to $950, to stock materials for making clothing and accessories and to acquire additional sewing machines to modernize her shop, thus attracting more customers. She calls her boutique Mireille Couture.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Couturière de formation, Madame A. Jeanne est née en 1964. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Son mari, électricien bâtiment de formation n’a pas de revenu fixe et alors la femme est obligée de contribuer pour une grande part aux charges du foyer. Avec un premier crédit de $400 qu’elle a obtenu, elle s’est lancée dans la vente des produits de la mercerie car dans son quartier il n’y a aucune boutique de mercerie. Ce qui a bien marché mais avec toutes les charges du ménage, elle se retrouve sans fonds de commerce.

Madame A. Jeanne sollicite un second crédit de $950 pour se ravitailler en produits de mercerie et s’acheter d’autres machines et moderniser son atelier pour attirer plus de la clientèle.

loans.use: To stock up on items for a clothing boutique and to buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Juana Elena

texts.en:
My name is Juana V.. I have dedicated myself to selling baby clothes; I also sell plates and cups. I've been running my business for two years. I sell my products at private offices and government buildings, so I have good clients. My goal is to increase my inventory, and with my extra earnings I plan to remodel my house and take care of family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Juana V. me dedico a la venta de ropa para bebe, tambien vendo platos y vasos, tengo mi negocio hace 2 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que mi producto lo vendo en oficinas privadas y gubernamentales, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion asi mismo mantener a mi familia.

loans.use: Buy baby clothing and accessories, plates, cups, etc.

loans.name: Habidam

texts.en: Habidam lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is uneducated and he is the one responsible for supporting his family. He took his 4th cycle group loan and opened a vegetable cart and is making a good income and doing a good business. Now he wants to take anther loan to change his cart into a shop and buy extra vegetables to sell  so that he can attract more clients. He is happy with this loan and he would like to thank AFSG for helping him.

loans.use: To buy extra vegetables to sell

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.en:
Mr. Fidencio N. is 43 years old and has three kids aged 10, 6, and 5. He lives with Teresa Gimenez who is a housewife and also helps out Mr. N. every now and then at the job. Mr. N. works as a charcoal salesman and has been at it for over 4 years now. He works from his residence and employs three workers who are not family members to help him carry out his chores.

He works as a middleman, buying “carbon” (a kind of charcoal, frequently used as cooking fuel because it is cheaper than natural gas) and then selling it to various outposts in the country. He delivers to most convenience stores and is in high demand this season because of the unprecedented cold that swept the country.

He limits his sales to nearby areas since he currently doesn’t have the assistance of a vehicle due to monetary restraints. However, he delivers all his goods in a small cart fit to transport such merchandise. He wakes up every morning at 6 to sort out his merchandise and doesn’t stop working until 6 in the evening. Even with such a strenuous schedule, he sometimes finds himself working overtime to make sure not to lose customers in this very competitive business.

He started off with very little, as little as 500 kg of charcoal, and now handles over 15,000 kgs of charcoal monthly. He is a natural-born merchant and lived in Argentina for 7 years before where he sold clothing items. He has worked his way up and his place boasts a huge potential to be exploited. He requires this loan to be able to purchase more charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam K., 47, lives in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with her husband and three children. One of her children is a mechanic, and the other two are students. Her husband works as a policeman and earns US$0.60 a day. Mrs. Sam K. earns US$6 a day, making and selling wine. They would like to help their son start his own motorcycle-repair business. A loan of US$1,000 will help him buy the necessary motorcycle spare parts..

loans.use: Purchase of motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Osolo

texts.en: Osolo T. is a mother of 4 children and she is 52 years of age. She hails from Ajangbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells eggs. She has been in her business since the year 1986 and needs the loan of $1175 to buy more eggs for sale. This, she said, will make her serve her customers better. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more crates of eggs for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her stock.

loans.name: Kawala 1B(A) Group

texts.en:
Hellen is married with eight children. She wants to build rental houses with the extra business profits.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en: Yeabu started her business by selling a few boxes of cigarettes on a table.  A 37 year old mother of 6 children, she works hard to generate income to feed her children.  Her husband’s meagre income is insufficient to meet all the family expenses.  With her 3 previous micro loans she diversified her business within the homestead.  Yeabu is beginning to experience success and growth  and would like to continue to develop her dream by developing the small kiosk into a shop.  She requests a loan of $350.00 to begin her dream.

loans.use: To open a shop.

loans.name: Ravshanbek

texts.en:
B. Ravshanbek is a 22-year-old farmer. He has been working the land since he was fifteen. Ravshanbek grows onions and maize. When it is the season, Ravshanbek works in the fields from the early morning until the late night.

Five years ago, Ravshanbek started producing onions on a plot of 0.10 hectares (1/4 acre). Currently, he grows onions on 0.50 hectares (1.24 acres) and wheat on 0.50 hectares (1.24 acres) of land. Now, when the business is stable, Ravshanbek believes that it shall be the main income for him in future.

Today, Ravshanbek is applying for a loan for the first time. He requests 2000.00 Somoni ($600.00 USD) for 7 months. Ravshanbek is planning to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and combustive-lubricating materials. He will also use the part of the loan to pay the salaries of seasonal workers. Ravshanbek thanks everyone who trusts him by supporting him today. He promises to pay back the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer, combustive-lubricating materials, and to pay the salaries of seasonal workers.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma has been working in her little shop, located inside her home, for 15 years. When she moved to her present location, she thought that it would be a good idea to invest her time doing something productive that would improve her and her family’s then financial status. She has always considered herself to be a hardworking and enterprising woman, which is why she has stocked her shop with an assortment of products. Nine years ago, she started selling beauty products as well.

Additionally in her spare time, she maintains her small orchard, where she now harvests fruits such as lucmo (a subtropical Peruvian fruit), figs, and avocados. Perhaps she will also sell fruit sometime in the future; however, she would like to be able to expand her business space so that she can have more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace quince años Vilma se dedica a atender en su pequeña bodega ubicada en su casa. Cuando se mudo a su actual vivienda ella pensó que seria buena idea invertir su tiempo haciendo algo productivo y que mejorara la situación económica que en ese entonces su familia tenia. Desde siempre se considero una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, por ello ha ido implementando su tienda con diversos productos, es así que desde hace nueve años también se dedica a vender productos de belleza.

Por otro lado, en sus tiempos libres se ocupa de darle mantenimiento a su pequeño huerto, donde ya puede cosechar algunos frutos, tales como la lúcuma, el higo y la palta. En un futuro se dedique tal vez a vender frutas también; sin embargo, ella quisiera poder agrandar su local para poder tener mas mercadería.

loans.use: Increase merchandise to boost sales

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Mrs. Rita A. is 40 years of age and is married with 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria.  She works at her mill and she will use the loan to purchase a new grinding machine so she can boost her output to meet her customers demand. She has been a LAPO client for 2 years.

loans.use: To buy an additional Grinding Machine

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia has many dreams to follow. She has a good work ethic: each day she farms the earth that provides sustenance for her three children, planting potatoes and "olluco" (an Andean tuber) and taking what she harvests directly to the open markets of Concepción and Huancayo to sell it herself. This is how she is compensated for the effort of six months of cultivation. Aurelia hopes to break into the sale of "comidas típicas" (traditional meals) because she has a special gift for cooking. This is the reason that she is making a loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

Aurelia, tiene muchos deseos de seguir adelante con su trabajo esforzado de cada día labrando la tierra que le sirve de sustento para la superación de sus 3 hijos, sembrando papa y olluco para llevar lo que cosecha directamente al mercado de Concepción y Huancayo para comercializarlo personalmente y de esa manera compensar el esfuerzo de seis meses de cultivo. Tiene muchos deseos de incursionar en la venta de comidas típicas ya que posee un especial don para la cocina y a esa razón atiende su petición.

loans.use: Capital to break into a new occupation and to buy compost and fertilizers for her cultivated land

loans.name: José Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jose works for a company that distributes water to all parts of Nicaragua. He's a pump operator. He's worked for the company for 17 years and sometimes works seven days a week. His goal when he started his job was to be able to lift up his family, to provide them with food, education and housing. He has two young children. Work on his house has moved along slowly, always depending on what money he brought in.

Jose's next step is to continue the construction of a bedroom so that he can make his two young children more comfortable. That's why he's asking for the loan, to buy the materials he needs for construction.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Don José trabaja en la empresa encargada de distribuir agua a todo el país, se desempeña como operario de bomba. Tiene 17 años de trabajar para esta empresa, y algunas veces tiene que trabajar los siete días de la semana. Su meta cuando empezó este trabajo era poder sacar junto a su esposa a su familia adelante y poder darles educación,alimentación y una casa donde vivir. Tiene dos pequeños niños. El progreso de la construcción de su casa se ha ido dando poco a poco, todo en dependencia de los ingresos que ellos generan.

Su siguiente paso es poder continuar con la construcción de un cuarto de habitación para darle mayor comodidad a sus pequeños niños, es por eso que solicita el préstamo, para comprar materiales necesarios para esta construcción.

loans.use: Continue construction work on bedroom.

loans.name: Lola Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes is a member of the Comunal Azucenas Bank.

Lourdes has a partner, is 26 years old and has 2 children. Lourdes lives with her parents in the neighborhood of Nahuimpuquio. She is studying nursing and currently working in a pharmacy in a university. Lourdes and her mother have a shop together selling assorted groceries, vegetables, and fruits. In her free time, Lourdes sells cosmetics from catalogues.

Lourdes needs a loan of 1050 PEN (approximately 375 US dollars) which she will invest in the purchase of sugar, rice, oil, soap, and shampoo.

Lourdes dreams of buying land in order to build her home, to grow professionally, and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Lourdes es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.

Lourdes es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 2 hijos, Lourdes vive con sus padres en el barrio Ñahuimpuquio, Lourdes estudio enfermería técnica, actualmente esta trabajando en una botica y esta estudiando enfermería en una Universidad a distancia. Lourdes junto a su mama tienen una tienda surtida de abarrotes, verduras, frutas, además Lourdes en sus ratos libres vende cosméticos por catálogos.

Lourdes necesita un préstamo de 1050 dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, aceite, jabón, champú.

Los sueños de Lourdes son comprar un terreno para construir su casa, crecer profesionalmente y mejorar sus negocios.

loans.use: Lourdes needs a loan of 1050 PEN (approximately 375 US dollars) that will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, oil, soap, and shampoo.

loans.name: Essotina

texts.fr:
Née à Bafilo une localité assez éloignée de la capitale du TOGO, madame S. est mariée et a deux enfants. C’est une femme vaillante qui a ouvert une boutique de vente des produits cosmétiques dans le marché de son quartier. Ouvert depuis 2006, sa boutique est la principale de son milieu. Pour l’approvisionnement elle ne va pas loin puisqu’elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de la ville de Lomé où elle vit.
Pour ajouter certains articles à ses divers produits elle sollicite ce crédit premier crédit.
texts.en:
Born in Bafilo, a place that is quite distant from the capital of Togo, Mrs. S. is married and has two children. She is a courageous woman who has opened a little store selling cosmetics in the marketplace in her neighborhood. Her store has been open since 2006 and is the principal one in her area. She does not have to travel far to stock her store, since she does her buying in the big market of Lomé where she lives.

In order to add certain articles to her various products, she is requesting this, her first loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cosmetics for re-sale

loans.name: Mrs. Ly Sath Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly S. is the group leader of four loan members in Chambork Khpuos village, Kampong Chhnang province. She and her husband, Mr. Linh Cheng, are farmers. They earn a small revenue to support their family by harvesting rice on their small piece of land. Three of their children are employed in a garment factory, while their youngest is a farmer. Although Mrs. Ly S.'s family work in different businesses, they still experience poor living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Ly S. is asking for a loan to buy a pig for breeding, as well as build a piggery. 

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Two members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy a pig for breeding and build a piggery

loans.name: Patrocinio

texts.es: El señor Patrocinio 46 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos, su taller está ubicado en una zona de mucha concurrencia al costado de la ruta 2 en km. 66 de la ciudad de Eusebio Ayala, se inició en el oficio estudiando en un instituto en la ciudad de Capiatá y posteriormente en forma práctica con su padre y un tío quiénes tenían un taller mecánico en la ciudad de Caacupé allí trabajó durante 10 años dónde adquirió la experiencia necesaria como para sentirse  seguro dentro de lo que es su oficio.nActualmente Patrocinio ya cuenta con su propio taller en su domicilio, con los equipos más modernos, que lo fue adquiriendo gracias a los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya, el inicio fue difícil porque los clientes tenían que conocer su trabajo, pero gracias a las recomendaciones de sus propios clientes, vecinos, amigos, hoy día ya cuenta con una clientela formada, su principal logro dice ser el hecho de haber asumido riesgos y lograr la independencia laboral.n
texts.en:
Mr. Patrocinio is 46 years old, married and has 2 sons. His auto shop is located in a zone where competition is fierce: at the 66th kilometer mark on route 2, in the city of Eusebio Ayala. He began his career by taking classes at the town's trade institute and later by working hands-on with his father at the shop they owned in the city of Caacupé. For ten years he worked there, and he only left when he felt he had obtained the experience necessary to do his job comfortably. Currently, Mr. Patrocionio owns a home-based auto shop that is equipped with modern tools, which were purchased with loans he received from Fundacion Paraguaya. It was hard in the beginning because customers wanted to become familiar with the quality of his work, but thanks to clients', neighbors' and friends' recommendations, now he has a solid clientele. He says that his main accomplishment has been taking risks to achieve his professional independence.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lubricants, parts and other accessories.

loans.name: Saret

texts.en: Mrs. Saret N. is a basket maker in Prey Chuor village in Takeo Province. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to request a loan to buy more raw material to make more baskets and use some of the money to buy chickens to start a chicken-breeding business. She hopes thereby to increase her income and provide a better life for her children. Her husband, Mr. Chum Aun, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. She is 47 years old and the mother of five children: two are laborers while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy material to make baskets and buy chickens to start a chicken-breeding business

loans.name: Moah

texts.en:
Moah B. is a thirty year old married woman.  She has three children who are still in the basic school.  She lives with her family in Atebubu. 

Moah works very hard to help her husband take care of the family.  She is a farmer as well as a trader.  She sells yams and other food items.  Moah says she buys from the northern part of the country where prices of food stuffs are cost effective.  She then sells to the food vendors and other consumers in her locality.  

Moah wants to increase her working capital so that she can buy yams in bulk.  She wants the loan to help her achieve this dream. 

Moah is in a group called “God is King” Trust Bank in her community.  The group members guarantee one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua N. is 35 years old, a wife and a mother with five children, who are in school. She has been a food vendor for a year now. She prepares and sells kenkey (a local dish prepared from milled maize and eaten with all kinds of sauces and soups). It is a delicacy many Ghanaians enjoy daily either as breakfast, lunch, or dinner. She sells at the main business center of Agogo. Her business is doing well, and she wants to expand her operation to serve more customers.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more maize grains, vegetables, rice and assorted meat for her operation. She hopes this loan will help her increase her earnings and improve her family's well-being. She would be very grateful for this assistance. Her photo was taking when we visited her. With the loan she wants to add the sale of soft drinks to her operation so that her profit margin can be increased.

loans.use: To buy bags of dried maize grains, rice, vegetables, assorted meat, etc

loans.name: Adio

texts.en: Adio K. sells blocks. He is 42 years old and married with 4 children. He hopes to expand this business. He needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more blocks to sell. He says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more blocks to sell

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon C. is 27 years old and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She stays at home and raises pigs. Besides doing this activity, she also sells sugar cane. On average, she makes USD $4 a day, while her husband makes USD $4 by running a moto-taxi business. This couple has two children, one of whom is in school and one other is too young to attend school.
Mrs. Thon C. is asking for a loan to expand her livestock by adding more pigs.

loans.use: To buy more pigs

loans.name: Lin

texts.en: Lin C., 27, owns a brickfield used to make charcoal. He sells the charcoal from his house and sometimes customers come to buy at his house. He is married with two teenage children. His wife works as a local farmer and sells desserts out of her home to the neighborhood. C. is applying for a loan to increase his business capital.

loans.use: To increase the capital in his business

loans.name: Alifali

texts.en: Alifali M. is a shop vendor who sells a variety of goods including women's clothing, textiles and kitchen articles. He has more than fifteen years of experience in this field. He reached his original goal two years ago when he realized his dream of building his own store. His one son studies at school, and Alifali dreams of providing him with an excellent education. To continue the growth of his business, Alifali applied for a $2000 loan with the loan term of fifteen months.

loans.use: To purchase more textiles to sell

loans.name: Esmelda María

texts.es:
La señora Esmelda B. se dedica a la venta de mariscos en el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua siendo este su negocio con el cual mantiene su núcleo familiar compuesto por sus dos pequeños hijos en edades escolares.

Con el propósito de adquirir los mariscos, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y de esta manera continuar su venta en su localidad que tanto necesita de su inversión para crecer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esmelda B. sells seafood in the wholesale market in Managua. The business maintains her immediate family, comprised of her two small children who are of school age. With the intention of acquiring seafood, she has come to apply for a loan at Ceprodel. This way she can continue to sell in her area, also making investments needed to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seafood.

loans.name: Sodir

texts.ru:
Ашурматов Содир- парень 23 лет, женат, имеет двоих детей. Он занимается продажей женских платков на «Авган базаре» города Худжанда. За товаром ездит сам в Бишкек. Его оборотный капитал среднего уровня. Поэтому для расширения своего  бизнеса Содир хочет получить кредит.
Он планирует съездить за товаром весеннего ассортимента. У него много знакомых , которые покупают у него платки, при мониторинге  было явно видно. Что у Содира стабильная торговля.
texts.en:
A. Sodir is a young 23 year old man; he is married and has two children. He sells women’s handkerchiefs at the “Avgan Bazaar” in the city of Khujand. He travels himself for products to Bishkek. He has an average level of working capital. This is why Sodir would like to get a loan to grow his business. He plans to travel to purchase spring products. He has a lot of acquaintances who purchase handkerchiefs from him. It was obvious during monitoring that Sodir has stable sales.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of handkerchiefs

loans.name: Consepcion

texts.en:
Consepcion M. is from the village of El Paraiso. She is 52 years old. Consepcion is married and has two school-aged children and two who are now grown. To make a living, Consepcion owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Consepcion has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Consepcion joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Consepcion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business.

Consepcion is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Consepcion from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make prepared food items for sale

loans.name: Mamarahim

texts.en:
M. Mamarahim is 51 years old. He is married with six children. Mamarahim has a small restaurant where he sells breakfast, lunch and dinner.
