Mrs Thông is 61 years old and she is married with 2 children.
 
She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years.
Thông lives in Dong Son district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
In 2011, Thông joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Thông has successfully repaid 7 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
Thông is a reputable person in the community. She is the leader of her solidarity group. 
The main hardship that Thông faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future.
With her business profit, Thông hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grace would like to buy top dressing, fertilizer, and insectcides.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Seven years ago, María Teresa's husband lost his job and because there was a lack of employment in the country, it was very hard for him to find a new one. They have 3 children, 2 of which were attending high school, but they didn't have the means to continue their education. María then decided to open a workshop and become a seamstress. She began to post a few ads around and that's how she started to have clients. Her family was able to make ends meet. She was then able to buy an industrial sewing machine ad now she sews school and secretary uniforms. The number of clients increased so she had hire someone to help her with work.

María Teresa needs a $200 loan to buy rolls of fabric to make summer clothes, and she wishes to see her business grow. You can be an important part and contribute to the growth of this business.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Hace siete años, el esposo de la señora Maria Teresa se quedó sin trabajo y debido a la falta de empleo del país le fue muy difícil conseguir un lugar para laborar, tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos asisten a la preparatoria y no contaban con recursos para pagar sus colegiaturas. Ante esta situación Maria inició su negocio como costurera, comenzó colocando anuncios en las colonias y así obtuvo clientes, de esta manera fue como su familia logró salir adelante. Después le fue posible comprar una máquina de coser industrial y ahora cose uniformes escolares y secretariales, y debido a la gran demanda consiguió a una persona que le ayude a maquilar.

Maria Teresa necesita de un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que utilizara para la compra de rollos de tela para maquilar ropa de verano, ella tiene enormes deseos de crecer. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental y contribuir con el crecimiento de este negocio.

loans.use: Compra de insumos

loans.name: Wani

texts.en: Wani is a 28 year old mother and is married with one girl aged 5 years. Her husband Darman is a fisherman, earning about $5 in a day. To supplement her husband's income, Wani makes and sells various cooked foods. From this business, she can earn about $2 in a day. Wani needs a loan of $125. With this loan she can buy more materials, thus her working capital gets bigger and more or less enables her to double her income eventually. She really wants to have more income so that she can have a better life. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma is married and has two daughters, one of whom is studying at the university. With the salary her husband receives as a driver, it's very difficult to cover all the necessities of the family, which is why for the last 25 years Irma has worked making and selling food. Now the expenses of her family have increased, and she wants to expand her business in order to be able to offer her daughter the opportunity to continue with her studies.

The high quality of her products has helped her stay in business for such a long time. Now Irma wants to be able to offer her products at various locations, so she is requesting a loan for $475, which she will use to purchase a cart she can use to sell her products in places where there is a higher demand, and in that way expand her business. She agrees to repay this amount in 6 months. Be a part of this dream and help this family improve and expand their business. They thank you sincerely.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Irma es casada y tiene dos hijas, una de ellas está estudiado en la universidad y con el salario que su esposo recibe como chofer es muy difícil cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, por lo que desde hace 25 años Irma se dedica a elaborar y vender comidas, ahora que los gastos de su familia se han incrementado Irma quiere que su negocio crezca para poder darle a su hija la oportunidad de continuar estudiando.

La buena calidad de los productos que elabora le han ayudado a mantenerse en el negocio durante tanto tiempo, ahora Irma desea poder ofrece sus productos en varios lugares para lo que solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que destinará a la compra de un carrito con el que podrá ubicarse en lugares donde tenga una mejor demanda y hará crecer su negocio, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte de este sueño y ayuda a esta familia a mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy a food cart

loans.name: Gonce

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Sulaymanova Gonca. She is a refugee from the Azerbaijan-Armenian territory in the Gubadli region, which is situated in the western part of Azerbaijan. She lives in the city of Sumqayit. 

She is a business woman with a small used clothing business. She has dedicated many years of her life to this type of activity.  Her earnings go towards the family's expenses. She wants to improve her business and increase the number of clients and her income.  Therefore, she needs a $600 loan. Thanks to her wages, she can cover her children's education expenses.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys and her husband are tailors and make school backpacks and sweatshirts. They sell both in popular markets around the city of El Alto. They have one baby son who is 3 years old. They live in the area of San Roque in the city of El Alto.

The requested loan will be used to purchase raw materials like cloth. This is her first loan with IMPRO. She has been evaluated and her social and economic standing qualifies her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Gladys y sus esposo son costureros y confeccionan mochilas para el colegio y buzos deportivos, los mismos que comercializa en las ferias populares de la Ciudad de El Alto. Tienen un pequeño hijo de 3 años. Viven en la zona San Roque de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito requerido será destinado para la compra de materia prima (tela). Es el primer crédito con IMPRO y la evaluación socio-económica realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Angostura 1 Group

texts.es:
Consuelo, together with her husband, fishes for a living. She's 42 years old and has five children. The other members of the group are employed in the same line of work which provides them with the income they need to support their families. Commercial fishing is the predominant activity in this area, near Presa La Angostura, and the principal source of family income.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

CONSUELO JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO SE DEDICAN A LA PESCA, ELLA TIENE 42 AÑOS, CINCO HIJOS.LAS DEMAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SE DESEMPEÑAN EN LA MISMA ACTIVIDAD, YA QUE DE ESTA FORMA OBTIENEN INGRESOS PARA EL GASTO FAMILIAR. PORQUE ESTA ACTIVIDAD ES PREDOMINANTE EN LA ZONA QUE VIVEN.YA QUE SE LOCALIZA CERCA DE LA PRESA DE LA ANGOSTURA Y ES LA FUENTE INGRESOS DE LAS FAMILIAS DEL SECTOR.

loans.use: Buy fishing nets and other fishing implements.

loans.name: Bobokulov

texts.en: Bobokulov G. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He decided to become the client of MicroInvest because all his friends and colleagues improved their business situations thanks to MicroInvest. Mr.Bobokulov became the client of MicroInvest in 2007, and now recommends herself as a reliable and highly motivated client. He is engaged in commercial service and trade. He is engaged in  cottonseed oil selling.  Bobokulov G. works with suppliers and the prices for his good is lower than the bazaar prices. He has repeat customers. But working in the trade sphere he meets the stiff competition. He wants to provide a wholesale cottonseed oil purchase to open a specialized trade outlet in oil selling. Now Mr. Bobokulov requests the loan of $650 for a wholesale cottonseed oil purchase.

loans.use: for wholesale cottonseed oil purchase.

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en: Mr. Abdulai is 40 years old and married to 2 wives and has 5 children.  He worked as a mechanic specializing in both petrol and diesel engines but the income could not meet family expenses.  From his savings and group loans from SMT, he started selling spare parts in the garage.  With his first individual loan from SMT, Abdulai expanded the business and established a shop in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  Abdulai has no problem at the moment in meeting his family expenses.   He plans to open another small shop in a different location and is requesting a $1,200 loan.

loans.use: To open a second location for his business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 36 years old and is a married woman with two children, ages 15 and 10 years old. She and her husband also take care of one other older person, aged 65 years old.

Lucy owns a small salon, which she began running in 2005. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Kanchi S.,a resident of Thecho, Lalitpur lives in an extended family with her mother-in-law, brother-in-law, husband and one daughter. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.

Mrs. S. is a shopkeeper in Thecho. Her husband's name is Hira S. and he makes different types of handicraft goods. Her daughter is studying in primary school.

Mrs. S. opened her pots and utensils shop 3 years ago to upgrade the living standard of her family. Her husband also helps her in her work. Now Mrs. S. is asking for her fourth loan of US$ 400 to further expand her shop by buying items like plates, steel glasses, and hotpots for their shop to meet the increasing demand of the customers. She wants to strengthen the economic conditions of their family by increasing her income.

loans.use: To expand her household products business

loans.name: Ogbeide

texts.en: Ogbeide I. is 27 years old, still single and has been in business since 2006. She sells wine. She learned this business from her mother. She is from Edo state, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy more wine for sale. This will help her to serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy more wine for sale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is a young mother. When she realized that her husband’s income was not enough to cover the household expenses and their young son’s education she decided to go into business selling American clothing, bedspreads, and blankets. The economic gains she has made from her business have allowed her to improve her quality of life. Yolanda is hoping for your help, since she would like to invest more in her business. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can easily cover the expenses that will come with the birth of her next child.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

Yolanda, es una joven madre que al observar lo insuficientes que eran los ingresos que obtenía su esposo para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y educación de su pequeño niño decidió dedicarse al negocio de venta de ropas americanas, frazadas y mantas, los beneficios económicos que obtiene con este negocio le están permitiendo mejorar su calidad de vida.Yolanda espera recibir tu ayuda, debido a que tiene proyectado invertir en su negocio con la esperanza de obtener buenos beneficios y cubrir con tranquilidad los gastos que le demandará la llegada de su próximo bebé.

loans.use: Increasing her capital so she can increase her supply of products

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy comes from a humble, but hard-working family. Since forming her own home, she works various jobs in order to prevent her beloved children from suffering hardships. In reality, she works with her husband as housekeeping for an important and well-known hotel in Juliaca, allowing them to provide peace of mind and well-being to their family.

Additionally, in her free time Nancy, with ability and creativity, designs and makes beautiful chains, necklaces, and bracelets for women and children by hand, that are sold in the Juliaca markets. Nancy would like to purchase raw materials to continue working on her beautiful art. That is why she is requesting this loan that she promises to return quickly.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Nancy proviene de una familia humilde pero muy trabajadora, desde que formó su hogar se dedicó a diferentes oficios para mantener sin privaciones económicas a sus queridos hijos. Actualmente, junto a su esposo viene trabajando como personal de limpieza de un importante y reconocido hotel de la ciudad de Juliaca, con este trabajo puede ofrecer tranquilidad y bienestar a su familia. Adicionalmente ha esta labor, en sus horas libres con mucha creatividad y habilidad elabora artesanalmente hermosas cadenas, collares y pulseras para damas y niñas que son vendidos al por mayor a los comerciantes de dicha ciudad.Nancy tiene pensado adquirir materia prima para seguir dedicándose a su bello arte, para ello es que solicita este préstamo que promete devolver puntualmente.

loans.use: To acquire raw materials for design of handmade jewelry and keep up with client orders.

loans.name: Lidia Teodosia

texts.es:
Lidia is a 38 year-old single mother of three children, 20, 17, and 10 years of age. She has had different jobs as she is responsible for the upbringing of her three children. At the present she works at home selling chicken and making crates, always trying to spend time with her family. Working at home makes is easier for her to be with her children as well as take care of business. What she likes the most is the flexibility to manage her time, but the difficult part is to satisfy the orders for crates because of lack of machinery or resources. It is Lidia’s dream and motivation that her children become professionals. She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of wood to be able to meet orders and in the future become an important businesswoman in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Lidia tiene 38 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus tres hijos de 20, 17 y 10 años. Siempre trabajó en diversas actividades por la responsabilidad que tenía en criar a sus tres hijos, ahora se ocupa a la venta de carne de pollo y a la construcción de cajones, estas dos actividades las realiza en su domicilio, tratando siempre de prestar el tiempo necesario a su familia.Trabajar en su casa le ayuda a no alejarse de sus hijos y dedicarse a la par con sus dos negocios, siendo esto lo que más le agrada, la flexibilidad de tiempo, pero siempre existen los aspectos difíciles, siendo uno de ellos, el cumplir con los pedidos de cajones, ya que por falta de maquinaria o algunos recursos la limitan a seguir trabajando. Lidia tiene visualizado el ver a sus hijos profesionales, esto es su mejor motor de progreso. Está muy convencida en invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de madera y atender a las demandas de las personas, y con el tiempo ser una gran empresaria en este rubro en su localidad.

loans.use: Purchase wood to make crates in order to increase business.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
Aydee tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Es una joven madre de familia que se esfuerza para conseguir el sustento diario para su familia, lo hace realizando las tareas del campo, hace 6 años que se casó y empezó a compartir este trabajo con su esposo.Cultiva papa, olluco y algunas verduras como la cebolla, esto lo hace generalmente por las tardes, porque en la mañana trabaja en un programa gubernamental llamado “Wawawasi”, es como una labor de niñera, brinda su casa y su tiempo para cuidar a los niños de otras mujeres, cuando estás salen a trabajar y no tienen con quién dejar a sus hijos.En la época de cosecha su trabajo se intensifica, pero vale su esfuerzo, porque luego llevará a la ciudad para comerciar sus productos directamente; mientras espera a ese momento, también realiza actividades ganaderas, criando animales para engordarlos y luego venderlos, de esa manera, espera los 6 meses para la cosecha. 
Aydee se esfuerza constantemente por el bienestar de sus 3 hijos pequeños.
Con este crédito podrá invertir en la compra de un toro, para que pueda seguir adelante con sus cultivos y el crecimiento de su ganado.
texts.en:
Aydee is 26 years old. She lives with her husband and three children. She is a young mother who strives to obtain daily sustenance for her family, and she does so doing farm work. It was six years ago that she got married and began to share this work with her husband. She grows potato, 'olluco' and some vegetables like onion. She generally does this in the afternoons because in the mornings, she works at a government program called "Wawawasi". There, her work is like that of a nanny- she offers her house and her time to take care of children of other women when they are working and don't have a place to leave their children. During harvest time, her work load increases, but her efforts pay off because she is then able to take her products to the city to sell directly. While she waits for this moment, she also devotes her time to other money making activities such as breeding livestock to fatten and then sell. This is how she passes the time during the 6 month wait until harvest. Aydee constantly strives for her well being and that of her children. With this loan, she will be able to purchase a bull, so she can continue succeeding with her crops and livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bull to increase the number of her livestock

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: N. Dilorom is 45 years old. She is married and has two children who go to school. Dilorom is a market vendor. She has been selling men's underwear and socks in the local market of Istaravshan town. With a business like this, Dilorom has been feeding her children and husband, who is an invalid, for 10 years. Dilorom started this business seven years ago. Little by little, thanks to her passion for making sales and her personality, she has been increasing her number of clients and making her business grow. At this moment, Dilorom is requesting a loan that she will invest in purchasing more merchandise to meet the demands of her clients. She promises to repay this loan in 12 months. She is planning to spend the profit on the treatment of her dearest husband. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: Purchasing of the underwear and socks for men in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Norma Maria

texts.es: Doña Norma tiene 32 años de edad, tiene dos hijos de 8 y 10 años de edad, que estudian la primaria, habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama Villa Reconciliación, su esposo trabaja como conductor de una ruta en la ciudad de Managua, lo cual sale desde horas muy temprano a su trabajo, la Sra. Norma se levanta desde horas muy temprano para mandar a su esposo desayunado, ya que su trabajo es agotador y riesgoso. Su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapatos en su casa, inicio con la liquidación de su trabajo anterior que tenia en la zona franca las Mercedes, lo cual lo invirtió en ropa para iniciar una etapa nueva en las ventas ya tiene dos años y logrado mantener su negocio. Con la solicitud de crédito es para comprar más inventario de ropa para damas y caballeros como ropa de niños, ya que tiene muchos encargos a la fecha y espera obtener buenas ganancias para poder ahorrar y comprar un terreno  propio ya que habita en la casa del suegro. A largo plazo es poder construir su casa digna para su familia y crecer con su negocio para poder seguir adquiriendo otro préstamo para hacer crecer su inventario y lograr sus objetivos.nn
texts.en:
Norma is 32 years old and has two children, 8 and 10 years old who attend elementary school. She lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood of the capital, Managua. Her husband drives a route in the city of Managua, and must leave home very early to get to work. In order to make breakfast for her husband whose work is exhausting and dangerous, Norma also gets up very early. Norma's business is the sale of clothes and shoes from her home. She started this business two years ago with a settlement from a previous job in the duty-free zone "las Mercedes": she invested the money in clothing to begin a new stage in sales and her business has been successful. The loan will be used to increase her inventory of ladies', men's and children's clothing as she has many orders to fill and hopes to make enough money to be able to save and buy her own land as she lives with her father-in-law. Her long-term goal is to build her own home worthy of her family and increase her business in order to request future loans to increase her inventory and reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy adult and children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Mrs. Man S. is a mushroom farmer who lives in Prey Chuor village in Takeo Province. However, she faces an obstacle in that she does not have enough money to re-seed the farm. Thus, she is seeking a loan to buy seeds to grow mushrooms, thereby increasing her income and improving her family's living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Pel Sok, is a construction worker. Mrs. Man S. is 46 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are laborers while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy seeds to grow mushrooms

loans.name: Andrea Benedicta

texts.es:
La señora Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Echave” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 72 años de edad, es casada y madre de 9 hijos mayores edad. 
Con el primer préstamo que recibió, aumentó su capital de inversión para comprar frutas y golosinas para venderlos en su puesto de trabajo. 
Con este préstamo de S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más golosinas y frutas para venderlos en su puesto de trabajo en el puerto.
Andrea desea continuar trabajando para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Andrea is a partner with the Victor Echave Community Bank of the district and province of Puno. She is 72 years old, married and has 9 grown children. With the first loan that she received she increased her investment capital by buying fruits and sweets to sell at her job. With this loan of $975, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy more sweets and fruits to sell. Andrea wants to keep working in order to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and sweets

loans.name: Nada Group

texts.en:
This group's name is Nada; it is a group made up of three ladies, who live in Aley Mount Lebanon.

-Sawsan is a 29-year-old woman. Sawsan has been working as a private teacher for two years. She requested a loan of 300 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase books and some school furniture. This is the first time that Sawsan has requested a loan.

Sawsan is speciA. in her work because she is patient with students and knows how to make them study. Her clients are her neighbor’s children. She decided on doing her business because she always wanted to be a teacher. In the future, she plans on continuing her studies.

-Nada is a 24-year-old woman. She has been working in a clothing shop for two years. Nada requested a loan of 300 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop and to do some maintenance work on her car. This is the first time that Nada has requested a loan.

Nada is speciA. in her work because she has good relations with her clients. She decided on this business because she wanted to improve her financiA. situation. In the future, she plans on purchasing a shop.

-Hekmeh is a 53-year-old woman. She has been working at handicrafts for twenty years. Hekmeh requested a loan of 300 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase thread for her work. This is the first time that Hekmeh has requested a loan.

Hekmeh is speciA. in her work because she has a lot of experience. Her clients are her neighbors and others. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

About Group Loans

In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individuA. share but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports the others and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda H., 34 years old, is a seaweed grower. Every day, she goes out on the sea to plant seaweed, feeling the heat of the sun to provide what her family needs. Her husband, Julito H., helps her plant seaweed to support their family. She previously worked as an encoder. But when she decided to get married, she left that job and started a seaweed farming business instead. She and her husband started their seaweed business using their own money; they grow the business by reinvesting their income. The business is located in Hingotanan, a very popular island in Bohol. Brenda is asking for a CEVI loan of Php 10,000 ($225 USD) to buy more seaweed for the farm. She believes that her loan will bring her a bigger harvest and more income for the family.
CEVI helps Brenda sustain her seaweed farm. Now, she enjoys the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage that CEVI gives to all their clients.

loans.use: To expand her seaweed farming business.

loans.name: Komilhuja

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old S. Komilhuja lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan but works in Khujand at the ‘Panjshanbe” bazaar, where he sells meat products (sausages and salami), sour milk products (pasteurized milk, curd, kefir and mask), vegetable oil, sweets, candies, and bread. He brings the goods from Istaravshan and Uzbekistan and also works with suppliers from Russia.

Komilhuja, a married father of three, is working hard to achieve a bright future for his children. He is now requesting a loan of Komilhuja 1200 TJ S for four months to purchase ice cream, a popular seasonal treat. Komilhuja thanks KIVA for its support and financial help.

loans.use: To purchase ice cream for his business.

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru: Шоимардонов Нурали житель района Рудаки.Возраст 35 лет ,женат и имеет четверых детей. Уже 15 лет занимается торговлей. Торгует овощами и фруктами. В месяц получает доход в размере 200 долларов США. Для того, чтобы увеличть доход от своего бизнеса он планирует получить кредит сроком на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nurali S. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 35 years old, married, and has four children. He has been working in sales for fifteen years. He sells vegetables and fruit. He earns about 200 US dollars a month. In order to increase his income, he wants to take out a loan for six months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Kioni

texts.en:
Kioni has owned a small food vendor store in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for 9 years. She belongs to Allah Karim group loan (Group code 2021). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 40. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Kioni is 48 years old, married, and has two children: ages 30 and 28.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Ranis

texts.en:
Ni Ketut Ranis (DNR.M-0646) is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Dsn. Anggasari, Ds. Ekasari.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To making a living, Ni Ketut Ranis owns and operates a business venture raising livestock.  Her main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale.  Ni Ketut Ranis has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 250,000 IDR a month from this activity.

In 2007, Ni Ketut Ranis joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Ketut Ranis has successfully repaid a previous loan of 200,000 IDR from DINARI.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  Ni Ketut Ranis is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.  This loan will be his third loan from DINARI.  Ni Ketut Ranis plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to financially support immediate members of his family.

About DINARI:
The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socioeconomic development opportunities to small business owners.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Ketut Ranis - (DNR.M-0646) merupakan 35 tahun pria.  Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Dsn. Anggasari, Ds. Ekasari.  Dia (laki-laki) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Ketut Ranis memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Ketut Ranis sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 8 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut Ranis menghasilkan sekitar 250,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, Ni Ketut Ranis bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Ketut Ranis meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli ternak indukan.  Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Ketut Ranis berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:
Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 33-year-old widow. She is the loving mother of three children, all of whom are in school.

For the past ten years, she has earned a living by working as a food vendor. Specifically, she sells rice with gravy stew. From the morning until the afternoon, she sells her food at the community market. Elizabeth explains that there is always high demand for her food.

Elizabeth belongs to a village bank called "Power and Might." She is now seeking a loan to buy more bags of raw materials such as rice, meat, cooking oil, spices, and charcoal. She is convinced that the loan will help her increase her inventory in order to hedge against price hikes, thereby ensuring she has sufficient resources to cook her food. She also wants to use a portion of the loan proceeds to support her children with their education. She is extremely grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional raw materials

loans.name: Lazu

texts.en:
Lazu C. is 39 years old and married. Her husband is a wildlife officer, and they have three children who are in school. Lazu currently sells tea. She is requesting a loan to stock more sugar and purchase chairs and tables for her restaurant. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, chairs and tables

loans.name: Khuriniso

texts.en: S. Khuriniso is a widow and has a teenage daughter. She is a private entrepreneur who works in the central city market selling women’s shoes, offering a large variety of women’s shoes at reasonable prices. She has been in business for thirteen years and has benefited a lot from two years of partnering with IMON International Ukraine. Lending services have helped her buy a new vending facility in a different part of the city, reach sustainability in her business, and given her confidence for the future. Khuriniso needs a loan of 4,000 Somoni to re-stock her inventory and purchase shoes wholesale for the summer season. She believes that the sphere of market trade where she works is a promising niche and will continue to grow and develop in the future. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase shoes wholesale for the summer season

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
B. Nguyễn Thị (20201060042) is a 37 year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. B. is the group leader of a 5-member loan group offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Trác Bút 06 (6).

B. is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, B. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for sale. B. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5.500.000 vnd a month from these activities.

On 12/16/2008, B. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. B. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.186.000 vnd from SEDA. This previous loan was used to expand shelter for the borrower's livestock. She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 vnd which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. B. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Nguyễn Thị B. (20201060044) is a 34 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.600.000 vnd loan to support her business in the arts sector operating a handicraft business.

2. Mẫn Thị T. (20201060045) is a 33 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 vnd loan to support her business operating a specialized retail store.

3. Mẫn Thị P. (20201060046) is a 26 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.600.000 vnd loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture-making business.

4. Nguyễn Thị G. (20201060051) is a 26 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 vnd loan to support her business operating a specialized retail store.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. B. Nguyễn Thị (20201060042) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. B. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Trác Bút 06 (6). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán. B. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, B. kiếm được khoảng 5.500.000 vnd. Vào 16/12/2008, B. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. B. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.186.000 vnd từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mở rộng chuồng cho gia súc của người vay. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 vnd. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị B. (20201060044) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.600.000 vnd. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ thuật. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hàng thủ công mỹ nghệ. 2. Mẫn Thị T. (20201060045) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 vnd. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 3. Mẫn Thị P. (20201060046) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.600.000 vnd. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. 4. Nguyễn Thị G. (20201060051) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 vnd. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed  and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower has asked to be visually removed from the Kiva website

loans.use: to increase her assortment of goods

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es:
Doce integrantes tiene la Asociación Comunal “Las Estrellas” y están juntas hace más de 10 años y participan activamente de sus reuniones. Todas tienen variados negocios, así por ejemplo Sofía Rita G. de 44 años, tiene el negocio de atención de fotocopiadora hace 10 años, en la zona 16 de Julio, atiende todos los días con amabilidad y respeto a sus clientes y ella necesita el préstamo para comprar sus insumos como son las hojas al por mayor. 
Juana Q. otra de las integrantes de 44 años también tiene un negocio de confección de edredones, tiene su taller en su domicilio y trabaja todos los días, realiza esta actividad hace 9 años y ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima como  tela.
Las demás integrantes del grupo también tienen sus negocios como la venta de ropa, sazonadores y verduras.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA, INSUMOS Y MERCADERIA

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos, ella estudio secundaria completa, y  vive  en la parcialidad de Cutipa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace  1 año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para comprar ovejas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo ella lo va a utilizar en la compra de ovejas, Lidia los vende en las ferias semanales en Pilcuyo e Ilave los domingos, también se ayuda con sus chacras.

Su deseo es poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan  las reuniones y los ahorros.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovejas.

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
L. alcancía comunal “LAS PALMERAS” esta integrada por 12 socios, quienes  han demostrando honestidad, responsabilidad y sobre todo ganas D. salir adelante; esta ubicado en L. zona alta D. Huaycan distrito D. Ate departamento D. Lima. 
Actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta D. L. alcancía comunal L. señora Gladys S., casada, con 5 hijos y se dedica a L. venta D. ropa en forma ambulatoria. 
Trabajan con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad, desD. hace 5 años y realizan diversas actividades como: venta D. gaseosas, cervezas, golosinas, plásticos, pasteles, ropas y accesorios para el hogar, venta D. comidas y ceviches. Gladys manifiesta que L. competencia  comercial es alta pero los socios tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios, ofreciendo productos variados y D. buena calidad. Con el reciente préstamo, es para aumentar nuestro capital D. trabajo para adquirir mercaderías e insumos para seguir generando mas ingresos para nuestras familias con el cual nos permite  mejorar L. educación D. nuestros hijos, por ello estamos muy agradecidos por L. confianza depositada y  seguir trabajando con más entusiasmo con L. Institución.
texts.en:
The “Las Palmeras” communal bank is maD. up of 12 members who have demonstrated honesty, responsibility, and, above all, the will to get ahead. It is located in the high zone of the Huaycan district of Ate, department of Lima.

Currently, the job of president of the communal bank is taken on by señora Gladys, married with 5 children and engaged in the sale of clothing on an itinerant basis. We have worked with EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad for 5 years and carry out diverse activities such as the sale of soda water, beer sweets, plastics, pastries, clothes, household accessories, food, and ceviches.

Gladys states that our commercial competence is high because the members have a lot of experience and know how to promote their businesses, offering varied products of good quality. The recent loan application is to add to our working capital and to acquire merchandise and raw materials in order to generate more income for our families. This will permit us to improve the education of our children. We are very thankful for the confidence shown to us and will continue working with more enthusiasm with the Institution.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to increase our working capital and acquire merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Wilma De

texts.es: Wilma tiene 45 años  es casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solo una depende de Wilma, su esposo está trabajando en España desde hace varios años atrás. La señora Wilma es enfermera y aparte tiene el negocio de venta de  mercadería según la época ahora que estamos en tiempo de calor trajo chinelas y sandalias para vender ambulando como hace toda su mercadería, la competencia es alta pero la cliente trata de traer cosas bonitas y baratas y además la clientela a la que presta sus productos están acostumbrados a la calidad de su servicio. Gracias a ambas actividades Wilma ha cumplido sus cuotas en forma puntual en su anterior crédito sin ningún atraso, lo cual significa que sus ingresos son buenos gracias a sus dos actividades, y también tiene crédito en otra entidad financiera.

loans.use: PARA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: Z. Bernadette est née en Août 1969 et vit depuis neuf ans à Danto, un quartier de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à KOHOUN Philippe, Bernadette est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à sa charge. Le couple prend ensemble en charge les dépenses de la famille. Ayant abandonné les classes au secondaire, Bernadette mène depuis près de cinq ans comme activité la vente de bouillie(aliment fait à base d’amidon de maïs ou de mil) accompagnée de pâté (fait à base de farine de blé). Bernadette vend aussi des tissus. Bernadette fait ses approvisionnements à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo. Bernadette vend la bouillie et les pâtés au CEG Danto à Porto-Novo. Mais c’est au marché Ouando que Bernadette vend ses tissus. Bernadette est à son premier crédit à ALIDé. Pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et mieux satisfaire la demande de ses clients, Bernadette sollicite ce crédit auprès de ALIDé.  Bernadette envisage plus tard acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Bernadette Z. was born in August of 1969 and has lived for nine years in Danto, a neighborhood of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin. Married to Philippe Kohoun, Bernadette is the mother of four children who are all in school, two of whom she is currently supporting. The couple takes care of the family expenses together. Having dropped out of school at the secondary level, for almost five years Bernadette has been selling fabric and "bouillie" (cornstarch or millet based food) accompanied by pâté (made with a wheat flour base). Bernadette also sells fabric. Bernadette gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin and in the Ouando market in Porto-Novo. Bernadette sells her bouillie in the Danto school in Porto-Novo, but she sells her fabric in Ouando. This is Bernadette's first loan with Alidé. Bernadette is requesting this loan from Alidé to increase her working capital and to better satisfy her customer's needs. In the future Bernadette plans to purchase a plot of land.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs, de sorgho et de farine de blé ainsi que des tissus.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia C. is from the village of Colonia, Valencia City. She is 53 years old. Cecelia is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Cecelia runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Cecelia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cecelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecelia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cecelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Sinignessigui sont majoritairement  des femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne  32 ans, 2 enfants et qui  vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Bougoula Hameau un des villages de la commune de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quatrième  prêt solidaire. Les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles font la vente  de fruits, tissus, sounbala, chaussures, bois de chauffe, condiments alimentaires et friperies.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5régimes de bananes, 1chargement de charrette d’orange et de mandarines, 1 vingtaine de complets (tissus pour  hommes et femmes), 4 sacs de 100kg de graine de néré pour faire du sounbala, 10 douzaines de chaussures en plastique, 1 chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 6 colis de condiments et 3 ballons de friperies.  Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent au marché de Bougoula Hameau et à domicile, au comptant, en détail et  à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles comptent sur plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  subvenir davantage aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Sinignessigui group are mainly married women with an average age of 32, an average of 2 children, and generally live in polygamous families in Bougoula Hameau, a village in the Sikasso region - the third largest administrative region in Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organisation in order to meet their customers' demands and are on their fourth loan. All previous loans have been successfully repaid. They sell fruit, fabric, sounbala, shoes, firewood, condiments and second hand clothes. With their new loan they intend to buy five bunches of bananas, one cartload of oranges and mandarins, around twenty suits (fabric for men and women), four 100kg sacks of néré seeds for making sounbala, ten dozen plastic shoes, one truckload of firewood, six parcels of condiments and three rolls of second hand clothes. They source their goods from the Sikasso town market and neighbouring villages. They sell their retail ware at the Hameau Bougoula market and through home visits; they take cash and credit payments from a male and female customer base. The women envisage making an average monthly profit of 35,500 FCFA each; part of this would be used for savings and family needs, and the rest would be reinvested in business activities. They are counting on increased capital in order to respond to their customers' needs and to meet the needs of their families.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Colette

texts.fr: I. Colette est née en 1984 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Colette est mariée à AGBOTON Florent, un vendeur de madriers. Colette a deux enfants, mais un est scolarisé. Le second enfant n’a pas encore l’âge d’aller à l’école. Colette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Il y a deux ans de cela que la famille s’est installée au quartier Adogléta à Cotonou. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Colette n’a fait que l’école primaire. Pour aider son mari dans les charges de la famille, Colette vend depuis trois ans, des pâtes dentifrices et des pommades de façon ambulante. Colette s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Colette a obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Colette désire agrandir son activité afin d’acquérir de nouvelles parts de marché. C’est la raison pour laquelle Colette sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Colette I. was born in 1984 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Florent Agboton, a merchant of construction beams, and is the mother of two children. Only one of them attends school, while the other is still too young. Colette lives with her children and her husband. Two years ago the family relocated to the neighborhood of Adogléta in Cotonou. The couple provides together for the family. Colette attended only primary school.

To help her husband to provide for the family, Colette has been hawking toothpaste and pomades for three years. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She got once a loan from Alidé and repaid it on schedule. Colette wants to expand her activity and get new market shares. Therefore she came to Alidé and applied for a second loan.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toothpaste

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 34 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Ali has owned a restaurant since 2002. He sells chicken and chicken sandwiches. Ali requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase chicken for his restaurant. This is his fourth cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loans helped improve his work by enlarging his restaurant and offering new platters.

Ali is speciA. in his work because he knows how to cook his chicken and he is known for that; apparently, he has a sort of a secret homemade cooking recipe for his chicken which gives it a speciA. taste and that’s why his clients like going to his restaurant. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. Ali decided on this business because he learned it when he was young with his uncle. In the future, he plans on improving his business and maybe opening a second restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase chicken for his restaurant.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer J., 33, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. Married to Bonifacio J., a factory worker, she is blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing a bike rental business for some time.

Jennifer has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends the weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow seven times in CCT’s cooperative.

Jennifer is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand her bicycle renting business. Her business lets her earn an extra profit of PHP 3,800 per month.

Now, with your help, Jennifer would like to obtain a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying assorted bicycle parts.

Jennifer dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can earn more and send her children to a better school.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy assorted bicycle parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stocking up and selling palm oil and corn

loans.name: Petronilo

texts.en:
Petronilo A. is from the village of Digkilaan in Iligan City. He is 46 years old and married. To make a living, Petronilo runs a sari-sari (variety) shop where he sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Petronilo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Petronilo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Petronilo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Petronilo is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Petronilo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his sari-sari store.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland is a 34-year-old single man living with and taking care of his elderly parents.

Roland has been working as a carpenter for the past ten years, working on a freelance basis upon the request of the customers. Over the years, he has been able to make a good reputation and has gained a growing number of clients.

Today, Roland is requesting $1,200 to purchase carpentry tools because, after this long period in this occupation, he's planning to expand his business market and meet his clients’ requirements to keep his good reputation.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry tools

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is a married woman with four children under the age of 11. Her oldest child is attending school. She additionally takes care of her parents. She purchases vegetables from the market and sells them at home to neighbors. With the Ksh. 15,000 loan, she hopes to improve her house, build a shop, and buy more vegetables, soap, and flour to sell. 

Her greatest challenge is that food goes bad when there are no customers and that sometimes people buy on credit but don't pay. She owns her home but does not have water or electricity. She cites food, water and paraffin as her greatest monthly expenses. She joined Yehu so that she could improve her life.

loans.use: Build a shop and buy more vegetables, soap and flour to sell

loans.name: Tu's Group

texts.en:
Tu T. V. is 26 years old. She lives in Xom Thuong village. She is married with two children. The children are going to school. Mrs Tu sells fruit in the market. She earns 100,000 Vietnamdong to 150,000 Vietnamdong (VND) per day. She is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by SEDA’s microfinance program. She has participated in SEDA since 2007 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND to buy more fruit to sell.

About other borrowers in her group:

Quang V. N. is 40 years old. He grows trees and breeds poultry. He wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to invest in livestock.
Mai T. N. is 41 years old. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to breed the pigs.
Hai T. N. is 54 years old. She has a store. She wants to borrow 654,000 VND to invest in her store.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Christ Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
A. Mansah is forty-three years old. She is married to a farmer and has given birth to four children who are between the ages of eight and nineteen. Some of the children are still in basic school. 

A. M. is a hard-working trader. She is into fish-selling. She wants a loan to purchase cartons of fresh fish from wholesalers in bulk to scale up her business. A. has been in business for twelve years and dreams of owning a big cold store in the future. She also aspires to see her children reach higher levels in academia. 

A. M. is the leader of a trust bank group called 'Christ'. There are six members in this group. They are mainly petty traders and food vendors. The group requests the loan to procure goods in bulk to scale up their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase assorted fish in bulk

loans.name: Faith And Trust Group

texts.en:
Rebecca B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Faith And Trust". She is 51 years-old and married with four children who range from 15 to 32 years old. She holds a diploma in secretarial science. She also cares for two siblings. 

For three years, she has been selling used clothes at the Vai Town Market, Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 7,500 Liberian Dollar portion of this 37,500 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of used clothes. 

Her goal is to improve her business, make more profit, buy land and build a house so that her children can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy bags of used clothes.

loans.name: Lift The People Group

texts.en:
Mariama K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Lift the people. She is 41 years old, married and has two children who range from 14 to 20 years old. She also cares for two siblings.

She was only able to attend school through 10th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For 15 years, she has been operating a beauty salon in Peter Town, Harbel, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 7,000 LRD portion of this 25,000 LRD group loan to buy more hair dressing materials like shampoo, hair rollers, and a hair dryer, etc. She describes herself as a kind woman.

Her goal is to improve her business and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Musa is inset at lower right because he was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more hair dressing materials like shampoo, hair rollers and a hair dryer, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Mayra Alejandra

texts.es:
La Señora Mayra Alejandra C. es socia del banco comunal Primero de Enero, vive por el sector de Totoracocha, en la ciudad de Cuenca que es  la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador, su hermoso centro histórico fue nombrado  patrimonio cultural de la humanidad.

Nuestra socia tiene 24 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo este año ingresa al jardín de infantes, su esposo es chofer y presta sus servicios en un taxi, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, labora 4 días a la semana y lleva en esta actividad un año, vende recorriendo la ciudad. Se encuentra en su primer ciclo y fue invitada por una amiga de la comunidad a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería.

Su meta es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mayra Alejandra C. is a member of the Primero de Enero (January 1st) communal bank. She lives in Cuenca’s Totoracocha sector. Cuenca is Ecuador’s third most important city. Its beautiful, historic city center was named Cultural Patrimony of Humanity. Mayra is 24 years old, married and has two children who are 5 and 4 years of age. Her oldest son will start kindergarten this year. Her husband is a taxi driver. They do not own their own home, they rent. She sells all kinds of clothes. She works four days a week and has been in this line of work for a year. She sells in an itinerant manner throughout the city. This is her first loan cycle and she was invited to become part of this great group of tenacious, enterprising women by a girl friend in the community. She will use the funds to buy more merchandise. Her goal is to own her own home someday.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina  S. is a 39-year-old married woman who supports her family by selling a variety of products: school supplies, cosmetics, toys, etc.  She lives in Purok Bagong Pag-asa, Brgy. Antipuluan, Narra, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her retail business,  she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 55,000. 

Gina  is now borrowing PHP 29,500 so that she  can  purchase more stock to sell.   This will be her 21st loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Gina  aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Shally

texts.en:
Shally D. is from the village of Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Shally owns and operates a business selling religious items, primarily selling incense and candles to tourists and to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2005, Shally joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Shally is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional religious items and materials. This loan will be her eighth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional religious items and materials

loans.name: Rizalde

texts.en:
Rizalde G. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. He is 28 years old. Rizalde is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Rizalde owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rizalde has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rizalde joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rizalde has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rizalde is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rizalde from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en:
A small entrepreneur from Khujand, Mohira sells fish in one of the community markets. She is married with one child. Mohira started her business 9 years ago. She launched her start-up and got straight to work making wholesale purchases and working long hours to sell the stock. Mohira's business can be characterized as growing and stable. Her rich experience working in this sphere has added a lot to this positive standing. 

We believe Mohira's decisiveness and ultimate focus on success will motivate her to repay the current loan of $2200 US on time. The loan will be very beneficial for the further expansion she has planned to implement, including opening a new vending stand.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fish at wholesale

loans.name: Massa

texts.fr: massa est une femme qui exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce en détail de produits génériques. il s'approvisionne au Ghana voisin et au grand marché de Lomé. elle a une expérience de 7 ans dans son activité. elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. elle sollicite de WAGES un second crédit pour l'achat de 10 cartons de produits génériques au Ghana et 5 cartons de produits génériques au Togo. elle est mariée et mère de  enfants.
texts.en: Massa is a woman who makes her living selling miscellaneous products. She sources her goods in neighbouring Ghana and from the large market in Lomé. She has worked in this field for seven years and has already received a loan from WAGES which she successfully repaid. She is seeking a second loan in order to purchase 10 boxes of miscellaneous goods from Ghana and five boxes from Togo. She is married with children.

loans.use: purchase of miscellaneous goods

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “CORAZON DE JESUS DE CCATCCAPAMPA ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sebastiana;   la socia tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, la socia se dedica  a la artesanía, ella compra lana de alpaca o de oveja y después de hacer un muy buen pulido y convertirlo en madejas de lana ella teje a mano con la tradicional técnica que heredaron de nuestros antepasados los inkas, la socia entonces elabora frazadas, mantas, chalinas, correas, medias, chompas, ponchos y mucho más a mano. Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar lana y comprar tintes vegetales para teñir las lanas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de lanas y tintes vegetales para la artesanía (telares).

La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Sebastiana is a member of the Communal Bank “Corazon de Jesus de Ccatccapampa”, which is located in the District of Ocongate in Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 38 years old, married, and has three children. Sebastiana earns her living from making handicrafts. She buys alpaca and sheep’s wool and gives it a good cleaning. Afterwards, she turns it into spools of thread for making hand woven articles. Sebastiana uses traditional techniques that were passed down from her Incan ancestors. She produces blankets, covers, scarves, belts, socks, sweaters, ponchos, and other handmade items. Sebastiana is requesting a loan to buy wool and vegetable dyes for coloring the wool used in her weaving.

She appreciates and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase wool & vegetable dyes

loans.name: Betzaida Rosaly

texts.es:
la señora Betzaida Rosaly C. B. es soltera y tiene 2 hijos, vive en la ciudad de Nacaome, Betzaida tiene una tienda donde vende ropa nueva, carteras, perfumes, ropa para niño, zapatos, vestidos, entre otros articulos.
su negocio tiene 8 años, mismo tiempo que tiene de vivir en dicho lugar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir a cabalidad su negocio. desea que para la epoca de navidad tener su negocio bien surtido ya que esta es la epoca en la cual hay mayores ventas de ropa.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su hijos.
texts.en:
Betzaida Rosaly C. B. is single and has 2 children, she lives in the city of Nacaome. Betzaida has a shop where she sells new clothes, bags, perfumes, clothes for children, shoes, dresses, and other items.
Her business is 8 years old, the same time that she has been living in this place.
The loan will be used to buy goods to fully stock her business. She wants to have her business fully stocked for the Christmas period as this is the time when there are the greatest clothes sales.
The profits will be used to help her children get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase shirts, T shirts, blouses, bags, underwear, hats, trousers, jeans, dresses.

loans.name: Nancy  Wanjiku

texts.en:
Nancy Wanjiru, aged 34, runs a school in Githurai 44 Estate. The school classes are from classes 1 to 4.  She is married to Joseph Mburu and together they have two children, Annie aged 12 years and M. aged nine months. Nancy’s husband Joseph is currently not employed or in business, so Nancy is the sole bread winner in their home. She was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Thika Road office.

She has been running this business for a period of three years and her monthly profit is Kshs 17,000.
