This is her first loan with KADET,  She plans to use the Kshs 20,000 to buy more chairs and tables for the students, since the numbers will increase after the January intake. If this loan boosts the business, Nancy plans to save and buy a piece of land and build a school, since where she has set up the school now is rented and hence costly.

Nancy dreams that she will be able to educate her children to high levels, and empower them to be self-reliant and sustain themselves in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs and tables.

loans.name: Marcelino José

texts.es:
Este es el segundo credikiva que hace Marcelino, él quedó muy satisfecho con el resultado de su primera inversión a través de este programa, porque logró tenr un nuevo capital, reinvertir y obtener una rentabilidad del 40%, un margen de contribuciónde un 60% y la rotación de su inventarios es en la actualidad de 28 dias; aunque en la actualidad tien un capital de trabajo de $4.000.000 COP. debe prepararse para la temporada decembrina que vien con muchos requerimientos por parte de sus clientes, pues quieren proveerse de arroz, aceite, granos, enlatados y embutidos para hacer la comida de estas  hermosas fiestas famliares. Yesto es lo que justamente comprará con su nuevo credikiva.
Si quiere leer su historia ingrese al siguiente enlace:

http://kiva.org/lend/188483
texts.en:
This is the second Kiva loan that Marcelino has requested. He was very satisfied with the results of his first investment through this program as he was able to have new capital, reinvest and obtain 40% profitability, a contribution margin of 60%, and the rotation of his inventory is currently at 28 days. Although at present he has a working capital of $4.000.000 COP, he must prepare himself for December as it comes with many requirements from his customers who want to provision themselves with rice, oil, grains, canned goods, and sausages to cook meals for these great family holidays. This is precisely what he will buy with his new Kiva loan.

If you would like to read his history, visit the following link: 
http://kiva.org/lend/188483

loans.use: To buy wholesale provisions

loans.name: Marcolfa Emperatriz

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz y Progreso.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Marcolfa, tiene 41 años de edad,  está casada  y tiene tres hijos de  23,  17 y 15 años que  estudian en Universidad y  en colegio. Su esposo es peluquero. Está  en el Banco Comunal hace tres años,  es la presidenta del mismo y esto lo ha tomado con mucha responsabilidad, le gusta porque estos créditos la han ayudado mucho así como a sus compañeras del grupo.

Tiene una pequeña fábrica donde elabora conos de galleta para helados, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, sus hijos le ayudan en esta labor, una vez que estos deliciosos conos están listos los entregan en su local a vendedores de helados y heladerías de la localidad, nos cuenta que esta labor la aprendió de su mama desde muy joven y que ya lleva en este negocio por más de 15 años y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar materiales e ingredientes para elaborar los conos. Sus sueños son tener una gran empresa y terminar su casa que la tiene en construcción.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the real tamarinds, the members of the Banco Comunal Luz y Progreso meet every 5 days.

This is where we met Marcolfo, 41 years old, married with three children aged 23,17 and 15 that study in the University and high school. Her husband is a barber. She has been in the Banco Communal for more than three years, is the president of the same and this has given her a lot of responsibility. She enjoys it because the loans have really helped her as much as her companions in the group.

She has a small workshop where she makes ice cream cones. She works Monday to Saturday from 8:00 until 17:00. Her children help her work. When the delicious cones are ready, they deliver them in their neighborhood to local ice cream shops. She tells us that she learned this from her mother since a young age and has worked in this business for more than 15 years. It has served her well.

This loan is to purchase materials and ingredients to make cones. Her dreams are to have a big business and finish the house that she has in construction.

loans.use: To purchase flour, eggs, sugar, water, etc...

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
La señora Janeth vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Las Lomas, de la ciudad de La Paz, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos menores de edad, la señora es profesora de primaria y su esposo es carpintero en aluminio, con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen, Es la primera ves que solicita un crédito.

El crédito que solicita será utilizado para la compra de material de construcción para efectuar arreglos en las habitaciones donde vive en la casa de sus padres.

Por el estudio social y económico, la señora califica para solicitar un crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs Janeth lives in her parents' home in the Las Lomas zone, in the city of La Paz. She is married and has four young children. She is an elementary school teacher and her husband is a carpenter who works with aluminium. Their incomes sustain them. This is the first time that she has requested a loan.

She will use this requested loan for the purchase of construction materials to make repairs to the rooms where they live in her parents' home.

The social and economic survey qualifies her to receive a loan.

loans.use: the purchase of construction materials for making repairs to one of the rooms in her parents' home.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris has been practicing mixed farming for the last seven years and sells her milk, beans and maize to the local market.

She has requested for a loan of 31,200Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children. Her biggest challenge has been competition, which has led to low prices of milk.

Doris is 38 years old and married with 5 school-aged children who all attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie R. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 30 years old. Ronie is married and has 2 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Ronie sells seafood products, including fish such as sardines and milk fish, in the local community.  He has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Ronie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. That loan was used to purchase additional inventory & use as working capital for his business. 

Ronie is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell, like salmon and mackerel. This loan will be his 3rd loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his  business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Muhabbathon's Group

texts.en:
Muhabbathon H. is the leader of this group. She is 38 and married to a tractor driver. Together they are bringing up two sons and two daughters. All the children are students, except the youngest daughter; she is only one year old. In order to earn money Muhabbathon and her husband breed livestock. They have been doing it for 25 years. Reselling livestock animals at the higher price they earn 10,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, the family wants to purchase five more animals for breeding. In the future Muhabbathon wants to see her first son get wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi S. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years-old and married with four adult children. To make a living, Levi owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income  comes from planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Levi has been engaged in her business for over one years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Levi joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Levi is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia, de 47 años, siempre a trabajado muy duro por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Pedro de 42 años, quien trabaja como albañil y sus 3 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

En la comunidad de Yurinaki (Comunidad del Distrito de Pichanaki), se encuentra el negocio de Teodosia, su puesto esta ubicado en la plaza de la comunidad, en donde vende gallinas, patos y gansos, los cuales están bien alimentados y cuidados, es por eso que tiene muchos clientes y sus ingresos económicos son buenos. 

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es alimentar a sus aves, ya que los cría con mucho cariño, lleva 6 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil, es tener que permanecer en su puesto todo el día en espera de clientes. Para el futuro, planea alquilar una tienda donde pueda brindar a sus clientes una mejor comodidad a la hora de atenderlos.

Este es el octavo préstamo de Teodosia con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable.

Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más alimento para sus aves, ya que tienen que estar grandes y sanos.
texts.en:
Teodosia is 47 years old and has always worked hard to excel in life. She lives in a house that she owns with her husband Pedro, who is 42 and works as a builder, and their three children, who are the reason for all of her efforts.

Teodosia’s stand is located in the community of Yurinaki (located in the District of Pichanaki). Her place of business is located in the community plaza, where she sells chickens, ducks and geese that are all well fed and cared for. This is why she has many customers and her income is good.

What she likes most about her work is feeding the birds, as she raises them with a lot of care. She has been in this business for six years and she considers the most difficult part to be having to stay at her stand all day waiting for customers. In the future, she plans to rent a store where she can provide her customers with more comfort when attending to them.

This is Teodosia’s eighth loan with MFP and she knows that she has to make her payments on time, which she is prepared to do. She is a very happy and responsible member of her communal bank.

With the 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) requested, she will purchase more feed for her birds, as they need to be big and healthy.

loans.use: to buy more feed for her birds, as they need to be big and healthy.

loans.name: Sambacouda Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de SAMBACOUNDA est composé de 27 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village que porte le nom dudit Banc Villageois. Le Banc Villageois est créé en décembre 2008 , mois de son inauguration. L'activité principale des femmes est le petit commerce, et en hivernage elles pratiquent l'agriculture avec les cultures vivrières. 

Madame BAMBY K. (tout à fait à droite de la photo, et un peu en retrait vers l'avant) est présidente du Banc Villageois. Elle est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle envisage fiancer son activité de petit commerce d'huile de palme et de pâte d'arachide.

Elle va acheter de l'huile de palme et des arachide qu'elle va transformer en pâte qu'elle vend dans le village et les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité.

Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille, assurer la santé et l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Le Banc Villageois of SAMBACOUNDA is composed of 27 women who all come from the village of Sambacounda.  Le Banc Villageois was created in December of 2008, the month of its inauguration.  These women mainly run small businesses and in the winter work to grow food.  
Madame Bamby K. (all the way to the left in the photo, and somewhat behind the one in front of her) is the president of the Banc Villageois.  She is 44 years old. She is married and the mother of 4 children. 
With her new loan, she plans to finance her small business to buy palm oil and peanut paste.
She is going to buy the palm oil and the peanuts, that she will turn into paste and sell, in the village and at the weekly markets in her area.  
Her goal is to contribute to improving her family’s living conditions and to ensure the health and education of her children.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and peanuts

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with two children, both of whom are grown-ups. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity and clothing. 

She has operated a clothing business for the past 18 years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Mary faces a major challenge of competition from other clothes sellers in the market. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings she is requesting, she wants to purchase three bales of clothes and pay for transport costs. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bales of clothes and pay for transport.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
En el departamento del Cusco conocido desde hace muchos años como la "Capital Arqueológica de América", se reúnen cada treinta días las socias del Banco Comunal “Todos Unidos” en la oficinas central de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú.

En este banco comunal conocimos a la señora Rosa Elena y nos cuenta que nació en la ciudad de Arequipa, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos. 

Rosa Elena desde el año 2000 que se dedica a vender adornos y auto partes para automóviles, ella tiene un puesto de venta que está alquilado en el centro comercial “Auto Partes San Pedro” de la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad Rosa Elena requiere el préstamo para comprar mercedaria como por ejemplo adornos, radios, bocinas, llantas, gatas y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Every thirty days, the members of the "Todos Unidos" (Everyone United) community bank meet in Asociación Arariwa's central office, in the city of Cusco, in Cusco department, Peru.  For many years, this area has been known as the "Archaeological Capital of America".

Here we meet Rosa Elena, a member of the bank, who tells us that she was born in the city of Arequipa, is 54 years old, married, and has three children.

Since the year 2000, Rosa Elena has been selling decorative accessories and spare parts for cars.  She has a sales location which she rents in the "Auto Partes San Pedro" shopping center, in the city of Cusco.  On this occasion, Rosa Elena needs a loan to buy merchandise such as, for example, decorative accessories, radios, horns, tires, jacks, etc.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as decorative accessories, radios, horns, tires, jacks, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera de una pequeña niña de 10 años. Ella vive con su familia en una pequeña comunidad rural ubicada en la provincia San Miguel en Cajamarca. Aurora es una mujer emprendedora que desea darle lo mejor a su hija.

Aurora se dedica a la venta de comida y bebida a pensionistas, desde hace más de 5 años. Esta actividad la desarrolla en su propio domicilio y cuenta con clientes  fijos que se encuentran satisfechos con el servicio que ella les brinda.

Aurora desea ampliar su negocio para tener mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida. Para ello solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles que utilizará para comprar mesas y sillas y así poder crecer en su actividad.

Una de las metas de Aurora es darle una mejor educación a su hija y con el crecimiento de su negocio siente que lo logrará.

Aurora canceló puntualmente el crédito que con anterioridad nuestra entidad le brindó.
texts.en:
Aurora tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera de una pequeña niña de 10 años. Ella vive con su familia en una pequeña comunidad rural ubicada en la provincia San Miguel en Cajamarca. Aurora es una mujer emprendedora que desea darle lo mejor a su hija.

Aurora se dedica a la venta de comida y bebida a pensionistas, desde hace más de 5 años. Esta actividad la desarrolla en su propio domicilio y cuenta con clientes  fijos que se encuentran satisfechos con el servicio que ella les brinda.

Aurora desea ampliar su negocio para tener mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida. Para ello solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles que utilizará para comprar mesas y sillas y así poder crecer en su actividad.

Una de las metas de Aurora es darle una mejor educación a su hija y con el crecimiento de su negocio siente que lo logrará.

Aurora canceló puntualmente el crédito que con anterioridad nuestra entidad le brindó.

loans.use: Comprar mesas y sillas para negocio.

loans.name: Kotognogontala 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 7 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37ans, 4enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à FACHORIBOUGOU, un des villages de la commune de KABOILA dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : la tomate et le jakatou avec  AMINATA 1ère gauche position debout.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Kotognogontala 7 Group are married women, on average 37 years old, with four children, who mostly live in polygamist families in Fachoribougou, a village in the district of Kaboila in the Sikasso prefecture, the third administrative region of Mali.  They are working with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to better manage their agricultural business during the winter season.  They are on their eighth loan with the institution; all prior loans have been fully repaid.  

Aminata, the first woman on the left of the photo, in the front row, primarily grows tomatoes and jakatou- a type of small green eggplant.  With this loan, she intends to pay labor wages, purchase agricultural inputs and seeds to tend a 1 hectare plot.  After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in the market of Sikasso, to a clientele of men and women.  She intends to earn an average profit of 65,500 FCFA per year.  This profit will allow her to payback her loan and also to help her husband with household expenses.  She hopes to maintain this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso in order to work an even larger plot in order to draw more profits.

loans.use: to pay wages and to purchase seeds and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Malikahan's Group

texts.en:
Malikahan, 56, is the leader of this group. She has been a self-starter since early childhood. In this way she found the talent of sewing in herself. An unending interest in fabric and new ways of design pushed her to pursue a profession as a seamstress and a fashion designer. 

Since all of her kids are already grown and live separately, Malikahan says she can devote herself fully to the business. The entrepreneur designs bedding for traditional Kyrgyz families.  They include quilts called “kurpa”, “tushak” and pillows of different sizes and designs. She graduated from a technical college and knows how education is important in the development of a person. The business started with an initial capital of 500 soms and now brings 1,300 soms monthly. Malikahan applied for a loan because she needs to purchase materials for sewing national souvenirs. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Washington

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA GENERACION III”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio; el socio tiene 63 años de edad, el socio es casado, y tiene 1 hijo; el socio trabaja junto a su esposa en la atención de su restaurante, el socio se dedica  a la atención de las mesas mientras la esposa prepara las comiditas del día, ósea los menús respectivos, el socio sirve los refrescos y cobra, el hijo también los ayuda en cuanto a la cobranza y a la cocina, ellos también cuentan con un lavaplatos. El socio desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de insumos e ingredientes como arroz, papas, aceite al por mayor para el restaurante.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the 'Nueva Generación III' community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

The borrower is 63 years old, married, and has one child.  He works alongside his wife, serving in their restaurant.  He waits tables while his wife prepares the meals.  The borrower serves drinks and collects payment.  Their son also helps on the till and in the kitchen.  In addition, they have a person who washes dishes.  The borrower would like to invest his loan in buying supplies and ingredients such as rice, potatoes and oil wholesale for his restaurant.

The borrower is grateful for the loan and pledges to make his repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying ingredients for his business

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es: Jacqueline tiene 40 años, es natural de Sicaya  y en la actualidad vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos en la casa que heredó de sus padres. A lo largo de su vida aprendió todas las técnicas agrícolas y ganaderas,  hoy en día  siembra maíz, papa y alfalfa, productos que vende cada mes, del mismo modo cría ovejas que también son vendidos para tener ingresos importante para el bienestar de su familia. Manifiesta que le agrada su trabajo porque siempre tiene productos disponibles para vender así como para su propio consumo. Tiene deseos de adquirir más terrenos y aumentar su producción agrícola así como el de tener más animales ovinos. Supo de MFP por medio de su vecina que la invito a formar parte del banco comunal a la que integra, es relativamente nueva en su grupo porque esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito, de las cuales ha sabido ganarse la confianza de los demás socios con la puntualidad en sus pagos. En esta ocasión el crédito que solicita, comprará sacos de abono orgánico para sembrar alfalfa y maíz.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 40 years old and a native of Sicaya. She currently lives with her husband and their two children in the house that she inherited from her parents. Throughout her life, she learned the techniques of agriculture and raising cattle. Today, she plants corn, potatoes and alfalfa, all products that she sells each month. She also raises sheep and sells them to earn income that is important for the well-being of her family.

Jacqueline says that she is pleased with her work because she always has products available to sell or for her own consumption. She hopes to acquire more land and to increase her agricultural production as well as to have more sheep

Jacqueline learned about Microfinanzas Prisma through her neighbor, who invited her to become part of the communal bank she joined. Jacqueline is relatively new to her group because this is only the second time she has requested a loan, but she has already earned the confidence of her fellow group members due to her punctual repayments. This time, she will use her loan to buy sacks of organic fertilizer for planting alfalfa and corn.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a charcoal vendor. She is unmarried and has two children, ages 15 and 18.  She has been engaged in this business for a period of six years. With this loan, she plans to buy more charcoal to offer for sale.

From the anticipated profits, she plans to open a stall within the town and expand the business. In future, she desires to provide her children with a good education and also to buy a plot of land and build for her family.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man with six children: three attend school while three are underage. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years he has operated a water distribution business, distributing using his handcarts to his neighbours. He faces the major challenges of high transportation costs and seasonality in his business. Charles dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES he wants to purchase a handcart for his water distribution business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a handcart for water distribution business

loans.name: Bakyala Kwekulakunya Group

texts.en:
50 year old Sarah's enterprising disposition is what has put her business in a favorable position. She plys her business in Lugazi.
It's been 30 years of unremitting purposefulness and diligence.
The light hearted widowed mother of 7 set forth in her business with start-up capital courtesy of her farming business.
She has not dispensed with her farming business.  With earnings from the retail business, she says she is able to reinvest in her farming business.
Sarah says her retail shop generates sales income of 200,000 Uganda shillings per month.
She intends to use her loan to purchase more retail commodities like sugar, rice, maize flour, beans, etc to resell

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities like sugar, rice, maize flour, beans, etc to resell

loans.name: Marteris

texts.en:
Marteris is married with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marteris is 42 years old and has 1 child who is in school.

Marteris has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marteris has requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Marteris has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Marteris would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Helen has been in this business for six years. Helen earns more income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her businesses.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Olmaskhan's Group

texts.en:
Olmaskhan, 42, is the leader of this group.  For twenty years she has been running a dairy business, distributing milk and homemade milk products to regular buyers.  It took much effort and trying several different types of businesses before she focused on milk production. 

For a long period of time, Olmaskhan was a farmer, gathering crops each fall.  She later switched to retail, selling food products in a local market.  After that, she bought cattle and made the first attempts at milk retail. The business was started with the small amount of 5,000 soms.  She now makes twice that amount each month.  Olmaskhan has two young kids and, not long ago, gave birth to a third child. The toddler needs care and good conditions. Olmaskhan hopes to receive her portion of the loan, which she will spend on the purchase of a baby carriage. 

 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan.  Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a baby carriage.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”QOLQUEWASI”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Agustina; La socia tiene 51 años de edad, la socia es soltera, la socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes la socia desea implementar su tienda de abarrotes y comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite por bidones entre otros productos; la socia invertirá su crédito para comprar estos productos y también panetones, la socia también acomodo un espacio en su tienda en la misma puerta y tiene pasto fresco para la venta, ella también cría animales menores como cuyes; la socia con lo que ingresa de dinero ella invierte en las mejoras de su vivienda. La socia solicita  el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad, en la compra de panetones y otros. 
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Señora Agustina belongs to the communal bank "QOLQUEWASI" located in the district of Huanchac and the province and department of Cusco.  

She is 51 years old, single and owns a grocery store.  She wants to stock her grocery store and buy rice, sugar, noodles, large containers of oil, etc.  She will use the loan to invest in these products as well as panetones [Christmas cakes].  She also made a space in her store where she has fresh grass for sale.  She also raises small animals such as guinea pigs.  She invests the money she earns in improvements for her home.  She is requesting a loan to buy basic necessity products, panetones, etc.  

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, noodles and oil as well as panetones.

loans.name: Bertha Isabel

texts.es:
Bertha Isabel tiene 44 años de edad vive en casada tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.
Bertha se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el cantón Ventanas. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

Con el dinero  del prestamo anterior pudo comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

En la familia la relación ha mejorado porque ahora puede aportar un poco más para el bienestar de la familia, en el trabajo le va mucho mejor porque a aumentado la producción en los ingresos a mejorado mucho porque ahora con la venta de los productos obtiene más ingresos. Con el apoyo de anterior crédito le ha ayudado a superarse y no tuvo ningún problema para poder cancelar las cuotas establecidas por la cooperativa. 
El sueño es poder agrandar la cantidad de trabajo y en el futuro comprar una maquinaria desgranadora de maíz. 
"Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada".
texts.en:
Bertha Isabel is 44 years old, married, and has three children. She lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. The V.R.C. Dulce Sentimiento (Sweet Feeling) is located in Recinto Caimito II, Puerto Pechiche parrish, Pueblo Viejo Canton. This area is dedicated to agricultural work and short-cycle corn, rice, and pigeon peas. 

Bertha does agricultural work planting corn, rice, and pigeon peas. She makes her purchases and sales in the Ventanas Canton. She asked for a loan to buy seeds and agricultural products like urea, herbicide, fertilizer, and weed-killer to keep her crops in good condition. With the money from the last loan she was able to buy seeds and agricultural products like urea, herbicide, fertilizer, and weed-killer to keep her crops in good condition. 

Within the family, relationships have improved because now she can contribute a bit more for the good of the family. Work is going much better because she has increased production and the income has increased a lot because now she gets more money from the sale of her products. The support of the last loan has helped her to succeed, and she had no problem repaying the loan according to the schedule set by the bank.  

Her dream is to be able to increase the amount of work and in the future buy a corn-sheller machine. 

"She is very thankful for the help she’s been given."

loans.use: to buy seed and agricultural products like urea, herbicide, fertilizer, and weed-killer

loans.name: Bellarina

texts.en:
Bellarina is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Bellarina has a shop, where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Bellarina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Bellarina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Jehova Jireh 3 Group

texts.en:
Ydelsa is the coordinator of Jehova Jireh 3. This group is made up of five business people -- micro-entrepreneurs -- and is located in the rural area of Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. 

Ydelsa lives with her long-term partner and her two children. She says that her biggest challenge is to build her house as a safe structure made of concrete blocks, and her most favorite things to do are learn and visit her friends and family. She runs a jewelry sales business, selling jewelry door to door and by walking around her community. With this loan, she will purchase silver jewelry, like rings, necklaces, bracelets, and other silver accessories. 

She is excited to receive her fourth loan with Esperanza. She has been part of this group for almost two years, and with each loan she has been able to improve her sales and has earned more clients. With the profits from her business, she will reinvest in her business and put more income into her house. Ydelsa thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Alba Nelly

texts.es: La señora Alba Nelly a sus 54 años de edad es madre de dos hijos, se dedica a la actividad de las confecciones hace alrededor de 30 años. El taller de la señora Alba Nelly esta ubicado en su casa, en este, la señora Alba Nelly confecciona sudaderas, pijamas y otras prendas de vestir. Los clientes de la señora Alba Nelly son sus familiares, amigos y vecinos. La señora Alba Nelly desea comprar insumos para la elaboración de sus prendas tales como telas, hilos y resortes. Con lo anterior la señora Alba Nelly podrá mejorar sus ingresos y así brindar a su familia una mayor calidad de vida. El sueño de la señora Alba Nelly es tener en su negocio rentabilidad y generar empleos directos.
texts.en: Mrs. Alba Nelly is 54 years old and the mother of two children.  For approximately 30 years she has been a seamstress and works out of her home making sweatshirts, pijamas and others clothing.  Alba Nelly's customers are her relatives, friends and neighbors.  She wants to buy sewing supplies such as fabric, thread and closures.  This will allow her to improve her income and give her family a better quality of life.  Alba Nelly's dream is to have a profitable business and generate direct employment.

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen lives in Changamwe area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has nine children, five of whom are in school. He owns a dry fish business and has been in operation for one year. It’s a business he began in order to get money to support his family. 

Stephen is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase more dry fish for sale. His main challenges are the lack of capital to purchase more stock. The extra income from this loan will help him educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase more dry fish for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el mismo corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas, en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia;  La socia tiene 52 años de edad, La socia es casada, la socia tiene 4 hijos la socia tiene un lavadero de autos y ella se dedica  al administración de sus negocio junto con su familia, la socia también tiene como actividad principal la agricultura, la socia desea comprar abono para sus cultivos, la socia quiere que se fumigue sus cultivos para que no le entre la plaga y malogre estos. La socia desea invertir en la compra de abono y fumigar sus cultivos.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI." The community bank is located in the very heart of the sacred valley of the Incas, in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

The member is 52 years old, she is married and has four children. She has a carwash and she runs it along with her family. She also has, as her main activity, agriculture. She wishes to buy fertilizer for her crops, and she wants her crops to be fumigated to protect against pests and spoiling.

The member wishes to invest in buying fertilizer and fumigating her crops. The member is grateful for the loan and commits herself to making payments in accordance with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying fertilizer and fumigating her crops.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el tiene un carro que hace servicio de transporte,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es tener un carro nuevo.El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos y llantas para su carro.
 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working in the transport business. He has a car that he uses in the transport service. The member works from 8:00AM until 7:00PM. Through this business he is supporting his children.

The dream of the member is to have a new car.

The member is asking for a loan in order to buy spare parts and tires for his car.

The member is happy for the loan and he promises to make his payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tires for his car

loans.name: Hường's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hường is 59 years old and she is married.
 
She has operated a food stall selling vegetables in the market for 5 years.
Hường lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. Hường's circumstances is the most difficult in this group. Her husband has passed away since 10 years ago, when her 3 children were very young. Her family is living in a small house in village. Her main income is from her vegetable stall in the market.
The main hardship that Hường faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetable to resell.
This is Hường first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Hường hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetable to resell

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en:
Madame A. Yawa, born December 31st, 1976 in Gapé is married and the mother of three children. A seamstress by training, she has her own workshop with apprentices. Her first loan of $200 allowed her to buy a sewing machine to improve the quality of her work. Abandoned by her husband, she is alone in providing for her children. She has gained a good reputation in her neighborhood through dynamism and dedication to her work.

Current customer demand requires Yawa to renovate her sewing workshop and to buy new equipment. Therefore she is seeking a new loan of $950 which will allow her to buy two additional sewing machines and materials to make clothing. Completing this project will allow her to increase her income, which she will put toward improving the living conditions of her children.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Yawa, née le 31 Décembre 1976 à Gapé est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Couturière de formation, elle a son propre atelier avec des apprentis. Son premier crédit de $200 lui a permis de s’acheter une machine à coudre pour améliorer la qualité de ses prestations. Abandonnée par son mari, elle subvient toute seule aux besoins de ses enfants. Son dynamisme et son dévouement au travail fait sa réputation dans son quartier.

Les exigences de la clientèle obligent Yawa à réaménager aujourd’hui son atelier de couture et à acheter de nouveaux matériels. Aussi, sollicite-t-elle un nouveau crédit de $950 qui va lui servir à acheter deux machines et des matériels pour la confection des vêtements. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus qui vont servie à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de ses enfants.

loans.use: Purchase of two sewing machines and materials

loans.name: Ana Eduvigues

texts.en:
My name is Ana A. and I sell breakfasts, lunches and snacks such as tacos, tortillas with cheese, bread with beans, Honduran tacos, burritos, and enchiladas. I have had my business for 4 years and I have a good clientel because I am located near a bus station. My goal is to expand my stock because as of now I cannot meet the needs of my customers, and also to have higher sales and with the earnings I make I will remodel my store, buy tables and seats, but most importantly, feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Ana A. me dedico a la venta de desayunos, almuerzos y golosinas como ser tacos, tortillas con quesillo, pan con frijoles, baleadas, burritas, enchiladas. tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que mi negocio esta ubicado cerca de una estacion de buses, mi meta es incrementar mis inventarios porque no cubro con las necesidades de todos mis clientes, asi mismo tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio, comprar mas mesas y sillas y lo mas importante alimentar a mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase tortillas, cheese, butter, beans, bread, chicken and pork, tomatoe sauce, vegetables, sodas

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch M. is 35 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and child.  Touch M. works as a farmer, raising animals and planting vegetables.  Her husband works as a carpenter and earns about $4/day.  This loan will be used to purchase carpenter's tools and some feed for their animals.  In the future, Touch M. would like to buy a small car so that she can transport a variety of vegetables to the market.  She would also like to repair her house so that it doesn't leak during the rainy season.

loans.use: to purchase carpenter's tools and some animal feed

loans.name: Ilkhomjon

texts.en:
Ilkhomjon is a teacher. He works at the secondary school in a place called Khonobod. Besides this, Ilkhomjon knows a lot about cattle and has a business buying and selling them. Ilkhomjon buys a cow at the market and after a week, he resells it for a better price. Thus he makes a profit. Ilkhomjon has also opened a small grocery shop near his house; his wife works there.

Ilkhomjon has been a client of MicroInvest for 9 months and has received 2 loans during this period. He affirms that every loan he has received from MicroInvest has allowed him to make a good profit. At the moment Ilkhomjon is hoping to recieve a third loan for the further expansion of his business.

loans.use: further expansion of his livestock business

loans.name: Custódio Maurício

texts.pt:
Custódio Maurício D. S. lives in Mahotas in Maputo. He is married and father of 3 children. He sells charcoal from his home to support his family. He joined the FDM program in March of this year and requested a loan of 5.000MT which he repaid on time. He is now in the 2nd cycle of the program, he is requesting a loan of 10.000MT to be repaid in 5 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Custódio Maurício D. S. vive no bairro Mahotas em Maputo.É casado e pai de 3 filhos.Tem um negócio de venda de carvão em sacos na sua residência em Maputo.Entrou para o programa em Março do presente ano com um empréstimo inicial de 5.000MT. Está no 2º ciclo e vai tomar 10.000MT para pagar em 5 meses. Comportou-se bem no 1º ciclo e houve um amento no volume de negócios do cliente.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia is a woman who is always in a good mood to work. She sows and harvests potatoes, corn and also she breeds guinea pigs. She dedicates more time to the latter activity as a consequence of a fall that brought her some complications to her health that prevents her from doing heavy work. Celia has five children who are her adoration; nevertheless the big sums of money that she invests in the higher education of her elder children, has caused a high deficit in order to cover the needs of the rest of her family. That's why she is requesting a loan that will help her improve her crops and increase the harvest of corn in order to obtain a bigger income for the sake of her children. You can help this family to keep living so happy and united like until now.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Celia, es una mujer que trabaja muy alegremente; se dedica a sembrar y cosechar papa, maíz y a la crianza de cuyes. Le dedica el mayor tiempo posible a esta última actividad a consecuencia de una caída que le trajo algunas complicaciones a su actual estado de salud que la imposibilita a realizar trabajos muy fuertes. Celia tiene cinco hijos los cuales son su adoración; sin embargo las costosas sumas de dinero que invierte en la educación superior de sus hijos mayores, le ha ocasionado un alto déficit para la plena satisfacción de las necesidades del resto de su familia. Es por eso que solicita un préstamo que le ayude a mejorar sus cosechas e incrementar sus siembras de maíz para obtener mayores ingresos en beneficio de sus hijos. Tú puedes hacer que esta familia siga viviendo tan feliz y unida como hasta ahora.

loans.use: Increase amount of products and crops.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Yawa is 35 and takes care of three children. After having been in an accident, her husband is unable to work. Yawa takes care of her family alone with the income she earns from her small neighborhood resturant, which she has been running for over five years. She would like to enlarge her restaurant in order to welcome more customers, whose numbers are steadily growing. She would also like to diversify her menu.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Yawa est agée de 35 ans , avec 3 enfants en charge. Son mari est inapte suite à un accident. Seule Yawa s'occupe de la famille par le revenu d'un petit restaurant de quartier qu'elle gère depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle veut agrandir le cadre de son restaurant afin d'augmenter la capacité d'accueil de ses clients qui deviennent de plus en plus nombreux. Elle veut également diversifier son menu

loans.use: Improve her restaurant and diversify her menu

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mr. N. Sorn, age 36, has been married since 1972 and has three children, two sons and one daughter. One of his sons is married and lives in a separate house and the other two children are working in a garment factory in Phnom Penh. He currently works as a house constructer. He began his construction business in 1985. His wife, Mrs. Kong Yun is a housewife and grows vegetable around her house. 

Sorn is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time, for $800. He will use this money to purchase a motorbike for his children traveling to work in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for traveling to work

loans.name: Carlos Armando

texts.es:
I feel that my house is very unprotected, so I would like to give my family more security by constructing a protective wall in front of my home. I work as a delivery person, which means I am not home all day, so this wall will make me feel more at ease. I am requesting $800.00 USD to build a protective wall in front of my home.
 Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.
“Siento muy desprotegida mi vivienda así es que me gustaría darle más protección y seguridad a mi familia con la construcción de una barda al frente, trabajo como repartidor y no estoy en casa en todo el día de esa manera estaré más tranquilo”. Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para construir una barda en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Construction of a protective wall in front of my home

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru:
Bahodur Padjabolievich J. lives in teh Shahrinav region in Tajikistan. He is 30 years old, married and has 6 children. He has a High School education and works as a farmer. He has a piece of land on which he grows potatoes. He sells most of the crop on the market and keeps a small portion of it to provide for his family. The profit from this business allows him to provide for his family as well as to purchase seeds and fertilizer for next year. He plans to use the obtained loan to purchase high quality seeds and fertilizer. He plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Джумаев Баходур Раджаболиевич проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 30 лет, женат. Имеет 6 детей. Имеет среднее образование.Занимается земледелием. Имеет дехканское хозяйство. Засеивает землю картофелем. Получаемый урожай использует для своей семьи и большую часть продает на рынке. Это дает доход для его семьи, часть которой он использует на жизнь , а остальную часть для посева в новом сезоне. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы закупить качественные семена и удобрения. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Saodat A. lives in the Shahrinav regions of Tajikistan. She is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. She has a close and supportive family. Saodat manages her own business - she sells groceries in her own store. She brings the goods from Dushanbe, capital of Tajikistan, and sells them in her home town. Saodat sells her goods with very little mark-up and as a result she has many customers. Currently Saodat wants to expand her inventory so that she can keep up with the local demand for various grocery products. To reach her goal she has planned to take out a loan. Saodat is going to pay back the loan in the next 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Абдуллоева Саодат проживает в районе Шахринау. Ей 40 лет.У Саодат большая и дружная семья. Она замужем и у нее 4 детей. У Саодат есть свое дело . Она занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин , где продает продукты питания. Привозит товар из города Душанбе и продает в своем районе. Ставит совсем небольшой процент на привозимый товар. Поэтому у нее много клиентов. Сейчас Саодат хочет увеличить товарооборот , для того , чтобы увеличить ассортимент , который сможет удовлетворить спрос населения на продукты питания. Для этого она запланировала получить кредит, который поможет ей достичь поставленных целей. А погасить кредит Саодат планирует в течение 9 месяцев

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Egharevba

texts.en: Egharevba E. trades in wood. He has been in this business for the past 8 years. He is 46 years old and is married with two children. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He is a LAPO client and needs a loan $600 to buy more timber for sale.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Patient Group

texts.en: Abdul T., 30 years old, operates a cosmetics-selling business. A previous loan enabled him to expand his business and increase his income, and he now owns a stall in the market of Magburaka town.  Abdul has been working with Mohemed, and both are in the same savings club; their plan is to expand their businesses and establish a shop.  They are therefore requesting a loan of $725 to achieve their goal.

loans.use: To increase inventory and generate more income.

loans.name: María Cruz

texts.es:
María started the business as she always liked trade. She had the desire to open a kiosk because she lives in a very populated neighborhood where there are a lot of children. Besides, this would allow her to help her husband with expenses because he was retired and needed another income to pay both household expenses and for their children’s education. She began approximately eight years ago by selling candy, pork rinds, fritters, tostadas and soft drinks. Later her earnings increased and little by little she began offering certain grocery items. Today she has a little bit of everything and even has video games and a soccer game that attracts children to the store and they are the ones that buy every day.

She needs a loan for US$200, which she plans to repay in four months, to offer more groceries. With your help, María will continue to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria inició el negocio ya que siempre le gusto el comercio y tuvo la inquietud de poner un estanquillo por que vive en una colonia muy poblada donde hay muchos niños además esto le permitiría ayudar con los gastos a su esposo por que era pensionado y necesitaba otro ingreso extra para solventar los gastos, tanto de la casa como de los estudios de sus hijos. comenzó hace aproximadamente 8 años en la cual vendía solo dulces, chicharrones, frituras, tostadas y refrescos después fue incrementando las ganancias y poco a poco fue surtiendo algo de abarrotes hoy en día ya tiene un poco de todo y además tienen juegos de video y un futbolito el cual le genera que los niños vayan a su negocio y son los que le consumen diariamente

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $200 que pagara en 4 meses para surtir mas abarrotes. Con tu ayuda Maria seguirá prosperando.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell in a general store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mrs. Elizabeth is 22 years old, she completed high school, is married, and mother of a little boy. She lives in the Caritamaya section of Marquiri, Acora disctrict, Puno. She belong to the New Horizons Communal Bank. She works in purchase and sales of sheep in the Acora Fair on Saturdays, and in the Llave Fair on Sundays, which she invested her first loans in.

With this loan of $125, which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of colored wool to weave little animals such as: turtles, monkeys, small birds, etc., since they generate about $25 per week, allowing her to increase her art production. She is very happy, because in the Communal Bank, the women are working and as such are learning to be responsible and punctual for life. Her income is much better than before and she no longer lacks money to cover everyday costs. Her vision for the future is to export her artisan goods to other countries and for her son to graduate from college.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elizabeth tiene 22 años de edad, su nivel de instrucción es secundaria completa, es conviviente, madre de un hijito y es domiciliada en el Centro Poblado de Caritamaya sector Marquiri, del distrito de Acora, provincia y región Puno. Pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevo Horizonte. Ella Actualmente se dedica a la actividad económica de compra y venta de ganado ovino en la feria de Acora los día sábados y en Ilave los dìas domingos, ya que los primeros préstamos invirtió en ello. Con este crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que pagará en cuatro meses, invertirá en la compra de lana de colores para tejer animalitos como: tortuguitas,, monitos, pavitos, etc, ya que le genera semanalmente S/.50.00 nuevos soles, ello facilitará incrementar más su producción de la artesanía. Ella esta muy feliz, ya que en el Banco Comunal las mujeres están trabajando y además están aprendiendo ser responsables y puntuales para la vida. Su ingreso es mucho mejor que antes, ya que no le falta el dinero en el bolsillo y así asegura cubrir sus gastos económicos. Su visión futura es Exportar a otros países productos artesanales y su hijo sea profesional.

loans.use: Purchase of wool in bulk.

loans.name: Magali

texts.es:
La señora Magali, socia del BC “Las Margaritas II”, vive en la Región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo. Se dedica a la venta de anticuchos de carne, de pollo y asados al carbón. Desarrolla el negocio en las afueras de su domicilio, situado en el Jr. San Martin C- 3, del mismo distrito donde vive, lugar donde diariamente acuden su comensales, que son moradores de la propia localidad o transeúntes de lugares cercanos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará los insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como arroz, azúcar, carnes de res, pollo, y cerdo, también en kilos comprará cecina, chorizo, lo que le permitirá variar los platos que ofertará a sus clientes y atender la petición de sus clientes.
 
Magali es una mujer entusiasta de 28 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo a quien quiere darle un futuro mejor. Su meta es comprar un terreno para construir una casa, porque por ahora vive en la casa de sus padres, también poner un negocio en su propio domicilio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Magali, member of the Communal Bank "Las Margaritas II", lives in the region and province of San Martin, district of La Banda de Shilcayo. She sells meat and chicken kebabs, as well barbecue. The business is located outside her home, located in Jr. San Martin C-3, of the same district. A location that is visited daily by her clientele, people from her own neighborhood or from nearby locations. With this loan for $350, that she'll repay in 4 months, she'll purchase the ingredients for her food preparation business such as rice, sugar, meat, chicken, and pork. She'll also buy cured meat and chorizo buy the kilo which will allow her to vary the plate offerings and satisfy customer requests. Magali is an enthusiastic 28 year old. She lives with her husband and a son that she would like to provide with a better future. Her goal is to buy a piece of land to build a house because they live in her parents house now. She would also like to continue her business in her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Liz West, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, meat, chicken, and pork for her food preparation business.

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Om

texts.en: Om Y., 45, is a widow who lives in the Phnom Penh with five children. She makes about US$3 daily by selling groceries, while two of her children make US$5.50 as a technician and garment factory worker. Om Y. is asking for a loan in the amount of US$800 to purchase more grocery inventory to expand her current shop. She is also hoping to purchase a pig to raise and sell with the money from the loan. She sees this loan as a great opportunity to expand her business and is confident that she will see her income increase as a result.

loans.use: Grocery stuff and raise pigs.

loans.name: Lanh Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Lành năm nay 35 tuổi. Năm 1998 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương  và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Ngoài chăn nuôi chị còn làm thêm nghề chài lưới vì thế thu nhập của chị luôn đạt mức 2.500.000đ/ tháng.Trước khi chưa tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị rất nghèo đến nay qua 10 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị  đã sắm sữa được thêm tiện nghi trong gia đình và mua được xe máy  phục vụ đi lại kinh tế ngày càng ổn định hơn.nVòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ  để đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại và chăn nuôi.n
texts.en:
Mrs. Lanh Thi N. is a 35 year old woman. In 1998, she joined the TYM fund and borrowed money to invest in livestock. Besides, she also did fishing. Therefore, the family’s income level reached 2,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. Before joining the TYM fund, her family was very poor. Since 1998, her family’s financial situation has been improved. She was able to afford more living facilities and bought a motorcycle, now used as the family’s main transportation mean. She plans to make the next loan of 12,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to renovate the farm.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovate the farm

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza, married and with two children, learned by herself how to become a good entrepreneur simply by risking her money for a sari-sari store business (a community based variety store).  She chose to engage in this kind of business so she can still have time to keep their house clean, cook for her children and do the other household chores while there is no customer.  Her store is usually open from 6:30 in the morning to 8:00 in the evening.  She usually earns a weekly income of Php1, 0000.00. 
	
She is borrowing Php5,000 as additional working capital because she wants to buy more products like soft drinks, canned goods (meat loaf, corn beef, sardines), cooking oil, sugar, coffee and milk which are very in demand in their community.  She knows that with a variety of products to sell her income will increase and she can then support the education of their children.  At the moment, her eldest is already in college,

	According to her, clean way of living, hard work in doing whatever endeavor will result to prosperity.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is a member of the Sumaqcha Village Bank.  “Sumaqcha” means “Beautiful” in Quechua.  Vanessa is 23 years old and lives with her partner and their three children. 

Vanessa sells hardware-type items like padlocks, scissors, and shoe polish.  She sells her ware on foot in different local markets, and sometimes travels to regional markets too.  She works seven days a week.  

Vanessa needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy sparklers for Christmas.  Vanessa dreams of owning her own store, of building a home, and of providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Vanessa Es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaqcha que significa Hermoso en quechua.
Vanessa es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 3 hijos, Vanessa vende mercería como candados, betún, tijeras, entre otros productos, actividad que realiza todos los días de manera ambulatoria en diferentes mercados de la ciudad y algunas veces viaja a las ferias.
Venessa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de luces de bengala para la navidad.
Vanessa sueña con tener una tienda, construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy sparklers for Christmas

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo S. is 26 years old, and is a good housewife, cooking delicious meals for her family and taking good care of her children. She is married with three children; all of them are single and still live in the family home. Her husband, Choun Sokha, is 31, and makes a living selling ice directly to his clients' homes. He normally gets up in the early morning to buy ice from a factory and then sell it retail. To make transportation of the ice easier, Mrs. S. would like to ask for a $1000 loan for her husband to purchase a trailer-motorcycle to transport the ice for sale. The family lives in Kompong Tom Province.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer-motorcycle to transport ice for sale.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: LA SRA. RITA QUE CUENTA CON 43 AÑOS VIVE EN SU PROPIA CASA JUNTO A SU ESPOSO DE 49 AÑOS DE EDAD Y SUS TRES HIJOS DE 16, 14 Y 10 AÑOS DE EDAD RESPECTIVAMENTE, UBICADA EN LA ZONA SUROESTE DE LA LOCALIDAD, MAS CONCRETAMENTE EN EL BARRIO SAN ANTONIO, EN SU DOMICILIO SU ESPOSO TIENE SU PEQUEÑA GRANJA ARTESANAL DE DONDE LE PROVEE POLLOS A SU ESPOSA CUANDO LOS TIENE. DOÑA RITA TIENE SU PUESTO DE VENTA DE POLLOS EN LA ZONA DEL MERCADO CENTRAL DE ESTA CIUDAD, PARTE EXTERNA. LLEVA BASTANTE TIEMPO EN EL NEGOCIO Y EN MUY BUENA UBICACION PLENA ESQUINA, POR LO CUAL CLIENTES NO LE FALTAN. LA COMPETENCIA ES MEDIANA PORQUE HAY OTRAS PERSONAS CON LA MISMA ACTIVIDAD. PERO EN SU LUGAR, NO HAY MAS QUE UNA, POR LO CUAL TIENE MUCHA CLIENTELA Y POR ENDE SALIDA DE SU PRODUCTO. DICE LA SRA. RITA QUE INVERTIO TODO EL CREDITO, BS. 3,500,-  EN EL DESTINO PREVISTO, COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION Y LE FALTO UN POCO MAS. ESTE SERIA EL SEXTO PRESTAMO DE LA SRA. RITA Y TODOS LOS ANTERIORES LOS A CANCELADO EXCELENTEMENTE. SU ESPOSO TIENE UN PEQUEÑO CREDITO VIGENTE Y PUNTUAL EN BANCA COMUNAL (AGROCAPITAL).
texts.en:
Rita is 43 years old and lives in her own home along with her 49-year-old husband and her three children, who are 16, 14, and 10 respectively. The home is located southeast of town, specifically in the San Antonio neighborhood. At their home her husband has a small poultry farm and supplies Rita´s business. Doña Rita has a stand where she sells chickens outside the city´s central market. She has had this business for a long time and has a good location on a corner and always has customers. There is competition from others who have the same activity, but in her location there is only one other merchant and she always has a lot of customers. Rita will invest all her loan to buy construction materials. This will be her sixth loan and Rita has repaid all her previous loans on time. Her husband currently has a small loan and is also on time with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials.

loans.name: Them

texts.en: Them S., 64, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are rice farmers and typically make about US $2 every day. This couple also gets support from two of their children who are construction workers. Mrs. Them S. would like to take out a loan of US $400 to raise pigs for extra profit.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia sells medicine and she has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan amount of N140, 000 to purchase additional supplies of medicine to sell. She is 47 years old and married with one child. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies of medicine to sell

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis S. is an enterprising woman with a big desire to improve the quality of life of her family. She is married and the mother of three children. Because of difficult living conditions and the lack of a job her husband had to leave for Russia for employment.

Nargis has been a seamstress since she was very young, learning in her mother's office. She was able to open her own shop at her home 20 years ago and has been successful because her customers have recognized the high quality of her products. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. Today Nargis is applying for a loan from IMON International for the second time. She is requesting a loan of US $1050 for the term of 10 months to purchase spring fabrics for sewing the national dress. You can help improve the quality of life of Nargis’s family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spring fabrics

loans.name: I Wayan Buda

texts.en:
I Wayan Buda is a 66 year-old man living in the town of Ds. Tuwed, Melaya.  He is married and has 9 adult children.  To make a living, I Wayan Buda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  I Wayan Buda has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 500,000 - 600,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2007, I Wayan Buda joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 IDR from DINARI.  This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  I Wayan Buda is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  The loan will be the 3rd loan he has taken out from DINARI.  I Wayan Buda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.


About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


I Wayan Buda - (DNR.M-0645) merupakan 66 tahun pria.  Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Ds. Tuwed, Melaya.  Dia (laki-laki) menikah dan memiliki 9 anak usia dewasa.  Untuk membiayai hidup, I Wayan Buda memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membudidayakan tanaman.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menanam & memanen buah & sayuran untuk dijual.  I Wayan Buda sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 7 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, I Wayan Buda menghasilkan sekitar 500,000 - 600,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2007, I Wayan Buda bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  I Wayan Buda meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli pasokan & peralatan pertanian/peternakan umum.  Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli benih, bibit, & tanaman muda tambahan untuk dipelihara.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  I Wayan Buda berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Ets Ecomin Group

texts.fr: ETS ECOMIN est une pharmacie détenue par un groupe de personnes. Ils résidents tous à Wome, un village situé à environ 130 kilomères de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. leur ambition est de répondre aux besoins pharmaceutiques de la population et des villages environnants. Avec ce crédit ils pensent approvisionner leur magasin afin de satisfaire aux exigences de la clientèle. Ce crédit leur permettra d’augmenter leurs recettes et par conséquent améliorer leurs conditions de vie respectives.
texts.en:
ETS ECOMIN is a pharmacy run by a group of people. They all reside in Wome, a village situated 130 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Their ambition is to respond to the pharmaceutical needs of the population and of surrounding villages.
